Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: EvickaBusuttil
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for our final 2 nights of our honeymoon in Malaysia and enjoyed every second. Only a 20 minute ride from the airport and the free shuttle to Orchard Road and Clarke Quay was fantastic. Walking distance to Chinatown. Eugene at reception was great in giving us a lovely room on the 15th floor when we checked in at around 11am and a late check out due to an early morning flight despite the hotel running at full occupancy. Rooms are large, very clean and amazingly comfortable. Complimentary computers with internet access and printer at the business centre. A litle tip to the concierge would be to give more accurate information regarding the city attractions and distance but apart from that, would not find a fault. Will highly recommend to all type of guess - be it business or leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Holiday Inn Atrium twice, on both occassions to attend the Singapore Grand Prix. The hotel is not as central as some but taxi's are very cheap and easy to come by. The staff are helpful and friendly, the hotel is clean and well maintained, if a little old and if you get a good deal on the price, can be good value, especially when the GP is on. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mikewhillis
Reviews.Content: At first I was disappointed to find the hotel was not centrally located , however on our first day we walked to the centre along the riverwalk. It took around twenty minutes but was enjoyable and took us to Clark Quay. The room was small and good probably do with a refurbishment. It also had a musty smell. However the next day it had been "treated" and was fine. The breakfast was a typical buffet style but perfectly acceptable. There were nearby restaurants on the riverside and in a mall about 5 mins walk down the road. The big disappointment was the nearby Hawker Centre was closed for refurbishment. (Clearly not the hotels fault). Also the free shuttle service was useful. Free WiFi access was available in the lobby. Overall a good stay and I would have no hesitation in using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fearmór
Reviews.Content: the is a very central hotel and is walking distance to Clarke Quay. The hotel has a couple of good restaurants and the rooms are great. The use of the spa / pool area on check out day is a handy feature if you need to kill a couple of hours befoe ra flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chinamom_7
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights with my 2 children, ages 7 and 13. It is the nicest Holiday Inn we Have ever stayed. Big grand lobby, helpful bell hops and concierge and a glass elevator up the middle of the atrium. The room was spacious with 2 queen beds and all the usual room items (small fridge, hot water pot, iron, hair dryer ect.). Good cleaning and helpful professional staff all the way around. The breakfast buffet was very nice with a wide variety of Asian, western and European selections. Lunch buffet I was not as impressed (We'd just arrived and too tired to go out) and had the Easter dinner buffet which was fab. Again, staff were helpful, prompt and professional. There is a lovely small outside pool. Great after a hot sweaty day sightseeing to cool off. It was plenty big for the kids to romp and play getting some energy out. There are lounge chairs for mom. There are a variety of resturants near by, and you can get most places in a reasonable time by taxi. There is a mall a few blocks away, short walk, with a food court and a Kenny Rogers resturant. You don't go to Singapore for fast food, but sometimes with kids you do what is easy! We did the double decker hop on hop off tour bus. It was a lot of fun, cooler temp on the top, a/c inside, and great way to see the whole city. It was interesting for the kids too. Over all we had a very nice stay and would recommend to anyone. It was about 20 minutes from the airport and cost about 30 Singapore Dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheetalchawla22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Holiday Inn Atrium for four nights in February. It was really a great experience with Holiday Inn. The staff was so cooperative.Rooms were very spacious. Housekeeping employees were really great, as they kept our room very clean. Concierge employees helped us a lot to explore the city with comforts. The location of hotel is really amazing as we found many nearby places to roam around.Wi Fi facility in the lobby area was good.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and rooms are okay”
Reviews.Author: ramlovi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before leaving to Malaysia. Rooms are spacious and clean. The staffs were very friendly. The location was really good, as we could take a bus or taxi easily from the hotel. Didn't have any meals at the restaurant, so can't comment on that. Overall, we had a good stay. The only thing that we were not happy about this hotel - there were some hair in the bath tub and floor - which means the housekeeping staff haven't done a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Finally holiday in singapore instead of work”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: Staff all very friendly. We like walking so it was a case of walking across road and you are in Roberston Quay and pedestrianised all the way to Boat Quay. Taxis reasonable so if you don't want to walk they are readily available. MRT a bit away but plenty of buses within 200m. Raffles 40 mins walk, Chinatown 20 mins walk, Boat Quay 30 mins walk. The buffet breakfast had a good variety but bacon always crispy. We will certainly use again

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: qantas_traveller
Reviews.Content: Two night stay booked through Qantas website. Prepaid including breakfast and late check out at 6PM. Check in was effortless. From the reception to the room was five minutes. The room was spacious. I was on eighth floor and had an excellent view. The bed was comfortable and the television had all the channels you could ask for. One thing that I am always impressed with at any hotel is instant hot water. This hotel has it. No waiting, hot water was immediate. The bathrooms look a slightly dated, but still very functional and appropriate by contemporary standards. Noise was not a problem at this hotel. I purchased dinner at the Melting Pot Cafe on level four. Meals are reasonably priced if you choose a la carte. Otherwise, you may pay $42 for a buffet dinner. I ate a la carte first night and buffet the second. Can recommend both. The variety is excellent and filling. Things that are a negative about this stay, I cannot think of any. Taxi rides to most attractions in Singapore are reasonably and really not more than $16 SGD. When in Singapore again, I will stay here once more.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Amy M
Reviews.Content: Our welcome at this hotel was exceptional. The staff were warm and friendly from the moment the porter took our bags, through to the reception staff and the concierge. The location is great, right off orchard rd. The hotel staff stored our bags for the day and we were able to use the pool area and showers until our departure at 6.30pm. The rooms were clean and had everything you would need.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: MartineUK
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a stopover in Singapore, the staff in the hotel are excellent and very helpful. Late check-out was not a problem. Nice lobby with free internet in business centre, nice pool on 6th floor, shuttle bus service to Orchard Road and Clarke Quay. In walking distance from the river. One little thing: the rooms could do with an update, they are a little tired. But it would not stop me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcus9000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2011 and found it to be excellent. It is a 5-10 minute walk from the metro, but it is a pleasant walk and this is Singapore so it is very safe. The hotel also has a shopping mall adjoining it and there are plenty of bargains to be had. My room was excellent and I also recommend the swimming pool, which is on one of the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore stop over”
Reviews.Author: M N
Reviews.Content: Quick and cheap trip by taxi, quick check in, quiet room, good local access to city and local eateries, good breakfast, good value. Cant moan about much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cartref
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception staff welcomed us on arrival. The porters were very efficient with our very heavy baggage. The room was very big with an extremely large comfortable bed. The room was very clean with the offer of a daily linen change if we wanted it. We were even given new tooth brushes daily. We were on the 7th floor which was very secure as the room card had to be inserted into a slot on the lift to get above level 4. There is an outdoor pool and gymnasium on the 6th floor. The restaurant on the 4th floor provided a very good buffet selection both at breakfast and in the evenings, which was topped up with fresh supplies at regular intervals. Although wi-fi is chargeable in the rooms there is free wi-fi in the main reception area and outside the entrance. The hotel also has two business centres with free internet and printers. The concierge staff were always very pleasant and helpful. It was nice to be greeted by name each time I entered the hotel. The hotel provides hourly transport into the centre by coach which also serves other hotels. However, there are always taxis waiting at the entrance which are very reasonable. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Have always a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrea8521
Reviews.Content: Very warm and polite welcome, helpful concierge with perfect knowledge, the prices in the hotel are not cheapest at all but it´s Singapore :) I had western food, wasn´t the best choice at all but who likes chinese cuisine will be more than happy to enjoy their buffet in Chinese restaurant. Go outsite enjoy the pool, gym has a good facilities with the view at the pool, massage has no mistake at all. Rooms are cosy, flat tv-screen, queen size bed, hairdryer, bathrobe, etc.. everything you need for your stay

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay at such an aged property...”
Reviews.Author: Dutchtraveller007
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for a wedding reception and i have to say that at first thinking of Holiday Inn i was not sure what to expect, knowing it is an aged property. Upon arrival the staff have been expremely polite and helpfull and that was a big change from China where i normally travel. The Concierge and Reception were warm and even the room attendents were very polite and helpfull. The location is not perfect if u look for a subway connection but everything in Singapore is basically in walking distance. Taxies are easy to get and the free Shuttle Bus service makes up for most of the connection issue's. Shopping is not far and for a good night out, the "World famous ZOUK Club" is just around the corner..!!! So no complaints to be honest. The Lobby Bar had the most friendly staff i have experienced in a long time and the restaurant staff even walked all the way from the 4th floor to bring us coffee in the early hour which was really great!!! Overall a great experience and worth to stay on a budget pricing and if you don't mind a more basic stay...

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: WallyPerth_WA
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome at check in, and helpful arranging access to our room as we arrived at 6am very tired. Our room was a decent size and layout with a view over the road at the front of the hotel. There was good live music at the bar in the evening, drinks expensive as usual in hotels. There was a guest laundry on our floor, well outfitted and easy to use. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Although away from the main shopping areas we found that getting around by taxi was reasonable as there were 4 of us to share costs. Public buses were easy to use for getting to Orchard road. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great variety of breakfast, vintage, internet trouble”
Reviews.Author: applecart3355
Reviews.Content: The title pretty much sums it all. You're not going to be disappointed by the breakfast. The room, albeit dated, is cozy and clean. The hotel gives vintage vibe, as it has been in the business for more than 50 (!) years, and the interior and structure are still preserved. I had a bit of internet trouble though, for the internet is paid, and cannot be shared by more than 4 devices. Connecting the 2, 3, and 4 device was tricky and I had to call the internet helpdesk. I do think that paying for internet is so last decade, Holiday Inn could actually reallocate their pillow budget (they offer you 4 types of pillow to be chosen, why one would need that many options, I'll never know) for hassle-free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there before and will probably will come back”
Reviews.Author: YuriKAct
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel with very attractive interiors situated not far from the Singapore river. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Every use of glass lifts makes it an interesting journey. We liked the hotel's Xin Cuisine restaurant, which is not cheap but provides very nice dining experience (some of their soups are aphrodisiac). However, Melting Pot cafe, where we had our breakfasts, was a disappointment for the quality of food. And it's rather expensive. A smart guest would better go outside and have a breakfast on the street (5 min walk) or take a taxi to Vivo city and visit Food Republic and they will pay less than in Melting Pot for better food. The hotel is a bit far from tourists' attractions. However, taxi to the most destinations won't cost more than 10 bucks. There is a bus stop just across the street, or it's only ten minutes walk to the nearest MRT station. There is a laundromat in hotel with coins available at reception. Overall, Holiday Inn Atrium was a pleasant stay and we will probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a nice hotel, but could be much better”
Reviews.Author: Alex C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 10 days, finding quite a good deal for the accommodation, but without breakfast included. The hotel is located at the junctions of Zion and Outram roads, which makes it be quite far from any of the Outram Park or Tiong Bahru metro station. Though, you can still walk to and from this station if the weather is fine...it will take about 10 minutes. Due to it's location, I found much easier to use the buses for getting around the city. Buses are working superbly, were never crowded and they are many enough not to have long waiting times. There are a bunch of bus station around this hotel. Bus can also be used to get you to the bus station. From a cheap transfer from and to airport, you can take the mrt to Outram Park station (East-West Line) and there you can find a taxi station. Taxi to hotel will charge you under 5 SGD due to the short distance. This hotel looks impressive, especially in the lobby, which is wide, with wonderful flower and with 6 exterior elevators. Also, the outside looks nice, with a fountain just in front of the hotel. Because of the large number or elevators, you should not experience any waiting time when you will want to get up or down. Unfortunately, the room is not as good as expected. Though having a decent size, the room had quite old furniture and a humid smell. Beside that, the LCD tv had nice movie channels. The bathroom, having a bath tub, is also not that great as one could expect. Hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful, with smile on their face all the time. The pool is just average and is covered by sun only after midday. The gym is small, but decent. Internet is very expensive in rooms, but is offered for free(wi-fi) in the lobby and in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay experience for a family of 3”
Reviews.Author: Animetal
Reviews.Content: Spent the New Year and Singapore with family and stayed at the Holiday Inn Atrium for 3 nights. We generally enjoyed our stay with the expected amenities and service of an ICH managed hotel which is always on the positive side. We never encountered any issues with the room service and hotel staff. We booked for a non-smoking double bed room which was clean and spacious. Bathroom is area is also good, complete with toiletries, clean and fluffy towels and robes. It's ok to drink from tap - this is Singapore after all but they still provide bottled water and some fruits as compliments from the hotel. I also liked that they included an iPhone/iPod dock in the room so that's one less charger to bring for the next trip in this hotel. Buffet breakfast selection is good, but can get tiring if you are staying for an extended amount of time. But this is expected for any hotel in the world. In-room dining staff are very courteous, and the food selection is great although a bit on the pricey side. We weren't able to try out the hotel amenities as we were usually outside most of the time to enjoy the New Year atmosphere of Singapore. But we really like this hotel and the atrium is something to marvel at the first time you arrive. The only problem I see in this hotel is that it's not in the pedestrian part of Singapore. It is possible to walk going towards Orchard road but if you have kids with you, better take a cab. Fortunately, they are a plenty in this city. The nearest SMRT station is Outram Park, but you still need a cab ride to go to the hotel (around 1.5km). The hotel provides a shuttle service from the hotel going to Orchard Road though but just getting a cab is faster. I wouldn't have any second thoughts in staying again here if another family trip comes up in the future.

Reviews.Title: “How much for wi-fi?”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: Hotels should offer wi-fi free of charge, this one charges a massive $25 a day. How do they justify that? The hotel is good enough but the location is very inconvenient and necessitates taxi rides to everywhere. Standards inside the hotel are good, the lobby is lovely but we were disappointed with it's location. As with most Holiday Inn's breakfast is expensive but it is a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, some remarks”
Reviews.Author: jk3972
Reviews.Content: Watch out when you book directly through the hotel. Taxes abd service charge is not included in rates they give you. Furthermore, you have to pay for Internet access. Both wifi and cabled cost S$ 25 a day. If you have 3G it' cheaper to buy a prepaid starhub card, which gives you Internet access throughout Singapore. Costs S$ 15. Service on the other hand is good and the hotel has nice views over the city. Breakfast is very nice too, and reasonably priced if you book a room with breakfast included. Checkout bookings.com for good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: TonyBur
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before so I knew what to expect and was pleased once again. The staff is very nice and helpful. The hotel is well maintained. I was given a rather small room even though I am a Priority Club Gold member. I know the rooms are larger having stayed there before. I was surprised that a Gold member was not given at least a typical room. The hotel is not in the center of Singapore in the Orchard Road area but that is a positive for me. It is a short taxi ride, or a bus ride which stops outside the hotel. The area is less crowded. There is a mall near by with a food court and cinema. It is near the walk way along the river which is very nice. The internet connection fee is outrageous! There is free WiFi in the lobby. Lower the price to a reasonable amount please. The breakfast is also expensive. It is a typical hotel which rips you off once you check in. I enjoy the hotel in spite of the rip off and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel But Taxis Essential”
Reviews.Author: Romablade
Reviews.Content: The first impression of this hotel is the lobby area and stunning high atrium that gives it it's name. We arrived on an early flight and so checked-in at around 4.30am. However, there were no rooms available so we had to hand around until breakfast was servers at 6. At 9.30am someone came to fetch us and show us to the first rooms that had become available. The rooms were of a reasonable size. The bed was very comfortable and the air con effective, although it was difficult to get a balance and it was either very cold or off. Breakfast was simple but tasty with plenty on offer (including Chinese and Indian food as well as traditional Western fare such as bacon and eggs etc. The pool is of a reasonable size and the gym is quiet small but neither were often busy so this really didn't matter. The only downside to this hotel is its location. It doesn't look far from the harbour area (business/financial centre), Clarke's Quay (eating) or Orchard Road (shopping) but the heat and busy roads mean no one walks in Singapore. So taxis were always necessary for every journey. That said, the average fare was 8-12 S$ or about £4-6 so won't break the bank (less than a London Underground ticket). What I like about Holiday Inn is that you know what to expect and this one didn't disappoint. Nothing special, but perfectly comfortable and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice middle range hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nured
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, not too expensive in a good place in Singapore. I was travelling with my wife, we wanted to stay in some skyscraper. It was a good decision to stay there - good view to the city, nice and clean room, great pool. But too expensive wi-fi internet - about $16 in a day. And breakfast isn't included in a room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, bad attitude of employees and poor location”
Reviews.Author: Fiona F
Reviews.Content: During my stay in Holiday Inn for 1-month training, I cannot say how disappointed I was to this hotel. The staff are slow in service and they are not thinking from perspective of clients. I wonder how these staff are getting trained. The location is very far away from city center and no train or restaurant or shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but a bit boring”
Reviews.Author: City_of_Seoul
Reviews.Content: There are 2 holiday Inn in Singapore. One is Atrium and the other is Orchard. I stayed in Holiday Inn Atrium for 3night during my second Singapore biz. trip. It was designated hotel by our company, so there was no option to choose another one. As a biz trip. the hotel is ok. but if you are a traveller or travelling with your family I wouldn't recommand this hotel. The outlook of the hotel doesn't look that old but overall atmosphere of the hotel looks a bit old fashioned (Bed, Bathroom, Carpet, Lobby). Breakfast buffer was not bad and room kept alway clean. You can use internet (wifi) but it costs some money. Service level in the front was so so. Although Singapore is a quite small country and you can go anywhere with a short ride of taxi or MRT, this hotel is a bit away from City centre or any tourist attractions. There is nothing to have fun nearby hotel - Only one night club across the street for the local. I tried to walk to the nearest MRT station and it took about 20minutes on foot. So, if you want to move around then just take a taxi. The location was the most disappointed factor for me.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Home Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Foxysardar
Reviews.Content: I believe this is hotel is an interesting choice as the location is quite decent and rooms are fairly spacioud .I have stayed here 3 times now and I am priority club member.Checking and Checkout are fairly quick and they allowed me to check in at around 11:30 AM as i am priority Gold member. I will use this hotel again though i don't like there food very much :( I will give them 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay = )”
Reviews.Author: sdanos
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Service Excellent cleanliness Will surely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Looks much better than it is, but nice and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Snaro
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights from January 21 to January 23! Positives: -Rooms, although "dated", are nice, comfortable and clean. Great place to come back to after a tiring day of sight-seeing. -Even the cheapest rooms come with amenities such as ironing boards, hair dryers, hot water and a small bathtub. Couples on a budget might want to take note of this. -Architecture is beautiful, especially on the inside. Everything's circular and the lifts are fascinating. Very futuristic and yet not cold. I loved staying in the lobby and just staring up at the ceiling, or watching the lifts move! -Very friendly staff -Free shuttle to go to an MRT station or to Orchard road -There were dancers for Chinese New Year and everyone got chocolate coins. Fun! -All cab drivers seem to know where it is Cons: -No shuttle to and from the airport -Not located close to any train station. The closest is Otram Park which is still a good 15-20 minutes away if you walk, and it's easy to get lost -No free internet in your room. This is probably the biggest con for me since I regularly check my e-mail for work. There's a business center in the lobby but there are only two computers. You have to pay to connect to their wireless internet from your room, which costs a whopping 25 dollars per day. This is 2012; the fact that they still charge for that service is blasphemy, especially for such an expensive hotel! -Their hotel room key cards are faulty and lose their properties easily. After two nights, my key card was no longer working, which I found out the hard way when I tried to use the elevator to go up. I had to get it changed.

Reviews.Title: “Another happy visit to HI Atrium”
Reviews.Author: LyCx
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay at the Holiday Inn Atrium in Singapore (we also stayed in August last year and I wrote a more detailed review then on this site). Following my second stay I just wanted to re-confirm my previous view that this is a great place to stay and a good base for a visit to Singapore. For us the real attraction of the place is the friendly and helpful staff. Despite it being about 6 months since our last stay various members of staff remembered us and were again incredibly welcoming and friendly. This makes it feel like a home from home rather than somewhere you are just staying for the night which is not something you get in a lot of hotels of a similar size in my experience. In addition the housekeeping staff cannot be more helpful and, from our experience, any request was responded to promptly. We would definitely stay here again should we return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bmanwest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room at the Holiday Inn Atrium on Expedia as part of a cruise vacation originating from Singapore. We also stayed at the hotel at the conclusion of our cruise. The Holiday Inn was cheaper and more accommodating than the other hotels we were considering with three of us, two adults and one child, staying in one room. Service was outstanding from start to finish. We reserved a room with a king sized bed and were not charged for a rollaway bed for our son. Hotel staff were exceptionally polite, prompt, and courteous. Our room was fully stocked with amenities such as coffee maker, blow dryer, mini-bar, slippers, even toothbrushes and toothpaste. The bed was very comfortable and the room was so quiet that sleep came very easily. Our room had a high definition flat screen television, closet-safe, complimentary bottled water, and a very nice view of the city. I’ve stayed at a lot of Holiday Inns and I have to say this was probably the nicest one yet. We ordered room service twice and received our meals in about fifteen minutes. The food was very good but fairly expensive. On the other hand we found that food prices were more expensive all over the city, not just in the hotel. The 6th floor of the hotel has a lovely pool deck and fitness room. The pool was clean and refreshing. The terrace is decorated with palms, bougainvillea, and tropical plants and there are lounge chairs and umbrellas as well as a children’s wading pool. Adjoining the hotel is shopping center where you can get a cheap massage or pedicure, buy beer and snacks, and pick up last minute souvenirs. There are no wi-fi hotspots in the hotel, but they do offer free internet access on two computers in the business center next to the reception desk as well as complimentary newspapers. In the morning they also set out free juice and pastry in the lobby in case you feel like skipping the $30 breakfast buffet. The hotel is short walking distance to the Singapore River and Clarke Quay, but you can also easily take a taxi from the hotel. Fare to the airport is about twenty five Sing dollars and to Chinatown about ten Sing dollars. We discovered that it is very hard to catch a taxi from Little India, or between the hours of nine and eleven at night. It’s a good idea to figure out where you are going to catch a return cab back to the hotel before you go out at night or you may find yourself walking many blocks until you can flag one down. The Holiday Inn has a very good buffet but it is pretty expensive. If you can get a deal where it is included with your room you’ll come out ahead. If not, there are many good restaurants on the Singapore River . For the most part the Holiday Inn Atrium is an excellent hotel providing quality lodging and first rate service. We saw a few minor areas where maintenance was needed, but nothing negative enough to give us a bad impression. For the rates we paid it was a very nice hotel and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't change a thing!”
Reviews.Author: Steph055
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after spending 11 days in Singapore with 7 close friends and we all enjoyed every minute! We are a well-travelled group but all agreed that for what we paid at the Holiday Inn Atrium, it couldn't be beaten. The staff were superb and looked after us beautifully planning and booking all outings and tours. Meals in-house were excellent and favourite drinks and snacks were remembered and served to us in their lovely, relaxing Lobby Bar - so no waiting! Taxis were always available and very cheap from there to everywhere we wanted to go, plus we used the free shuttle bus to Clark Quay and to Sun Tec City a few times. The breakfast in the Melting Pot was all we could have asked and often made lunch unnecessary! We have stayed at the Holiday Inn Atrium quite a few times before and would definitely go back there when next in gorgeous Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if u know what to expect in SG hotels at that price”
Reviews.Author: Niraj_C
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family during christmas. Recd good care and attn from Elizabeth and her team at the 'Melting pot'. They cooked Indian paratha and subzi as requested and we just liked tht. Dont expect Indian style Chinese and tea during breakfast buffet there. Good concierge. 70's style hotel though well maintained. Good checkin and room booking process carried out by Peachy Lim.

Reviews.Title: “Good..... but can be better”
Reviews.Author: nangia_nikhil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty old in the construction and I would say in the service as well. I along with my wife stayed here on our honeymoon and unlikely other good chain hotels we were not given any special treatment except a welcome letter (at least a small cake or flowers should have been given). Having given a request for a room at higher floor 3 months before arrival I had to again persuade the front office staff for the same as they already blocked the higher rooms for other guests. However, they did it.... The Housekeeping service is very impressive and fast but they should also keep extra items like nail cutters with them I would say, a good hotel at its price point bit compared to other IHG properties an average...

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Docrheena
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over Christmas but I have to say the spirit of Christmas was rather sombre. Rooms were good and so was service BUT the food was horrendous! it was hardly tasty, not even the local delights . Felt like we were being served by chefs still in chef school! Definitely need to improve on the food!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BuriedBones
Reviews.Content: In terms of cost - it's hard to beat this hotel in this part of Singapore. The check-in staff are efficient and polite, the facilities are acceptable in every way (internet connections not brilliant, but they work just fine). Breakfast at Melting Pot is pretty varied and you will definitely find something that you like. Only negative I can add is that the rooms I have stayed in look like they need a bit of a face lift or something to lighten them up a little.

Reviews.Title: “Average and value for money”
Reviews.Author: KingTT
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Zouk Club. Free usage of internet & computer centre. Halal indian muslim restaurant opposite the hotel. Free shuttle service to city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Gman558
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 5-6 times for business/leisure over the last 3-4 years and it is a good balance of quality, price and location. I find the staff VERY helpful and I would single out Gobby on the front desk team as being excellent. The rooms are typical Holiday Inn (in my view a positive because you know what you get) but there are great views on the upper floors. We stayed over New Year and used the Executive floor and lounge facilities. Staff in lounge are helpful and this is good value option plus GREAT VIEWS from the 27th floor. The hotel even opened the Exec lounge at midnight on 31st Dec and offered drinks and food with a wonderful view of the fireworks at Marina Bay. Despite initially not looking to be a good location, this hotel is only 5-10min walk by the river to Robertson Quay and 15min walk from Clarke Quay. Both locations have excellent bars and restaurants and there is no fight to get a taxi on the way home. In addition the bus connections to Orchard Rd and Clarke Quay are excellent. Hotel concierge desk are helpful and will direct you to walk to Clarke Quay or show you where to get buses from.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Elsa3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Singapore at 1am. We didn't want to pay full price at a luxury hotel for a couple of hours of sleep. We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 1 night. The rooms were clean but very dated. Our room looked like something from the 1980's. We were surprised to arrive in our room to find three single beds, since this is not what we reserved. When we asked the front desk for a different room we were told there was nothing else available. This hotel is ok for a transit stay but I would select another hotel if I were staying more than 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Krishna_Sathya
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel I would love to stay at each time I arrive in Singapore..the breakfast is extremely good with a large variety of stuff to choose from..the hotel staff are very polite and recommend places around to get good dinner..the location is very good with a bus stand right next to the hotel to reach the Singapore MRT...overall a great stay..be back soon..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy one night stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: grant_SK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on March 11th 2011. It is very nice hotel, early check in, nice and mordern building, nice street view from the room because of high floor, very easy to access both commerical and residential area. In my opinion, this hotel is suitable for all the travelers.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilyZhou
Reviews.Content: I've been to Singapore on Jan, 2011 and stay in this hotel for 3 nights. Good experience. We arrived Singapore quite early morning and got to the hotel at about about 8:00AM. Actually we didn't expect a room but only want to leave our baggage there. To our suprise, we got our room immediately! It located on a high floor(15 or 18?) with a great view. Thanks a lot to to Holiday Inn, my friend and I finally washed our face and had a snap after 6 hour long flight from the north to Singapore. And, the room was quite and bedding wonderful, I've slept well for all the 3 night stay here. We didn't have our breakfast at the hotel so no comments can provide. But the location is a little far away from the MTR. During the 3 days we always walk about 20min to take MTR at the Outram Park Station. Not sure if the bus can take us there. But there is a bus station within 5 min walk which has a lot of buses pass by, one of them can take you to Orchard Rd. Shops on the 1st floor sell postcard and stamps, we mailed several postcard here. Great seviece. Staffs here are also friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice n Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JustSamIND
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when i was on a busniess trip. So didn't worry about the lodging cost. I paid arount 1.3K bucks for 5 day stay. Hotel - Good. Ambience - Good Hospitality - Good Breakfast - Good (Continental. They serve a South Indian delicacy as well) Accessibility to MRT - OK (There is a bus stop just opp. to the hotel) Channels on TV - Good Overall, i had a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location @ Riverfront & Close to Chinatown & Orchard Rd”
Reviews.Author: Newo
Reviews.Content: Great location across the road from the riverfront and water ferry. Bus stop for the "123" to from Orchard Road is metres away or across the road. Easy walk along river to the MRT station at Excellent hotel with great Atrium lobby and glass walled elevators. Clean comfortable modern soundproof room on 11th floor with good view. Breakfast buffet was an very good choice of hot and cold food. Easy walk to Chinatown or a short taxi ride. The six local hotels run a shuttle to Orchard Road etc. Details from reception or concierge. Short walk to convenience store at local service stations (ask directions). First visit was in October 2000 as Hotel Concorde.

Reviews.Title: “you can probably do better”
Reviews.Author: taipeipeter
Reviews.Content: but if the price is right, it's OK. Rooms were roomy enough, and bedding very comfortable. Pool quite nice, though fitness center more of a joke. By Singapore standards, not a 4*. More than a bit aged and not that clean (not dirty, by any means, but I didn't like finding strange hairs around my room. There is karaoke in the lobby. Due to the atrium design, the extraordinary loud out of tune screechings can float up to every room.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel that does the job.”
Reviews.Author: RioJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed several times in this hotel. Last stay was in Nov. Nothing terribly wrong with this hotel. It does what it says on the can. Rooms are fine, though the carpet is not to everyone's liking. I've gotten used to it. For a HI property, a bit surprised ,in a good way, that it offers pillow menu. I was once even "upgraded" to their Japanese room, which was a laugh. In room Internet service is a constant problem. Patchy at best. Get yourself a prepaid broadband sim card at the airport to save yourself some grief.Breakfast is good old American style, hearty and unpretentious. A surprise find is the excellent Cantonese restaurant, Xin. Lovely authentic Cantonese cuisine can be had. Location wise, not walking distance to anything of interest but taxis are always on the wait by the rank. All in all a good value accommodation if one can overlook the ghastly carpet!

Reviews.Title: “Slipping standards”
Reviews.Author: RSDelhi
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in this hotel and alas it was not nearly as good as the first one. The hotel is aging and its beginning to show. The rooms, even the deluxe ones, are cramped, furniture is old and if you can believe it, the TV is right in front of the working desk. The bathroom doesn’t have a walk in shower which was not a new discovery but just adds to the list of inconveniences. The redeeming feature of the room is the view it provides of the adjacent parks if you are staying on the higher floors. It could get busy in the breakfast area which is located on the 4th floor but you will get by. They serve the same breakfast with a little tweak here and there so don’t go looking for different variety every morning. The hotel’s location is not bad at all and it’s always nice to just step out for a walk by the river or to visit one of the many restaurants and bars by the side. For those staying with families and planning to visit the city, they also have a shuttle at the fixed time of the day. The hotel needs to buckle up because the tariffs are not getting any lower in Singapore and for the same price, you could actually get a better suited hotel closer to the main district.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Milanbhise
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. I stayed here this months and few times in the past. This hotel is conveniently located and good accessible from anywhere. The staff is very good and ever helpful. Hotel building is rounded one, so offers great view of the city. Go for higher floors. Restaurants here are great. The only 'minus' is little away from nearest MRT station " Outram". Plenty of Taxis available which takes you to Orchard Road ( Hotel has coach service to Orchard Road), Raffles, Boat Quay, etc. Rooms are airy and large.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location near the Singapore River”
Reviews.Author: AZSailor12
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at a great HI in Beijing, this one was a bit disappointing. The rooms are pretty small here and there is no executive floor. Business associates told me the Orchard HI was better. The service is excellent here and food at the Melting Pot is good. There are many good restaurants across the street here along the River, so I only ate breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shrirang J
Reviews.Content: In general, the hotel is good. - a little far away from public transport. For family travel, being close to public travel is very useful. - vegetarians my find it difficult to eat in this hotel. Going out is better

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Oztravels7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the service was outstanding. Nothing was a problem for the staff, although there was one surly lady in the Melting ot but she too was efficient. The breakfast was outstanding in the Melting Pot and a really nice touch is a free designer coffee to take iwth you on your way out! I was on the Executive floor on Level 26 with access to the Exec Lounge. The view was spectacular and the canapes and drinks better than average. The only dowwnise to the room was the shower which was in the bath (refurbed bathroom) and there was not great water pressure although that said it was adequate. The gym's cardio equipmenty needs updating but again that said, it worked pperfectly but it is old. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wannabe - 'Towering Inferno'”
Reviews.Author: HKPiper
Reviews.Content: If gaudy, retro 70s is your thing you're sure to love this place. The rooms are dark, brown, gaudy and dreary. The (rather small) outdoor swimming pool has a purple coloured wall and some sort of dark brown frame thing (never did fathom out what it was for....presumably some sort of attempt at decoration and it (the swimming pool) looks over an industrial building. Inside the hotel the elevators are glass covered with lots of shiny lights, all very tacky and 70s-ish. Think of the movie, 'Towering Inferno' without the flames and you've got the idea! The hotel is not on the MRT route and appears to be a considerable distance from downtown however there are some good restaurants and bars within walking distance....thankfully as the dinner buffet at the cafe is very ordinary. Likewise the breakfast. The hotel only appears to have two restaurants, the cafe and a Cantonese restaurant. I did not go to the Cantonese one, so I cannot comment on that, however the cafe is certainly mediocre. What also surprised me was that to get internet access I had to pay. Many hotels of equaly standard I have stayed in before provide internet access for free. The price of staying at this hotel is not cheap. They should be charging 70s prices to go with the decor! On the plus side however, I have to say that the room we were given was spotlessly clean (if dated), the air conditioning worked well, the staff were very friendly and nothing seemed to be too difficult for them.

Reviews.Title: “No real complaints.”
Reviews.Author: akaepb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 days in August 2011 with 3 people total. One 9 year and 2 adults. I enjoyed the hotel atrium design because never much walking to the room. Fast elevators! The room was fine and plenty big. I felt humidity in my room which was a bit difficult to eliminate. . Non smoking room was just as it said. Hotel is not easy walking close to main tourist areas, but our Singapore friend showed us how to easily take the bus. Bus stop very close. Also, The hotel has a free shuttle a few times a day to the busy areas of shopping, etc. Stops at 2 locations. Taxis are not particurlarly expensive in Singapore. If you didn't know, the language of singapore is English, well sort of english, anyway. Singlish, LOL. Price of hotel is generally less than waterfront area hotels farther downtown. Singapore is NOT a cheap city, ie Jakarta, but not expensive by western city standards. This hotel, is a bit out in one direction, between downtown Harbor area and places farther out like Chinatown, which was about a 10 minute or less taxi ride. I would stay there again, depending on the rate. One last thing. The main concierge was the best we ever had. The most friendly and helpful. I wish I could remember his name! He was tall with dark hair and always so nice and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Sure I Saw the "Brady Bunch" in the Lobby?”
Reviews.Author: PerthMovers
Reviews.Content: How often have you read a review on a hotel that raved on and on about the lobby and public spaces? Its a hotel right? Its suppose to make an impression when you enter. Likewise, its public facilities are suppose to be up to scratch. That's what your paying for-right? And the more you pay, the more you expect- simple economics. The Atrium Holiday Inn Singapore, has a very nice lobby. It has acceptable public spaces. It has a nice pool and gym area- it even serves a reasonable breakfast, brought to your table by attentive, smiling employees. I spent 3-nighs at the hotel on business recently and its the room quality that is beginning to lack at this property. This hotel isn't new if you compare it to the monoliths of glass and concrete that dot the surrounding Singapore sky. I had a room on the 24th floor that was in painful need of a face-lift. Now I know that all 'parents' think their children are perfect and beautiful. Unblemished by circumstance. However, as we all know that isn't always correct. Note to 'hotel management 'parents' - as with children- hotel rooms can also let you down. Stepping into the room, I was transported back in time (and not in a good way). Not for me did the room evoke monumental moments in history or romantic nostalgia. No, hotel management have decided that the 1970's is "where its still at." This in itself is a very curious historical anomaly by hotel management. Given that there is no concept in the, City-State of Singapore of modernity whatsoever! Why choose the '70's? Nothing happened in the 1970's, except the invention of sueded and flairs. While on TV we had to endure the, "Brady Bunch". I hardly think these achievement warrant an entire hotel complex in South East Asia dedicated in their collective honour? But back to the time machine. The room to put it simple was brown. Brown carpet, with heavy old brown furniture and fittings. The bed was a granite-block camouflaged with a white sheet. So don't go bouncing on it unexpectedly (you've been warned). The bathroom is, even by the most charitable definition- tired and in real need of a make over. A shower curtain drapes supine over an old bath. I had great difficulty accessing the internet in my room ( which is free) but perhaps that was more the result of my own inane I.T. skills than anything the hotel did. If you love food then you will love Singapore! The only meal I ate in the hotel was breakfast- which was very good. The hotel is only a 10-15min walk from China town or any other of a myriad of food locations, where they always serve it, fresh, frequent, and fiery. Singaporeans' are extremely affable, and will engage with you, if you make a bit of an effort and push a little outside your comfort zone. The bill for my stay was I think around 800 ( Singapore dollars). As somebody else was picking up the tab, I didn't pay too much attention. I did however look up for a moment as I was signing my departure documents. Just in that flash, that moment, I was sure I saw Greg and Marsha walking through the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The best service for best price.”
Reviews.Author: Yonex99
Reviews.Content: I spent couple of month to find good hotel in Singapore with applicable price. The problem is that in Singapore cheapest 2-3 stars cost as 4-5* in Asia. I travelled with wife and 6-month old kid, so i looked for something more that only room and bed, but good hotels are very expensive, and starts from 200$. HolidayInn Atrium was only good hotel,with the best price i found. Big room, big bathroom(usualy for econom hotels in Singapore you can only have small room 2x2m with hole on the floor insted of even bath cabin), so this hotel was prety good for staying with my newborn kid! Architecture of the hotel very nice,veri nice view from the last floor to the lobby. One minus-no free wifi, but you can use complimentory internet in the business center. Location quite good,you can always take taxi and after 15-20 minute will be in any place you want.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel view, Room Size, Room Facilities, Restaurent”
Reviews.Author: Raushan_kr
Reviews.Content: The Hotel with room space, House keeping, Vareity of foods in complimentary breakfast which keeps changing daily is excellent. I stayed there for a week but found excellent in their all services. Even their housekeeping qualtiy was also very good. They used to change the room sleepers on daily basis (Towel made soft sleepers). Apart from that their food in the restaurent takes acer for all continet. Very good Indian, Chinese, American, maxican & food for other countries as well. Let me say that their cleantliness & timing for break fast well very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rjones74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Atrium foe a week on business. The only downfall for this hotel is the location. However it is an easy walk to both Robertson and Clark Quay's. Otherwise this is a GREAT hotel to stay at. Hotel staff is excellent and very accomodating. Especially Ariffin, the Concierge Manager. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Be cautious of credit card holds at check in”
Reviews.Author: Alaskan99
Reviews.Content: Paid the full balance of my stay using a credit card other than the one used at check-in because the charges were more than originally anticipated. After paying the full $2,000+ balance, the hotel manager couldn't assist removing the credit hold. The hold prevented me from using my credit card to purchase souvenirs for family. Would have liked the front desk manager to be more helpful in removing the credit hold, rather than condescending grimace of my hardship.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: JOGAB53
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Chinese quarter with many restaurant. Orchard road is a little further. The hotel has its own transport to Orchard road. The staff is incredibly helpful. Check in and Check out is very quickly. Rooms are clean. Breakfast is great. Super hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pashtet
Reviews.Content: Good value for money for such expensive city. While being a bit away from main shopping and MRT, it is easily reachable by taxi which is cheap in Singapore (to get from hotel to Orchard street costs 5-8 dollars depending on time and traffic). Room was good and clean. Didn't have any meal there so cannot say anything about that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value and Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ErinS84
Reviews.Content: Definately recommend this Hotel. It is VERY clean, our rooms were kept well stocked and cleaned everyday. It was a short walk or $3 taxi ride to the closest metro and a 5min walk to the local Mall w the most wonderful foodhall at the bottom w amazingly priced local food. The staff were really helpful with any of our requests. Basic gym and pool but met requirements. Expensive Wifi but free internet on the business centre computers. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Shane W
Reviews.Content: My room was basic but still very spacious and comfortable. The lobby is quite spectacular and the staff very friendly and professional. Great lobby bar, and excellent breakfast. Greaat location, walking distaance to China Towwn and very central to most other things.

Reviews.Title: “Truly appalling...”
Reviews.Author: cachecacher
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my 8-day stay in Singapore. I ended up staying only one night and left! The service is truly appalling. It is possibly one of my worse hotel experiences. Upon check in, I was greeted by door staff who opened my cab door. Wonderful? Then he simply turned around and left, and I was left alone to open the cab trunk and took out my own luggage! So I took my luggage into the hotel and checked in. Check-in was smooth, but the reception staff did not know how to process a credit card payment (this was really puzzling to me). It took a manager to figure it out. No problem: simply a 2-minute delay. Perhaps the staff was new to the job. I passed my luggage to one of the staff and was told that it will be well taken care of, so I was off to my room. I went straight to my room. It was old and badly needed renovation. But everything was clean though. I went to the gym for a short workout. When I got back 30 minutes later, my luggage still did not arrive! So I called reception, and finally it came. Then, I wanted to send some shirts for dry cleaning. A laundry staff came to pick up my shirts. But he did not speak English!!! So I told him to wait at the door while I call up housekeeping to clarify. Guess what? While I was on the phone, the laundry staff simply walked into my room and helped himself to the laundry bag from my luggage!! No privacy respected whatsoever: He simply walked in and helped himself to my belongings without permission! I was left speechless... Next, I tried to connect to the hotel's internet service. There was some confusion about the pricing plan, because when I connected, it did not specify in advance about how much I had to pay. So, I called reception. Reception did not know how to deal with the question and transferred me to concierge. Concierge put me on hold for 5 minutes, and then back to reception. After 10 minutes, I finally got to speak to someone again, and was told that she would get back to me. And nobody got back to me for one hour!!! So I called back, and the same person picked up the phone. She apologized and asked to put me on hold (again). But she actually hung up the phone on me! Okay, fine. Maybe it was an honest mistake. So I called back again. She did not even apologize for hanging up the phone on me. At this point, I was getting a little annoyed. Especially since the internet issue was still unresolved after over an hour. Finally, a manager called me back (this is 1.5 hours after my first phone call) and said I should be aware that as long as I am connected to the hotel's internet, I will have to pay for it. This is regardless of me not even given any notice about charge rates, internet plans or anything like that! It was beyond belief how the staff has handled the matter. At this point, I had more than enough. I decided to cut my stay short. So I called up reception to let them know I'm checking out the next morning. I did not even bother to complain about the poor service standards, but simply said I decided to move out the next day. Staff then said okay. 10 minutes later, staff called back and said I would now have to pay a higher room rate because I got a discount rate from my long stay (8 days). I said, okay, but how much more. He quoted me something that was like 60% higher than the rate I booked for. So I said, please let me speak to the manager. Staff said, sorry, the manager is not around. He would have to get the manager to call me back. After 5 minutes, manager did call me back. And I basically told him about my unpleasant experience so far and asked if he could do anything to give me a more reasonable room rate for one day. I also said I was going to move to the other Holiday Inn hotel (which I did). He said there is nothing he can do, even if I move to another Holiday Inn, because they are completely different entities. Then, he hung up the phone on me (again!!!). This was getting on my nerves. By the time I called back (this time, manager did apologize for hanging up). He eventually offered a room rate which was still 30% higher. I was simply too tired to argue with him anymore. I had checked in for a few hours and basically I had not a single good experience. I was going to be late for my meeting. I just wanted to get out of that hotel. The only positive note is actually breakfast next morning. The waitering staff was prompt and efficient. But it was too little too late. I took a quick breakfast and left for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: 44WestSide
Reviews.Content: First stay in Singapore, didn't want to spend a huge amount. Nice alternative to the "pricier" hotels. Rooms were clean and everything was in good order. I wouldn't call the breakfast buffet "fantastic". I would call it somewhat ordinary and the service was poor at times.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mampfi
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel, friendly Staff, fantastic breakfast Buffet, good Pricing - Best Said with "good Value for your Money"

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: phineyjo
Reviews.Content: Lovely, friendly staff. Excellent facilities, excellent food. Great location and a shuttle bus to Orchard road Highly recommended ....it even had a pillow menu

Reviews.Title: “Good rates if you book it online”
Reviews.Author: HK_Ling
Reviews.Content: Manage to get the room for a good deal for SGD128++ per nite after 20% discount as the booking was made quite in advance. Check in was quite alright, waited about 5 mins to be served. They have quite a number of counters but only two person was there. Probably it's 12 in the afternoon. The room was good with the size of 30 m2 but the layout is a bit uncomfortable for me. When u open the door the first thing you see is the bed. Meaning that any noise you make it can be easily heard from outside. Still prefer the small walkway with the bathroom on your right before reaching you reach your bed in all other hotels i stayed. The king bed in the room is the super king type so it's good enough for up to three adults. The mini fridge is packed with drinks meaning that u won't be having much space to put other stuffs you've bought unless u took them all out. Supplies of towels and toiletries are inconsistent. The first day, there was three bath towels in the room but only two in the second day. There's only one dental kit on the first day but they stocked it two the next day. U have to call the housekeeping for your shaver. One gentle reminder is that you make sure to have the "do not disturb" sign on as they don't have "please clean up the room" sign. The housekeeping guy will knock on your door around 9 am in the morning. He knocked twice as I was a little bit late to open the door and somehow i had a feeling that he might open the door if i don't open the door. Made enquiry to the hotel lobby and they said it was their standard practice to knock on the guest's room. However, the attitude from the receptionist wasn't great and it seems that it was my responsibility as a customer to inform the housekeeping not to disturb me in the morning. About the location, it does not sit above any mrt station but there are bus stations around the hotel. They do provide shuttle bus from the hotel to orchard road/clarke quay daily as well as to financial center on weekdays. The last bus from orchard is around 830pm. Do check local transportation website or google maps for the bus numbers serving from the hotel to your point of interest. It's not that hard to get a bus or even a taxi. Although the stay does not come with breakfast but i managed to look at the restaurant on my way down on the lift. It doesn't seems to have a lot of people eating there and they don't seems to have a wide variety of selection. Not much food around the area unless u walk 5-10 mins to nearby area to have your breakfast. For the price and the size of the bed and room, it is an option to consider providing that u do enough homework on your local public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: BasudevBasu
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel on a number of occasions while travelling on business.Comfortable though a bit dated rooms, efficient check-in and check-out.Service is courteous but slow.Location is bit of a problem being not served by the metro.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: RikkiSixx
Reviews.Content: We found the Holiday Inn Atrium a great place to stay in Singapore. Great value for money and excellent service. The atrium is amazing when you first walk into the hotel lobby. We were given a room upgrade and put on the 22nd floor which was great because we are light sleepers. There was almost no traffic noise in the room. Rooms were of good size and the bed was amazing. The hotel is a little bit out of the city but the free shuttle bus they offer to and from Orchard Road and Clarke Quay made up for it. There was free wired internet in the business centre and we used free wifi on our laptops in the lobby. Staff were always polite and helpful, they even had and international power adapter that we could use to charge our devices. Pool and gym were fantastic. Housekeeping do a great job cleaning your room and resupplying shampoo, coffee etc. They even provided free bottles of water everyday which was great because it does get very warm in Singapore. Something very special about the Holiday Inn Atrium is that it was my partner's birthday when we were there and they surprised us with a bottle of wine, bowl of fruit and a hand-written card. That blew us away! We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel if you want good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Go Wrong with Atrium”
Reviews.Author: Efleet
Reviews.Content: As the title says, atrium would always the plus point for a hotel especially you are staying on the top floor. Hotel staff are very helpful and kind. We were asking for 2 single bed room upon our arrival (around late evening) and they'd already run out of rooms of that kind. So, they upgraded our room to a suite, haha:-) it is always pleasant welcome if a hotel can really offer you a good room in the right moment (specially you need good sleep after long haul flight)! nice city view too!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in expensive Singapore”
Reviews.Author: henry00
Reviews.Content: As we were moving to live in Singapore from the UK we needed to stay somewhere for almost 3 weeks until we got our accommodation sorted. So I looked online at loads of hotels and decided to stay at this Holiday Inn as it was seemed good value for money. And it was. The rooms are relatively big and have been 'done up' to a decent standard - nothing fancy but clean and with robes, toiletries, kettle etc and are very clean. You can get free wi-fi in the reception area but it is pretty expensive to get it in your room. It is located away from the main busy areas but is a short taxi ride to Orchard Road. There is even a free shuttle bus that leaves from the hotel and leaves you at the Concorde Hotel which is midway along Orchard Road - very handy indeed for shopping - just ask the conceirge for a ticket before boarding. If you don't fancy leaving the area you should go to Robertson Quay (across the road from hotel) which has some pretty good restaurants and bars by the river and is much better and quieter than Clarke Quay which is a little further down the river. Another useful thing to note is that the hotel has a laundry room (good for us as we were staying so long). It has a decent pool on the 6th floor and a small gym too. The breakfast buffet serves everything you could wish for (bacon, eggs fruit, omlettes as well as good pastries and local food and Indian food too) although it did get a bit repetitive after 3 weeks as they don't change the menu much. All in all this is a great hotel for exploring Singapore and will not use up all of your holiday budget.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: mayellow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel for 3 nights and I have to say, this hotel is just nice of everything. The food was nice, the bed and the pillow was perfect. The staffs were friendly. You can trust the big brand of "Holiday Inn" anyway. I found the location is a little bit odd since we have to walk to the bus stop and take bus in order to go to city. But other than that, the rests are just perfect. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great service, stunning atrium, dated rooms..”
Reviews.Author: ttflying
Reviews.Content: Did a 1 nite stay on the way to Europe from Australia. We (family of 4) arrived about 2300 and had booked 2 twin rooms with a request that they be connected. No connecting rooms where available and when we got to the rooms they were double beds. back down to reception and they then assigned 2 twin rooms... Apart from that little glitch the hotel staff were great at every level. Rooms are old and tired but clean. Breakfast and bar service great. We requested one of the rooms to have a later checkout and this was granted.. 2 extra hours which was good. I don't know what will happen with this hotel, the cost of upgrading the rooms will be huge but the staff and customers deserve better rooms. I would not stay again at the hotel only because of the old rooms but if I learnt that the staff had moved to another hotel I'd go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not within walking distance of any public transport, although when we research prior to going they said we could walk from the train station to the hotel. You can walk, but wouldn't recommend it with bags, you have to go up and down stairs and cross the street and it was hot and wasn't fun at all. But we didn't want to wait for a taxi as there were over 100 people in the line. The hotel itself was breath taking walking into the atrium. Free shuttle that drops off at various places around Singapore but doesn't go at the most convienent times... Had a swim in the pool which was refreshing even if quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: vijayakumarc123
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel by reading review, not disappointed me. very nice hotel. The distance between hotel and airport is little far. Friendly front desk team welcomed and helped me to get my heavy luggage to room. Took some 20 minutes to check in and offered room at 22nd floor. The lifts are very fast, no need to wait long. Room was pretty big. Awesome panoramic view from the room window, was enjoying scenic beauty. They had offered free breakfast and had all the item to full tummy but for vegetarian, some how manage with fruit juice & other veggie stuff and i didn't found any Indian style food. We have to walk little more outside to get hotel. Getting taxi from hotel was very fast. There is a near by bus stop that connects to the city. probably 10-15 minutes. I completely happy with service and facilities they have provided. Overall Very Good!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, slightly out of the way, expensive WIFI”
Reviews.Author: JARMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I normally travel for business, but on this occasion I stayed at the Holiday Inn as my daughter who was on school holidays joined me at the end of the business trip. The atrium is stunning, my daughter and I really enjoyed going up and down from level 16. It was fun to look out going up & down. All the staff are really happy, everyone was very welcoming, all the time. This was a real contrast to the last hotel I stayed in last week in Penang. The breakfast was good. Having Indian Dahl was an unusual breakfast for me. There was a wide choice of foods. We ate one night in the cafe, the food was good with a wide selection. The rooms are older, but this was not a problem at all. However the toliet flush is quite noisy. 2 gripes... 1. How can anyone in their right mind charge $27 ++ for internet access? In this day and age I am tending to choose more hotels based on having WIFI included. 2. I made local phone calls, this are timed. A 30 minute local phone call ended up being $5.20, this is a rip off Taxis were never a problem for us. We often caught the bus from Havelock Rd, the 123 bus goes up Orchard Bvld. This makes it easy to get to Orchard Rd. Most of the buses going from outside the hotel on Havelock St go via the Clarke Quay MRT stop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: SaradeUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in late September/ early October 2011 and loved it! We upgraded to a room with better views and were not disappointed. The free shuttle bus made getting around Singapore very easy, although taxis were very cheap. The lifts are a real show stopper as you first walk in. The swimming pool and gym were an adequate size and always quiet when we used them (daily). Only a short taxi from Clarke quay for a great night out but we had a good time in the hotel bar too! The buffet breakfast was lovely and we had a nice evening meals in the restaurant and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nik1985
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, superb location... I stayed at 23 floor and the view of whole Singapore City was amazing. Food was great... Great over all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Average Accessibility around Singapore”
Reviews.Author: al22tec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention in August. Good room rates for Singapore standards. Its rates were basically the same with a supplier who stayed in a Chinatown hotel, but the chinatown hotel was much smaller than Holiday. Beds are quite good, the food is good. I had some problems with the internet wifi. Once you are connected and switch off your computer, when I switch back on, I end up having problems re-accessing it. The front desk is not any help with this problem, telling me to call a hotline number of the internet provider. Accessibility is limited to either the bus or by taxi. The next MRT stop is several blocks away. Taxis are not that plentiful though, and there is some wait at the hotel's entrance. The other minor issue with taxis is that the hotel is considered as part of the business district and if you take the taxi during rush hour, expect to be charged extra, I forgot what they call it, a charge for entering the business district, over and above whatever is the extra charge by all taxis for rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with basic facilities & services”
Reviews.Author: hippodiver
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay if your expectations of this hotel are basic: a comfortable and clean room at reasonable rates, given the relatively high hotel rates in Singapore. Facilities are basic. It has a decent swimming pool that seemed to have been renovated recently. It also offers free internet access on the ground floor. Both of those facilities were quite empty during my stay there which was nice. It also has a laundry room (SG$5 for washing and SG$5 for drying). The dry cleaning rates are expensive though for the hotel of this class. It is not in the most "central" location but it is still fairly convenient. The nearest good place to eat and shop is Great World City shopping mall by about 10 mins on foot. There are also good bus routes if you know where to catch them. If you know how to navigate your way around Singapore then this hotel is quite good. The hotel was being used as a base for a lot of aircrew.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Holiday Inn standards”
Reviews.Author: ria_q8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atrium Singapore for four nights in January. As our taxi's pulled up there was no help at all from the doormen and we had to unload our suitcases ourselves. Check In was fine even though one of the room keys didn't work and it two trips back to reception to get it sorted. There seemed to be a musty smell throughout the hotel however this could be due to the Singapore humidity coupled with air conditioning. The hotel is like a large ring with floor after floor of rooms circling the main reception. The higher up the more amazing the view down is. Our rooms were initially OK (we had three rooms) however we found a toe nail in one of the beds and brown marks on sheets of another bed meaning we had to call housekeeping twice and they seemed a bit upset we had complained. Other than that the rooms were fine - if slightly dated - with comfortable beds and pillows and a clean bathroom. We didn't have breakfast included when we booked and it seemed pretty expensive so we chose to eat out each day so can't comment on the food. Pro's at the hotel are the laundry room for guests to use and the little convenience store on the ground floor where snacks, toiletries and washing powder etc are all available. There is also a little massage place which was great for a foot massage after a long day shopping. Cons included the location of the hotel as everything was a taxi drive away and lack of help from the hotel doormen until we left - they were extremely helpful helping us at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Crazyhorse3
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is what you would expect from a hotel chain like Hoilday Inn. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable and Tarrifs are competative. The pool and spa facilities are OK and breakfast is excellent but expensive. The hotel runs a regular shuttle into Orchard road for shopping but my wife and I walked from the hotel to Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and the famous Raffles hotel in complete safety. These areas boast the best bars and restaurants where you can gaurentee good service and good food (beware alcholol in Singapore is quite exspensive). Singapore prides itself on very low crime rates so any time day or night your quite safe walking to most places. if you dont feel energetic, taxis are every where and very cheap. from the airport to the hotel it only cost me 25 sing dollars. A good base for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Should be 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: Staff quite surly on check-in, the room was fine but the lobby had a stale musty smell, it needs a good clean..on check-out, my husband had to ask the lady to stop talking to her friend and to stop ignoring him as we were in a hurry, we had a train to catch, and if looks could kill! It's also a little far out if you want night-life. On a positive note, the room was clean, the bed comfortable but there are better hotels in that price range.

Reviews.Title: “No real reason to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: MuchLoveandAloha
Reviews.Content: I came to Sing on vacation, and this place is nothing to write home about. The atrium IS pretty, but the rooms themselves have a good 1970's feel to them. Everything looks old and tired, from the light colors to the doors to the rooms. It's not terrible; just looks worn in. Location - a fair walk from the MRT. I would say a minimum of 12 minutes, and I'm in good shape. Not terribly ideal since you will spend a fair amount of time waiting for the MRT. Also, a taxi to this location automatically adds $3 SGD since it is considered "inside city limits," whatever that means. Getting anywhere via the MRT will take you a while if you stay at this hotel... Bottom line- if you are on business, fine. Other than that, the location isn't the most efficient for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth your visit :)”
Reviews.Author: ourmaizcay
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 3 nights in Singapore. Bit amazed that previous reviewer had issues with room. Found it to be a great hotel, with great stuff. The rooms were clean, modern as expected with any Holiday Inn. The only point worth noting is that it's not as centrally located as other accomm. But that's overcome my the free bus available in the mornings. As other's have mentioned lovely stuff, help make Holiday Inn Atrium a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a bit long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: WliaputsSbsp
Reviews.Content: You know that old building smell? Well, this place has it. The service was good, the rooms were nice and clean, just kindof old. The location is pretty poor, there isn't much within easy walking distance. I walked to the MRT one morning, but it really is a bit far. I also walked to Great World City mall, which was also a bit far. I used their restaurant for breakfast, which was a very nice buffet with pretty much anything you can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel desperately needs updating”
Reviews.Author: globaltravelbuff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Atrium for 2 nights while in transit in Singapore. The hotel is not very close to public transportation and is out of the way of most of the main shopping/business areas. The rooms were extremely outdated and bare. The lobby, while large, lacked any sitting area/furniture. The only positive aspect was the customer service-- the staff was quite helpful. Beyond that, we frankly expected more from a Holiday Inn, especially given the fact that Holiday Inn has updated most of their hotels in the US in recent years.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service. Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Mitika M
Reviews.Content: I was staying at this hotel from the 31 Aug 2011 through the 3rd Sep 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We had an east facing room, and it was very nice and spacious. The bathroom tub could be considered a little outdated, but the amazing deal we got to this place offset that. I was really impressed by the staff at this hotel. I have been to many hotels where some of the staff are very welcoming and courteous, but at this hotel all the staff treat you amazingly well.
