The concierge was extremely helpful and the hotel also provides a free shuttle service to Orchard St. which is an excellent shopping destination (or a nice place to find a variety of meals if you aren't interested in the breakfast or other meals at the hotel). I tried the breakfast at the hotel and it was very nice. Tip: they give you $10 off breakfast ($20 instead of $30 per person) if you choose to select a breakfast option during check in. So if you intend on having breakfast here and haven't gotten a breakfast package, then get one at check in. We ordered in room service quite a few times during our stay and were quite impressed with the food. If I don't have an extravagant amount like $400 to spend on a room per night, I will definitely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “disappointment”
Reviews.Author: savi_75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the holiday inn atrium from 3 till 6th september 2011; it was quite a disappointment. The rooms were out-dated and had a weird disgusting smell coming from the old carpets on the floor. The windows in the room dont open. The hotel is pretty far from major shopping centres and public transport so you need to get a taxi. Even the taxis dont drive easily to this hotel to pick up guests. However there is a free shuttle bus driving close to orchard road. The breakfast was not as good as expected and the staff was not really friendly and uninterested; we requested for a table near the window but the person we asked to do this didnt want to clean a table for us. Overall is was not the experience we hoped for and we will not stay at the holiday inn atrium again when we visit Singapore in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Its not as close to the main attractions in Singapore as portrayed.”
Reviews.Author: Bozz56
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth and freindly. Allocated an excellent room on the 26th floor. Great views. Sensational buffet breakfast. My advice...book and prepay the breakfast at time of booking. Its a lot cheaper and well worth it! This hotel is away from the main shopping area of Singapore, despite how its portrayed by the advertising guff. Everything is a Taxi ride away, and while Taxis are not expensive in Singaporee, it would be lots easier to go outside and buy some drinks or snacks or do some clothing or electronics shopping at a place within easy walking distance and closer to the hotel. If you want shopping and to avoid Taxi fares, stay at the sister hotel.....the Intercontinental in the city. You will save time and taxi fares. Minimal views but lots of other benefits there. Drinks in the Lobby Lounge are overpriced (even at the happy hour prices).Wine is less than ordinary. Bed is hard but pillows good. If you travel to China and dont like the beds there then this is paradise!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will recommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: Liz421
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful and courteous. Was able to assist us in locating the place where we are looking and in fact had even print out the map of the place. The coffee shop with its nightly live music is very inviting. Food is definitely a mixture of different culture, you could hardly wait to taste it .

Reviews.Title: “Average+ hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramzzz
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. I had very mixed experiences. The checkin was quick and painless. We got to our room and found that the bathroom was dirty and there was lamps missing in the bedside light. Called the reception and sent room service instantly to cleanup the bathroom but the attitude of the cleaner was not so polite. He was constantly on phone with someone. Later we were moved to another room which was better. The room otherwise is very Holiday Inn full of all the things that one wants. The bed was excellent , the pillows were a wee bit hard and heavy but not bad. Swimming pool and gym were good but the towels outside were not very nice smelling and old. Buffet breakfast was good overall. One can see the age of the hotel from various things but the one thing that stood out was the very friendly staff, everywhere, be it buffet, reception etc..except that one cleaner that I mentioned earlier. Location wise it is just across the road from the famous Singapore river. Great Location considering it is very close to all the great resturants and nightlife of Singapore. Was good overall , nothing great and nothing too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry late review but very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: magsnewell
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on priceline very good value, excellent lovely big clean room and bathroom, very good buffet breakfast (paid extra but remember that it was good value).The staff were the best and very helpful,hotel beautiful at night and provided a cooked meal for us late on arrival night. I would def stay here again . make sure and try time permitting massage in little shops attached to hotel .. amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place with friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: sarin61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 weeks and it was one of the pleasant stay I had at a hotel in sometime. The staff were friendly specially the people at the Lobby Lounge. If you are staying there go talk to Nic at the Lobby Lounge and ask him "one for the road" The only complaint I had was food when I ordered from the bar and had troubles 3 times. The staff was prompt in taking action and the F&B Director reached out to me and apologized along with the chef and promised that it would never happen again. I would be staying here every time I come to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good and Guest Friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Ode_to_Joy_9
Reviews.Content: Rooms are larger than other Hotels in the area. Slightly dated construction however the maintenance of the place is good. Breakfast is ok. Internet is available in the lobby and at the business center. Pool and Gym facilities are good. Laundromat facility available which is useful for the guests. Overall comfortable stay and staff is friendly, will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service in the Lion City”
Reviews.Author: DocTotoy
Reviews.Content: Though it is a fairly old hotel and the fixtures do need a bit a of updating, whatever the structure needs in terms of an update is well made up for by the EXTREMELY helpful and friendly staff. They made our stay very very convenient by arranging for most of our transport needs and directing us to where we needed to go. Breakfast was at par with most hotels in the same level. Nothing spectacular but worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: DebHnz
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in Singapore on this trip. We knew we didn't have a lot of time but wanted somewhere comfortable and convenient so chose Holiday Inn Atrium based on price. We weren't disappointed. The architecture of the building was lovely and the lobby at night, stunning. We ate at the lobby bar where there was live music. It was a little loud but we are getting older and don't like music so loud that you can't hear to talk. We overcame the problem by sitting as far as possible away from the vocalists. The music was lovely and added a nice ambience - they just needed to turn it down. The food was good enough. We did have an initial problem with the chips being cold but this was quickly rectified and we were given a free dessert to compensate. Top marks for good service. The room was immacuately clean, bed comfortable. We wanted for nothing. There was a free gym and pool on site but I never got there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laurajaynewoodhouse
Reviews.Content: He stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed it. The bed was huge and ultra comfortable. The staff couldn't do enough for us and even surprised me with a birthday cake! The breakfast was varied and a good standard. The only disappointment was the internet charge ($29 per day).

Reviews.Title: “Great place n location to stay especially with kids”
Reviews.Author: Stulizlarson
Reviews.Content: Checked out alot if hotels and found this a good place to stay with family n it's location is great few min away from tge mtr.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: tiantang
Reviews.Content: Considering Singapore hotels are on par with London prices, to get a 4* hotel for under 100 GBP was a bargain. Holiday Inn is a chain 4* hotel. The Singapore branch has the following features: positive - gorgeous atrium - 10 min walk from the tube (though taxis are cheap and we just cabbed it everywhere) negs - the nearest tube stop is inconvenient for orchard road - decorated in the standard holiday inn decor which in my opinion is antiquated.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel with excellent amenities”
Reviews.Author: crocnsw
Reviews.Content: A well maintained hotel with friendly efficient staff. Rooms are spotlessly clean with many guest amenities in the room such as toothbrushes, bottled water etc. While the buffet breakfast is well stocked food is not replentished as quick as it should be. Hotel is near river and Clarke Quay restaurant area is an easy walk from the hotel. Need a taxi to reach Orchard Rd. Hotel is also a short taxi ride from China Town and the new casino. Swimming pool sheltered from direct sunlight in morning. Will have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - will definitely come back again!”
Reviews.Author: Pyng
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Holiday Inn Atrium in April 2011 and i must say i was pleasantly surprised. I was very apprehensive at first about staying in a "hotel chain" after a few bad experience but Holiday Inn changed my mind. Just a few months before, we were in Singapore and we booked into a one of those modern boutique hotels near Clarke Quay. Thinking that we were getting good value and great service seeing that it was a small, we were so wrong. On our return to Singapore, i looked around online for another hotel to stay and read reviews on Tripadvisor and this is where i found Holiday Inn Atrium. Two things that caught my attention was that guests said that the beds were big (king size) and that there was free shuttle to the city. Seeing that the hotel rates were reasonable, we booked one room for 2 nights. We arrived from an early morning flight and took the train from the airport to Outram Park (this is the nearest station from the hotel but not walking distances). From there it was a short taxi ride to the hotel. Befitting their name, there was indeed a beautiful atrium within the hotel itself when you enter. Check-in at the front desk was fast and efficient. As we entered our room, we were pleased about the room size and the layout. The bed size was indeed large and was comfortable (yes, they have a pillow menu but ones we already had were good). We had a good and pleasant two nights of sleep especially after all the sightseeing/shopping we did all day. There was also a flat screen TV with good amount of channels, tea and coffee making facilities, a safe and bathroom amenities. I think what made our stay enjoyable was the high level of service from all the staff. The overall staff of the hotel was great while their concierge was very friendly and attentive. Not forgetting is the housekeeping staff which must deserve a mention as one of the nights we spilled some tea on the duvet and within minutes of calling, one of their housekeepers promptly came and change the sheets all in a matter of minutes. He even offered us an extra blanket and said that he will leave it in the room if we need it just in case. Other than that, do make use of their free shuttle and grab a copy of the daily schedule from concierge. We sat on a few rides to and fro Orchard Road in a comfortable tour bus like shuttle which is parked at the side entrance of the hotel. Do remember that you will need to call front desk or concierge to book you seats earlier. Also, taxis are easily available outside the hotel lobby itself where the doormen will hail one for you. If you are looking for a place nearby to eat or hangout, we were recommended by the hotel to visit Great World City Mall which is just a 10 minute walk but we still took a taxi anyway. It was a good mall with plenty of eating options and shops to browse. Overall, Holiday Inn Atrium was a great value for our money. Although not as good of a location compared to our previous Singapore stays near Clarke Quay or at Orchard Road, it has been one of our best stays. We will definitely come back to stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cipols16
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in Holiday Inn Atrium Hotel before our holiday in Indonesia and our experience was really good. It had clean and confortable rooms, good service, a nice pool. The best thing was definitely the elevator!!!! Bad things: breakfast and wifi access (too expensive). It wasn't very close to Marina Bay, but we could get the centre very easily by taxi (really cheap). Go there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's a Holiday Inn - but with a 5* experience”
Reviews.Author: LiveLikeLocals
Reviews.Content: No need to introduce the Holiday Inn brand, but it's definitely worth pointing out that they are not the same all over the word. We've stayed in many of them, and all of them great value, good amenities and all of the same-same brand features. But the HI Atrium Singapore had us mightily surprised: A stunning building (awesome atrium with glass elevators), stylish and superbly equipped rooms with great views, super-friendly and helpful staff and very good facilities (e.g. business center where you can print 'War and Peace' for free (well, we did not do or even try that...)). The hotel is close to Robertson Quay with lovely local restaurants (none of the Boat Quay madness) Plus, there is a free shuttle to take you to Orchard Road. We got our own little 5-star experience for a 3-star rate (booked online directly with the hotel). We suggest you try it when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall experience”
Reviews.Author: Tw0_Kiwis
Reviews.Content: Best value for money hotel we’ve stayed in for a long time. Fifth visit to Singapore decided this time to try another establishment. We were not disappointed. Service from all staff was excellent from reception, housekeeping, concierge to restaurant, nothing was too much trouble. Any request was actioned promptly and efficiently. Hotel and room was spotlessly clean, food in restaurant was superb. Beds are large, could have slept the whole family, Rooms are of good size, with plenty of room for luggage. Regular free shuttle bus service to Orchard Road shopping, with a stop on the return journey close to Chinatown markets.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious room, great views, friendly, helpful staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: dransfield
Reviews.Content: Only S$1 to catch a local bus to main shopping centres. Need to have right money as no change of notes possible. Great way to see the city. Lots of lovely walks around hotel, beautiful, clean city, with lots of colour. Tropical plants everywhere along the way.

Reviews.Title: “The most economical IHG in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiWil
Reviews.Content: Location falls behind the HI in Orchard Road, Style loses out to the Intercon in Bugis, Comfort is behind the Crowne in Changi - but if you are looking to stretch your dollar then the HI Atrium might be your choice! Me and my spouse stayed here for a fortnight during the festive lunar new year and actually found our choice to be a good one. If you have a car, hotel parking is plentiful and free, location is very central and no ERP (toll charges) charges applies. There are plenty of good food around the hotel vicinity, check out the Zion Hawker Centre, Great World City Mall, Zouk Disco. Be forewarned: If you are a pious man and frown upon sights of working ladies parading their stuff after the working hours of the KTV, you might consider changing hotel or sleeping in early. Nice swimming pool. Suites are spacious and offer a great view of the cityscape, better still if you are staying over during National Day (Aug 9th) or Chinese New Year (Feb period) to catch a glimpse of the fireworks downtown! Shuttle services to Orchard Shopping areas for tourists. I heard the Dim Sum is worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 rating - good service, everything else 'ok'”
Reviews.Author: bryli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a month on business, overall it was good enough to last an entire month. I'm pretty sure the only thing keeping me here was the price though (pros and cons listed below). Overall it'd be a fine place for a short stay, a good value for the price (minus taxi costs), however I would not recommend for a longer stay. Pros: - 10 minute walk to a shopping centre and food market - room service was prompt and good quality - the breakfast was above average with great service Cons: - internet in the room was slow, being here on business, it bordered on being enough to check out on a few occasions - not close to any subway station, must taxi or take the bus - front desk service not so helpful and almost indifferent at times - the gym was small, pool was cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and good price!”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunk85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011 and had a very good stay here. The staff is always friendly, efficient and helpful. The hotel itself looks amazing from the insight, gave us a real Vegas-feel! The location is good, but you will need transport to get to the main sights. Luckily there is a taxi-spot right in front of the hotel (just like in all the Singaporean Hotels). Everybody just ques up and in no-time you will have your cab. There also is a metro station nearby, but we did not make use of it thanks to the great taxi-service. The room facilities are good, I have never found that much amenities such as toothbrush, razor, cotton pads etc. The bed is spacious and the room is very nice, light and clean. We booked a standard room with twin beds. Breakfast was the best we had during our entire trip to Asia. Lot's of fine foods to choose from and to keep you going for a day. The swimming pool looked good, no time to try it though. The view is not as spectacular as you will have from the Marina Bay Sands, but hey, the prices there are four times as high as here! And you can always go there for drinks ;)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Webmoment
Reviews.Content: The title says it all! The incredibly professional staff at this hotel made this the best hotel experience ever, and we have been traveling for a long time. From checking in to reluctantly leaving, we really felt as if we were prize winners being accorded special VIP treatment. Our first contact was Mr Faizal Hashim, Assistant Director of Rooms. He turned a booking mistake I had made into a dream stay by taking a personal interest in us and bringing customer service to a new level. We left the property considering him a great new friend. We will never consider any other property in Singapore after the experience we had. Our room was superb, and Faizal arranged some tours for us, assisted by the very charming Mr Ryner Choong, and we had the best time ever of our several visits to Singapore. The property itself is immaculate and in a nice central location, a short taxi ride away from everything. I want to emphasize, it is the people working here that make this hotel a cut above other properties! Without exception, everyone we met was charming and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Executive floors service great”
Reviews.Author: enemy01
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the executive floors of the Holiday Inn Atrium and I found the service was great. There was nothing I could fault about the room and the executive lounge attendant was very helpful. The view from the room across Singapore is great from the upper floors. The hotel is not the most central in Singapore, but it is easy to get to on public transport or walking.

Reviews.Title: “decent older hotel if you have a nice room”
Reviews.Author: Supermensch
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Holiday Inn Atrium. Upon arrival, my room had a damp feel and musty smell to it. I spent the night in the room but in the morning, most of my things felt as though they had been outside in a camp site all night. I requested a different room, which seemed to be better. However, after showering, I was dressing in the room and heard a noise in the bathroom. Peeking around the corner, much to my surprise, there were two small streams of water coming from light fixtures on the ceiling, puddling on the floor - presumably a leaky drain from the a/c unit. After that experience, I was moved (again) to a third room which was fine. The staff was very friendly and certainly apologetic for my experience. The hotel design is interesting, and riding the glass elevators up the atrium was always an enjoyable experience. The room was clean and had been recently modernized. If you can get a room on an upper level, you can potentially have a fantastic view of Singapore. Breakfast was good, with a mixture of asian and western selections. The location is reasonable, though about a 15-20 walk to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: Bhupeshrajan
Reviews.Content: The holiday inn atrium is a nice and beautiful hotel located in centre of the city, the atrium is awful and hotel room is to the high standard! The rooms are spacious and the view is too good as i get top floor! its my second stay in the hotel, i will prefer to stay again

Reviews.Title: “A different experience”
Reviews.Author: Waddy0905
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was amazing as compared to the rates at which we got, Breakfast was amazing but the only negative about the hotel is that its far away from all the tourist attraction of Singapore. Even though the bus stop is just in front but you need to shed some extra dollars for the travel

Reviews.Title: “i loved the locality”
Reviews.Author: roamerviji
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on outram road, it is very conveniently placed for shopaholics, this hotel itself has large shopping area and nearby distance with china town. They provide free shuttle service to china town and clarke quay, one has to get coupons from counter located near lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: jchan2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located well and was an instantly recognizable shape. The rooms themselves were clean, spacious, and comfortable. Staff was helpful in organizing destinations to see within Singapore and the breakfast, though a little on the pricey side (book a day in advance for a discount), had a large variety of items and was prepared well. Overall, though this hotel is not located near some of the other hotels, it is still in a great location just a quick taxi ride away and is within walking distance of a MRT station and a market with a large variety of affordable foods.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good All Round”
Reviews.Author: emem
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and could not fault. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Good location with cheap taxi Fares readily available. Room very well maintained and a fantastic bed. Great breakfasts ( cheaper if you book for breakfast the previous night) with variety to appease anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Location - V Good Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: LalitShharma
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife and a four year old kid on this new year. Over all our stay was good... But a still believe it could have been a little better. From inside the hotel looked hollow with long rounding corridors... The strange cylindrical look from outside is actually good. The hotel staff is not very friendly but ok. You have to call the reception 3 times at least to get the job done. rooms are not too big either. The Concierge service was the only saving grace they are prompt, active and always at your service unlike the front desk staff. I believe the restaurant could have been managed a little better keeping the holiday rush in mind. We had to wait stand in a long ques (20 min waiting) to get to the B'fast table. Not so much choice for the B'fast either. the food was ok. pool is too small... hmmm, stightly bigger thn the splash pool :). Over all I wish there was a little more for me to feel good.

Reviews.Title: “Has the 3 things needed for a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: laurenatjindong
Reviews.Content: The 3 things that make a room comfortable for a good nights sleep is, very comfortable bed, no noise disturbance what so ever, and completley dark no matter what time of the day! We were on the 14th floor so the higher the better in terms of getting away from below street noise, although the location is quiet as it's not located in the heart of all the hustle and bustle. There is the option to book your buffet breakfast the night before saving yourself $SGD10, but if you don't feel like you will eat all that there is an a la carte menu, you just have to ask. Be aware if you are told 'we must upsell to you' when asking about the a la carte menu which I thought was a bit strange, saw the notes next to my name on the computer (UPSELL) as though I wasn't allowed the a la carte menu?! Insisted I wanted the a la carte menu and after some confusion from the staff ordered from this menu. Out the back lobby door and a 10 minute walk away is a hawker centre which we had dinner from one night for $SGD10 for the 2 of us and it was lovely, ask the conceirge and you are going to want to save all the money you can whilst in Singapore, it is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: highgrove4
Reviews.Content: Fazial, Thank you for the opportunity to thank you again. Before I left, I handed a hand written letter to the receptionist in which I praised the overall stay at your hotel, I made exception to your service and help you gave me, which I felt was above and beyond your normal duty, thank you again. I did manage to get exactly what I wanted from "Challange" and also came away with a new lap top .... mmmm..... that wasn't in the plan. Regards. Kelvin

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, reminds us of Shanghai's Grand Hyatt inside!”
Reviews.Author: Glocklt4
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with great design. Almost identical to Shanghai's Grand Hyatt, but not nearly as tall of course :). We stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed it. Quiet and has laundry machines for you to use to avoid insane laundry prices of most hotels. Only reason for not 5 stars is that the rooms could have been a bit more updated, but really it was fine. Front desk service was very good and helpful. Selection of multiple types of pillows was very nice! Location of hotel is a bit out of the way if you like to walk everywhere, however the walk down the river is very nice to Clarke Quay if you enjoy walking a lot. Taxi from the train station was only $5 SGD. Restaurant buffet was very expensive at $30 SGD each, so we did not even try it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice atrium, indeed”
Reviews.Author: 7dust
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, with stunning atrium. It has all what a decent HI should have. Would return there again. It's not very near any subway station though (the nearest is Outram Park). It was quite inexpensive too.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: surfie999
Reviews.Content: While the Hi Atrium is currently upgrading the pool on level 6 and it is not available for at least 6-8 weeks there is still a small splash pool on the roof. With fantastic views across the whole city. Many rooms seem to have been renovated over the past year or so and breakfast is still a great feed to get you going for the day with plenty of choice. One always feels welcome at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the eighties”
Reviews.Author: DKBNZTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean. Its an ok location. But apart from that there is a lot to be done! The atrium is souless, the bar, has terrible singers. The breakfast area in need of refurbishment, the staff are OK. The shopping mall attached is an eye opener!

Reviews.Title: “This is a repeat stay as it is just right!”
Reviews.Author: Steph055
Reviews.Content: We enjoy some time in Singapore at least twice a year and the last few times have chosen to stay at this hotel because it is an excellent location, has the best beds and pillows and is spotless! We love the massages and mani/pedi's just off the lobby and enjoy a Happy Hour drink in the Lobby Bar before going out for tea each evening. A great holiday hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: nbedi
Reviews.Content: This was a very decent hotel. Good location with most attractions within a decent taxi distance. The staff was generally very helpful. We checked in at the same time as tourist coach, but we were given priority for check in. There is a little shop in the hotel to buy any food supplies. There is a free hotel shuttle bus, which was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Dream_Traveller005
Reviews.Content: Nice and Elegant hotel situated very close to the most happening boat quay ,Clarke quay, Orchard Road and China town etc.. Close by shopping areas like Great World city etc. Average price and good service... Good customer service and friendly staff. Best deal among ICH hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property, Awesome People”
Reviews.Author: Bishal K S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in end-May 2011 and was on the 27th floor. Breathtaking view of the Singapore city skyline complimented with exceptionally good food and service. There was an Indian restaurant also, and it just made it perfect for the family. The service was top class, and they did everything to ensure we felt like honored guests. The conceierge was impeccable in service, and arranged all our transportation and trips and didn't charge an arm and a leg as most high-class properties tend to do. Will stay here whenever in Singapore, be it for work or fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Soulless: A lot need to be improved”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTourist201
Reviews.Content: Ref: Reservation Confirmation # 64678180 Stayed there for a night on April 7. I firmly believe that to err is human, to forgive is divine. And my [many] contributions would vouch, I don’t unnecessary whine. Being honest and straight-forward, I am really surprised to find several recent positive reviews of this hotel. For us it has been a sheer disappointment. I would go to the extent, that this particular property is sullying the very brand Holiday Inn. Let me exemplify. 1. Wrote to the hotel for asking directions. Got a confirmation that they had received my mail but the reply never arrived. 2. At our check-in we were informed about a fruit basket, as a welcome gesture, being a first-time guest over there. That fruit basket never arrived. Yeah, arguing about such complementary services sounds childish if not idiotic. But in hospitality branch you don’t offer something if you don’t intend to deliver. 3. You wouldn’t believe, our toilet was not flushed!! Could it become more pathetic, at a so-called 4-star hotel? 4. Our room had seen its finest days and was in need of some refurbishments. 5. No information about free shuttle, if there is any. 6. Management, don’t ask you for your feedback after your stay. Nor do they mail you any survey form. Without letting guests to express their complaints and for that matter satisfaction and pleasure, how can you improve? 7. Even otherwise, it is a soulless place. Where people might be doing their duties but don’t seem to be enjoying their respective jobs. Pros. 1. Good business center, with free access to internet and printer. 2. Good quality breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Loinkloth
Reviews.Content: In Singapore only for 2 nights, the hotel is much more than above-average and I imagine if I was in town for business this would be very suitable in any category. As far as a holiday is concerned I would've preferred to be much more in the thick of things such as Orchard Rd or the Bay areas so that you can just step outside of the hotel and do shopping and sight-seeing. The Atrium is very much a business hotel, with very comfy intimate rooms, and gym and pool tailored to people pressed for time. Breakfast under the atrium is quite an experience with good plentiful selections and attentive staff. Nice cocktail in the lounge with live singer some evenings to wind down a busy day. You need to, however, take some form of transport (albeit, short and cheap) to go to significant shopping, dining and sight-seeing places, not to mention the nightlife. Otherwise, a nice comfortable stay with nothing to complain about. Free wifi is a plus (maybe, expected?).

Reviews.Title: “It was a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: gupta_sanju
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay for 5 nights with friends recently. The hotel is very comfortable and located conveniently close to Orchard Road,Chinatown etc. The service is decent, room size adequate for upto 3 persons in a room. The hotel has limited eating options comparatively but overall a good palce to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: joymumu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 3 days stay in Singapore mainly based on rating on TripAdvisor based on our budget. Well located, big hotel, spacious rooms, expensive but reasonably priced as compared to Singapore, good access to public transportation. Value for money. Enjoyed the stay for 3 days with family. Terrific experience of watching bentleys, lamborgini's, porche's, merc owned by the visitors of the nightclub. Great lobby, attractive elevators. Few kilometers away from orchard road. Recommend to plan in advance and book well in advance. I would definitely like to go back on next opportunity.We liked the food though quite expensive. Name itself is enough to speak of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Spiderpig41
Reviews.Content: Well looking up from the reception certainly gives you an aspect of the hotel architecture, stayed for one night while passing through Singapore, very pleased with the speed of check in and my travelling companion appreciated the birthday wishes after hanfding the passport over. They recognised my platinum status and provided a deluxe room on the 16th floor. I must say you may not appreciate the glass elevators if you have vertigo! Room was spotless and had all the amenities provided. Rooftop pool was relaxing for an early morning swim and the gym was reasonably equipped. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment but the bar was fun and priced as you would expect. Good stay, good service and not too bad a location. 10 bucks gets you to Raffles and the tour buses pick up from here.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for Singapore touring”
Reviews.Author: dngma
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and were very happy with the accomodations booked through Priceline Name Your Own Price. Although the hotel is not in the center of the city nor in the Orchard Road shopping area, it's location close to the Singapore River and on the Hop On-Hop Off bus lines makes it a convenient location to tour the city. We walked about 1 1/2 blocks to the bus stop for the tour bus and could ride 2 different route buses back to the same location at the end of the day. Our room was spacious with a desk, chair and ottoman and very comfortable bed. Bathroom was nice with soap/shampoo provided in the oval glass shower. Breakfast was not included in our price, so we opted not to pay the high price for it and had coffee and danish we brought along in our room. We made up for that with bigger lunch, tho food is very expensive in Singapore. There are some affordable places to eat in the Suntec Center Shopping Area in the center of the city. 3 computers with free internet access are available in the lobby business center. Room internet access is not free! We would certainly stay here again if we were to return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: MIDixie
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Atrium is a beautiful building with comfortable rooms. Well sized with all amenities. We enjoyed cooling down in the pool. Breakfast was delicious. The staff was most helpful. They went out their way to assist with every request. Our flight was a midnight flight. Checking out at 10am posed some problems, but the Hotel voluanteered a late check out to 15h00. Thereafter kept our luggage and gave us acces to the pool and gym showers to refresh before our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: mms08
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn Atrium. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well maintained. A selection of pillows is available via their pillow menu. However, the location of the hotel is not good and maybe that explains why the rates in this hotel are lower. The nearest MRT station (Outram Park) is about 15 to 20 minutes walk. Most of the buses that take you to this area (1N to 6N) are not in service during the time we were in Singapore. The only bus that was in service at the time was bus 4N and we always had to wait for 45mins for the bus to arrive at Clarke Quay and Orchard Road bus stations. Overall, we had a good stay at the Holiday Inn Atrium. The room was average sized, clean and quiet. It's a good hotel for a quick Singapore get away.

Reviews.Title: “great for stopover”
Reviews.Author: lawless79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a stopover. Got in at midnight and reception staff were effecient and extremely helpful. In fact all staff were helpful and pleasant. They suggested the breakfast buffet which was good value. We were all starving so ordered room service. The food was very good and the portion sizes were massive and only managed to finish half our meals. Rooms were clean but bathrooms could have been given a bit more attention. The bedding was very comfortable. Aircon worked well and good TV service. Windows opened if you didn't like aircon. The room smelt a bit musty but not overly so. Breakfast buffet was fine and kept all the families varied tastes happy. It is not right near any public transport, the bus stop is about a 5 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly Styled Hotel”
Reviews.Author: delonvaz
Reviews.Content: As soon as you enter Holiday Inn Atrium Singapore, you will be awed by the style of the hotel. Very neat and clean. In short an excellent place to relax and enjoy peace of mind. The staff are very courteous and helpful, eager to help all the time. Great location too as most of the attractions in Singapore are not too far from this hotel. Although I did not try the lunch/dinner at this hotel, however breakfast was more than pleasing with a variety to choose from in front of some live music (not something many hotels have for breakfast). The rooms are simply excellent, comfortable and make you forget all your worries. If you are in need of some rest or simply want to lazily lie on your bed, there's no better place than the Atrium. Recommended for ease of access and comfort

Reviews.Title: “It does the job!”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: Room 902: Quick check inn, 6 lifts get you up to your floor quickly. Room 902, OK in size, comfy bed, mini bar, TV, Air con, iron/ironing board, bath a good size and plenty of hot water. Had a good nights sleep. Decor is middle of the road - not modern, but not quite old fashioned (yet) Slight musty smell on entering room 902. Breakfast buffet - plenty, good quality - (Tea and coffee man - needs to be quicker and pay attention!) Breakfast is worth having on level 4. Pool - again, not the greatest pool, but nothing wrong with it. Had a dip, quite OK. Shop - 2 shops sell all manner of snacks, drinks, magazines in the mall that is attached to the hotel. Enjoyed it - could not fault much.

Reviews.Title: “A Lazy Weekend with Friends”
Reviews.Author: anindyamandal
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, Nice Room. Location a bit away from the heart. Got a class of its own. But warmth is less. Room Service needs to be a bit fast. Breakfast spread is superb. Unique interiors. Lobby and the Bar is mind blowing. Can spend hours sitting in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: ColinG1960
Reviews.Content: The Staff at Holiday Inn go the extra distance to help your stay. You only have to ask. I found them efficient and friendly. Overall great service.

Reviews.Title: “smelly room, over price and in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: surplu4u
Reviews.Content: I stayed for business with my extended family and booked two rooms for original stays for five days. But the rooms are smelly (like moldy kind of smell from the air conditioner system) and in one of the room the bathroom stink. Told the front desk and shown another two rooms that have the same issue. I cannot sleep with the smell and decided to get another room the next day and cancelled the remaining 4 days. Hopefully Priority club will return the remaining points on the second room that i booked via award stay. Really disappointed with the stay and location of the hotel that literally in the middle of nowhere. The only nice thing is that the bfast buffet has a lot of variety. stay out of this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: I decided to try this hotel because of some good reviews, also I was looking for a hotel within a lower price range. In the end, you get what you pay for. I guess I was expecting better after reading some of the reviews. But as I found out, I can see why this hotel is cheaper than others. For one, the location is not perfect. It's far from an MRT station, you pretty much have to rely on a cab to go anywhere. The rooms have a bad choice of dark brown carpet, maybe to cover up any stains. The walls/ceiling between rooms/floors are paper thin. When someone in another room uses the bathroom, it's like they're in the same room as you. I was lucky, the 1st 2 nights were not too bad, other than the occasional bathroom noise. But the 3rd night, the room above me made an almighty noise at 2:30 am. Can't believe someone can be so inconsiderate. I suppose it reflects what kind of guests stay at this hotel, since anyone should know you shouldn't be making so much noise early in the morning. The cheap rates (S150 on weekends) makes staying at this hotel one of the attractions. I like to have as many choices of hotels in Singapore, so I can add this hotel to it. But I probably won't stay here again unless 6 or 7 other hotels have been ruled out. This hotel is cheap, but that's all it is.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irenere
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel. The staff is very helpfull and friendly. Nice pool too. Great place to wind down after a busy and warm day in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice of hotel for a transit stay.”
Reviews.Author: Skarlett123
Reviews.Content: Good standard hotel but not central to key areas. A 35 minute walk back from orchard road, about 15 minute walk toClarke Quay. Did not seem to be in an area with many restaurant choices. An issue with the room booking (had put a family of 4 into a room with 2 single beds) was dealt with quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rick56911965
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3nts on my way home to the UK from Australia. You walk into the building & wow, look straight up....never seen a hotel interior like it...amazing building !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ralphmenon
Reviews.Content: Its a combination of the Old with New. with Prompt service, and vri hospitable. Conference Rooms on Level 1 & 2 make movement easy. Entrance in the hote through the Glass Elevators give an excellent view of the Atrium and Lobby

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and very cleane but the breakfast buffet was poor”
Reviews.Author: b7reeny
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and very cleane but the breakfast buffet was poor

Reviews.Title: “Far too expensive for too low a comfort level”
Reviews.Author: Savvy111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn in end 2009 for a couple of days, on an official engagement. Paid over S$270 per day for the room. The rooms were very basic, and there was a persistent noise from the air conditioning right from my entry in the room. However, this did not get fixed despite multiple interventions over 2 hours. Finally, after a long wait and much frustration, I was given a better quality room for the next day's stay. It was a case of me having to literally demand better service. The wireless did not work as well. The location of the hotel is fairly central, though getting back there at night can be sometimes tricky (Outram Rd MRT is not exactly walking distance, nor do you find many cabs after 11 pm or so). Cabs run full in the evening. However, its a 10-12 min drive back from Orchard and should usually not be a bother. Food: The breakfast spread was good, including options for travelers from any part of the world. I had one meal in the hotel, dinner just prior to my departure, and found the Indian platter quite decent. Didn't use either the pool or the other facilities. The Atrium also has a small boutique and a trinket shop right next to its lobby, and you can pick up not only knicknacks but also some small eats there. Overall, plus on location, but not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AJW123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Holiday Inn Atrium for three weeks while in Singapore on business, I found that the although the atrium was extremely impressive the rooms left a fair bit to be desired very outdated and in desperate need of re-decorating and a bit of additional maintenance wouldn't of gone a miss as I had a light fitting fall off the wall in the middle of the night. Despite this though the staff where extremely helpful and would go out of their way to assist you if needed and all where extremely polite and friendly. The internet connection in the rooms was slow and at times refused to work all four of us working staying found this same issue which made working in and around the hotel tedious. There was always a large choice of food available at meal times however we tended to opt to go out for food but the meals I had in the hotel where all of a reasonable standard. Almost directly across and about a three minute walk away was the Singapore river if you follow this down towards the coast you find a large selection of restaurants and bars to provide plenty of alternative choices for food and drink. The closer you get to the marina the larger your you are presented with, Easy links from outside the hotel via bus and taxi to get you almost anywhere you would wish to get to China town, little India, the marina and Outrum road so plenty of possibilities to explore using the hotel as your base. Swimming pool and gym where always clean and tidy and rarely very busy, the gym was lacking a lot of equipment but provided the basics so was useable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: DetSam
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and 2 teens) and I arrived late at night and, unfortunately, no adjoining room was available for my teenage kids. Staff was very apologetic, but I think my kids rather enjoyed their bit of freedom being roomed a floor away from us. Room was great with an excellent view. Clean beds with very comfortable pillows - and I am picky about pillows. Good location if you want some peace and quiet, but not too far from public transportation; though we usually just took a taxi as we wanted to optimize our time. A bit pricey but definitely less expensive compared to other hotels of equal or even less quality. What we liked best was the warmth, friendliness and efficiency of ALL the staff. Would we go back there? Definitely - in fact we're planning to return this July 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Large but Cosy Five Star Singapore at Four star prices”
Reviews.Author: Micgwit
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Atrium Singapore We chose this hotel because it was our anniversary on February 20th and we wanted our last 2 nights in Singapore before moving on to Thailand to be special. It was! I booked a room on the executive floor, which included free snacks, wifi and free drinks from 7pm in the executive lounge on the top floor with a great view of the city. On arrival a very charming and most efficient young lady checked us in and informed us we had been upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The room was huge, with its own separate large size bedroom. There were 2 bathrooms and the most excellent views of Singapore city from the windows. The hotel itself is large but still feels “cosy”. The staff could not have been any more helpful or efficient; they were to a woman and man just perfect. On the day of our Anniversary, there was a knock at the door of our room. It was the same lovely lady that checked us in but this time holding a very large well presented basket flower arrangement comprising of Roses and Orchids with the compliments of the hotel on the occasion of our anniversary. This was way beyond normal good service. Cleanliness in the hotel was always good, the rooms were left spotless every day. I am a smoker but always book a non-smoking room because I don’t like stale smoke smells. If I want to smoke there is a perfectly good smoking area just outside the hotel front doors with a long bench and ashtrays. Inside the hotel lobby, restaurants, public and private rooms I never once encountered any odours connected with smoking. The food we ate at the hotel was always good quality and plentiful, we loved the buffet breakfast. The pool although small was perfectly adequate in size and was a wonderful way of relaxing after a long hot day of sightseeing. Snacks and drinks could be ordered by the pool and again here the staff were very pleasant and attentive. Although we did not use it, there is a free shuttle to take guests to the local transportation hubs, but a few minutes of walking takes one there anyway. This hotel is not a “cheap” hotel but it is far less expensive than most hotels in Singapore of a similar or in most cases lower standard. We are at present in Bangkok working voluntarily at an orphanage and have rented a small apartment for our extended stay. We are trying to keep our costs down here in Bangkok, (although we did splurge a little bit on the Chatrium Suites in Bangkok for our first 8 nights, which compares very favourably to the Holiday Inn Atrium in terms of quality and service.,) because we loved the Holiday Inn so much that we are planning to return for the final 5 days of our SE Asia trip at the beginning of April before flying back to the UK, if there is enough cash left in the bank!!!! I would recommend the Holiday Inn Atrium to any visitor to Singapore and am sure they will be treated as honoured guests and made to feel extremely welcome. Thank you to all the staff from the managers to the cleaners, the receptionists, waiters, chefs, bell boys and all who make the Holiday Inn Atrium a very pleasant place to stay. As a certain California Governor once said, “I’ll be back!”

Reviews.Title: “Feels good”
Reviews.Author: WindchimeWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking, I called and asked if I could view the facilities and room before making my decision, and my request was readily acceded. I think this is important; not all hotels are capable of doing this. Staff fells well-trained and able to answer my queries satisfactorily. Again, not all hotels have this. Layout of the rooms - in a semi circular design, hence very spacious common corridor - you don't have to navigate through dingy and narrow corridors. Room interior - clean, comfortable, spacious enough, cute toiletries, etc. no complaints there. Clean smell - Being a non smoker, this is important. A non-smoking floor that really has no smell. Nice pool, clean and refreshing, well-equipped gym. It is a short walk to the Singapore River, but a bit more walk needed to reach the happening places at Clarke Quay. The hotel is located next to a business complex. Pros: convenience store nearby. Cons: you see non-guests sitting around the lobby. (Although a guard does 'chase' them away politely, props to the guard tasked with this dirty job. :))

Reviews.Title: “Hub of comfort in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: KhannaGurgaon
Reviews.Content: In the world's best rated city, Singapore, this hotel is probably the most economical with all the 5 * amenities and comforts like home. Easily available taxi service, MRT nearby this hotel is well connected . Very lively ambience and smiling faces all around.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located -- Good Cuisine & Warm Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Frequent
Reviews.Content: The property is centrally located in Singapore and about one km away from MRT. The bus stop is right outside and there are good number of taxis available. The restraunt in the hotel offers good asian cuisine - indian, japanese, chinese and thai. For hotel guests, special dietary requirements are well catered to. If you buy breakfast from hotel reception, there's a 10 dollar discount and you can also advance purchase dinner to get a 10 dollar discount. There wide variety of food dishes in buffet breakfast and dinner. Moderatley priced, good quality food ! Room service is very prompt and efficient. You can get high speed internet access as part of room package deal. Hotel staff is very warm, prompt and receptive. They offer good guidance on local sight seeing and other travelling needs. Overall, very nice place to stay. I'd love to be there again !

Reviews.Title: “Super location with Very reasonable prices & Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AnupMehta
Reviews.Content: It is a hotel with good value of money .We were family of 4 with 2 teenage kids & Hotel provided extra bed without any fuss & extra charge. Nice place with good connectivity...Hotel very near to the heart of city-Orchard Road & Hotel provides shuttle for drop to Orcharad Road/Pikup,every hour 2-3 times in Morning & Evening -which is great service.

Reviews.Title: “Short and Sweet Stay”
Reviews.Author: irenemHongKong
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Holiday Inn Atrium for one night prior to flying off to Kathmandu. To reach the hotel we took the MRT from Changi airport to Outram Station 2 Singapore dollars plus one dollar returnable deposit. From there it is a 20 minute walk, but we took a taxi for 4.40 Singapore dollars because it was pouring with rain. Check in was quick and efficient. The hotel is built around a central atrium. You get a view over it as you travel up in their fancy glass lifts. You must use your hotel card to access floor 6 and above. Our room was spotlessly clean with a very comfortable double bed. They even placed a pillow menu on top of the bed. Tea and coffee making facilities were available in the rooms with quite a good selection of teas to choose from. There was lots of storage space in the room. There was a minibar and a safety deposit box. There was a large flat screen TV in the room. Free internet was not available. Internet access cost 28 Singapore dollars for 24 hours. We walked into the centre of Singapore - Clarke Quay, Boat Quay by going along the Singapore River. It took maybe around 30 minutes or so, but we went slowly looking at all the riverside bars and cafes on route. The hotel had several little convenience shops. It also had several restaurants western and Chinese but we did not eat in them . There was a very nice swimming pool on the sixth floor open from 6am to 9pm and a well equiped gym on the same floor open 24 hours. In the evening when we walked back to the hotel from Outram Station we found a street close to the hotel with lots of Chinese restaurants serving very reasonably priced food. we also passed a seven eleven near the hotel. Check out was also polite, fast and efficient. I would happily stay here again. The only downside is the 20 minute walk to the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Huge yet Homely”
Reviews.Author: RamakrishnaPai
Reviews.Content: The space-age atrium was not just a welcoming feature, it provided the launch pad for our Singapore holiday. Our room on the 17th floor was truly spacious & provided every comfort. Luckily, even though our reservation for 3 adults had specified king bed (+ spare bed), it turned out to have 3 separate beds which made our 5-night stay all the more restful. I paid about SGD 350 per night, inclusive of taxes & breakfast. A reasonable price for a hotel which is quite luxurious. Added touches like electronic safe, bathrobes, etc., made it even better than the other Holiday Inn - Kensington Forum (London) where I've stayed. Free internet too @ the business centre. While the hotel is a little far from the nearest MRT, taxis are freely available & turned out to be, mostly, cheaper too for our family trips. The local taxi drivers are very friendly, polite & simply don't expect a tip. I could glimpse the extended Skypark deck of the futuristic Marina Bay Sands from my hotel window & also watched the xenon searchlights scour the sky one night. The helpful concierge & attentive housekeeping staff were like icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: garyinternational
Reviews.Content: Well, Singapore is Singapore. This is my 3rd stay at the Atrium and I love it. Great food, Great people, Great position, Great hotel. A building is a building, a room is a room, but its the people that make the difference. They have great eating places, a great strip mall next door, and is located near to everything. I really approve

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Atrium, big rooms, difficult transport”
Reviews.Author: LaPlanche86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the Singapore river, north of the city center. It is kind of far away from the attractions but this isn't necessarily an disadvantage! When you walk from the Hotel to the city center, you pass a lot of nice restaurants which are located along the Singapore River. Despite the long walking distances, the hotel offers a free shuttle bus to the next MRT station. Check-In was ok. Not very fast but the agents were very friendly and answered all my questions. Unfortunately my credit card wasn't accepted or it didn't work. The failure was due to the hotel's system. Further, I got an upgrade to the Executive Floor. The room itself is very big. The views are nice as every room on a floor has a different view into a different direction. It was clean, although not spotless clean. I found a few black hair in the bathroom. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Since the first day, the waitress in the Executive Lounge remembered my drinks. Breakfast is a bit disappointing. I think I have to get used to the little choice as I might be a bit spoiled as a German. Check-out was efficient but there was one concern. I bought the upsell package, which included internet, breakfast and lounge. Unfortunately, the internet was credited to my bill additionally. That had to be sorted out. When you connect to the internet you can chose between pay per use and monthly flat rate. An option for the upsell package is not included which is weird. Further, you can get free WiFi almost everywhere in Singapore, though I don't understand why the hotel still charges for it.

Reviews.Title: “Degraded”
Reviews.Author: kd2011
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on line, impressed by the massive atruim image that displays in the website. Little were we aware of that its more than what meets the eye. After staying at Holiday inn Orchard for seven nights we decided to explore this holiday Inn too, for its good location. It started with the day we checked in, no bellman approached us at the hotel foyer, at the time of check in the reception staff was unprofessional to the core, we were waiting for 15 mins until we checked in.The lobby looked gloomy with a wierd smell that really puts you off. Lots can be done to improve the atrium lobby. The room was below 4 star standards, the bath tub & the curtain were having a wierd smell. The bed squeaks when you sleep. The room was also smelling good. The restaurant services looked substandard. The icing on the cake was on the day of checkout at around 10 am, someone knocks a "Do not disturb" door hard, thrice & rings the door bell continously. I was half asleep & my wife was in the shower. when i opened the door, a housekeeping lady who could barely speak english asked Check out? check out? I mean this was the least I was expecting from a group like Holiday inn, specially when we just had such a wonderful stay at the orchard. To add on there was ample amount of flesh available from 9 pm onwards, i believe the hotel earns its living by encouraging the same. I would definately not recommend this hotel to families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneJohno
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst attending a conference with my work. I thought it was excellent. The hotel and conference sentre is very good, Staff are friendly and the Restaurant and Bar are first class. Would not hesitate to stay here again on future visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Travelsalot050
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2007 and it is just as good as my last stay. The breakfast buffet is comprehensive. Rooms are comfortable with panoramic views. Staff are very friendly. They even brought in an international choir to sing Christmas carols in the lobby. My only issue is the prohibitive price for Internet access (S$28 per day). They do have a Business Center with 3 terminals. Unfortunately they were very busy and often unavailable. During our stay we several times noted one ignorant man who spent a considerable time on the 'net while his son was playing video games on another terminal. Go to Great World City (turn left on Havelock Road) and walk for 5 minutes. Excellent shopping center with food supplies (Supermarket). A small convenience store is located just outside the hotel and open till 3am. The hotel is about 600 meters from Outram Park MRT and serviced by several bus lines. The pool area on level 6 is very good. Two pools, main and kiddies also have a fitness center collocated. It may not be on Orchard Rd but they are definitely worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: atulsodhi
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayed for 4 nights at the end of Dec 2010 at this hotel. We were there at the peak year end period. We were looking for a hotel that had all the facilities and at the same time not too expensive. after some research this hotel seemed the right choice. no regrets. comfortable and good size rooms. good breakfast. response times at the reception were slow - but no big deal, as we were on a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: MarkLaurence
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an incredibly impressive atrium and the rooms seem large and comfortable. It is across the road and a short walk from the Singapore River and not that far from Robinson's Quay and Clarke Quay. I walked along the river each day to get where I was going - Chinatown, Orchard Road, Little India and Fort Canning Park. I think it is a good hotel but I really think there are others that are better located - The Swissotel Merchants Court or Novotel. It all depends on what sort of traveller you are. I prefer to walk where possible and frankly the Holiday Inn is not in the centre of things. The pool area is a bit ordinary but that was not a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “affordable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Snowie4
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Holiday Inn a couple of times now. They have great service very nice people. The locations great its pretty close to everywhere and the rooms are relatively affordable. They've got cheap massage places and manicures just downstairs from the hotel which was really good. The Buffet breakfast was great. The hotel lounge had a great live band when we were there. ^^

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: aussie912
Reviews.Content: Nicely placed between the shopping precinct of Orchard Road and Chinatown. Our bed was very comfortable. The room was a perfect size for the two of us. The service was excellent. As this was my husbands first trip overseas this hotel catered for all our needs at a reasonable price. There is a shuttle bus that takes you to Orchard Rd and other stops along the way. Coming out of the lobby you can cross the road and walk along the river and see the restaurants along the way. Perfect place to stay..

Reviews.Title: “ok but the air freshener was a killer....”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are trying very hard to please but are struggling with an old property. The hotel is in a very bad location that is not close to anything at all, the rooms are old, small and the worst thing of this hotel is all the air freshener that they spray everywhere in the hotel, the freshener that they sprayed into my hotel room as so so strong that I could not sleep all night and it gave me a terrible headache, i had to check out the following day. I did sample the hotels room service and this was excellent. The room were not suited to the business traveler, desk was far to small for anyone to work under, I couldn't get my legs under the desk with the chair, also TV was located right above the desk, so it was impossible to watch a bit of TV while working at the desk, so as far as doing some work in the room there was no chance, also internet was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation really bad ! Also Overpriced !”
Reviews.Author: Lumex87
Reviews.Content: As i stayed in this Hotel in the beginning of Dec i didnt really know what ive booked. I read all the reviews here first and thought it should be a good deal. I booked over the Holiday Inn Hotline and they promised me over my gold ambassador status an free room upgrade to executive floor. As I arrived nobody knew anything, they even needed to call the Manager twice after then telling me that there is no opportunity to give me an upgrade. We got an Deluxe Double Bed Room - seems like last renovation was in the 70s or 80s ! Really old Floor - old Furniture and small windows . The only nice thing was a lcd tv and the view out of the room ! We decided to get ourself an executive room and pay a little more , so we moved the next day to an room on the 25th floor (out of 26). Now - everyone who thinks the room is bigger or newer, let me say that - on the original Holiday Inn Website they even tell you that the Executive Rooms are newly renovated - haha bad thought. Same small Room, same old Furniture , same TV, same small bathroom wheres no place. We moved out the same Day , its not only the renovation what the hotel needs real soon, i didnt really felt comfortable there, the staff was unfriendly and service was bad. Im OK with walking 15min from Outram MRT station to the Hotel, or relax at the Hotel Pool which is really nice, but if you wanna enjoy your Holidays in Singapore you should think 2 if u wanna spend your money there or get a better hotel for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriceced and bad service”
Reviews.Author: vikingBeijing77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of renovation and still charges more than better hotels in the city. My room was dated, wardrobe door jamming and general feel of early 80's hotel. On top I was charges 28$++ for Internet despite being Platinium member, 270$++ for a room without Breakfast I would get better and cheaper in 4 star hotel in Bay area or Orchard road. On top the front desk service was terrible, waiting 15 minutes wihout getting result, and later found out they mislead me about the Invoice, despite asking twice. My advise; if you pay that amount of money, there are better options in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “holdiday inn, a place to live”
Reviews.Author: velkumar
Reviews.Content: holiday inn atrium, is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in. right from the ambience inside the hotel, the rooms, food provided, the location of the hotel, all at their best. well connected by bus and rail as well. all other facilities like the swimming pool, laundry etc were as well at their best.if you ever happen to visit singapore, make sure u stay at holiday inn atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Never knew Holiday Inn could be THIS good!”
Reviews.Author: PumaHammar
Reviews.Content: Had to take my daughter on an emergency hospital visit to Singapore. It helped a lot to stay in such super comfort. Booked the "superior" room through the Changi Airport Hotel Reservations at a great rate. Couldn't have been happier. All from room, cleanliness and service to the breakfast buffet were nothing short of fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooning? Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: Mangala25
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel, if your traveling on business of with a large family. But if you want to travel with your husband or wife, please think twice. You don't want small kinds making noise while you want to have a peaceful meal at the restaurant. You don't want to bump into annoying large family crowds who are all over the place. Our room wasn't ready and we were made to wait for an hour at the lobby. It was the start of our Honeymoon. From the day we checked in were were waiting to check out! terrible hotel for a couple ( I stress on that)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.....ok location”
Reviews.Author: ashley-sayer
Reviews.Content: The holiday inn atrium is a nice hotel, the room was good although a little dated, but everything in there was working perfectly especially the much needed air conditioning. The front desk staff were very helpful, as were the other staff that worked there. My only problem with this hotel was its location. It is a fair walk to the MRT station, and this meant I got a taxi everytime I left the hotel, luckily taxi's are very cheap and the hotel has 4/5 always waiting outside. The pool area was lovely, although saying that there was building work going on next door which meant there was a stream of scruffy builders hauling roof lining and other materials alongside the pool which wasn't any bother for me but could be annoying for some, especially if your enjoying a quiet relaxing break. The hotel has a nice lobby and friendly concierge and was a pleasant experience. I did have room service one night, which was very prompt, but i was very disappointed in my Chicken fried rice dish, which was extremely disappointing considering the large price. I Didn't eat much of it, so wouldn't recommend it. Apart from that ( which is as much down to my personal taste as to the quality of the food) the Hotel is great, and is perfect if your prepared to pay out to travel in a taxi ( which is usually great in the hot weather)

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: arniebe
Reviews.Content: arrived after a long flight from amsterdam at 0630 am arrived at the hotel to drop off luggage .asked if we could leave luggage here before we booked in at 1400 hr that day i was told that if we wanted to go to our room it was ready for us realy happy with that room was exelent good buffy breakfast on our last nite we had a buffy hot and cold dinner in the restaurant good food value for your buck staff verry helpfull could do not enough for you great hotel to stay would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark1403
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in nothing was a problem for the staff. We had a quick check in. Asked for a room on a higher floor..."no problems". Breakfast and dinner smorgasbord was excellent and well priced for a hotel. The pool was great, nice temperature. We even used the laundry, had a problem with the washing powder dispenser, made a call and someone was up to fix it in 5 minutes. The Concierge was helpful, nothing was a problem. For me it was 5 star service by a four star hotel. Thanks everyone at the Holiday Inn Atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but don't use the internet!!”
Reviews.Author: GS33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good value for money. Its location isn't great (a short trip to Orchard Street) but taxis are cheap. Hotel is OK, rooms are reasonable quality but a little dated. Very typical of Holiday Inn with a bog bed. What ever you do do not use their wifi. They charge per minute and although I tried to be as quick as possible it still ended up being expensive. Holiday Inn Atrium if you are staying in Singapore for a few days and get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marc1946
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Holiday Inn at 8.30 pm, and was given a room straight away, which was great as I was tired after a night flight. I was only staying one night, but because I had a night flight the next day I asked for a late check out, they told me I could stay till 2 Pm, I could stay till 6pm for half a room rate or longer for a full room rate. I opted for the 2pm check out, and so spent some more time shopping, and also lying by the pool. The room was ok, getting a little tired. The bed was very comfortable, also the room was very quiet, so no complaints. When I checked in they asked if I wanted breakfast for S$22.-- which was fine by me. The next morning after a very good breaffast, they presented me with the bill, which was to my surprise S$37,--. I mentionted the price difference, was told that when I checked out the price would be S$22.-- which was correct. So if you want breakfast order in advance for S$22.00 it will save you some money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and location”
Reviews.Author: DaveCarlsbad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times during the past five years. The staff is excellent - very friendly and helpful. After a couple of stays theyremeber you and always take time to say hello. If there is ever an issue it is quickly resolved. The entire management team is very approachable, they truly care that you enjoy your stay. I like the location as it is in a little quieter area but very easy to walk to shopping, chinatown and many restaurants. Although the upscale restaurant in the hotel has very good food. Rooms are a nice size and clean. Highly recommend if you are looking for a hotel that provides consistent value and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Some fine tuning needed to lift the standard”
Reviews.Author: Pethouse
Reviews.Content: We were two couples who stayed 2 nights. The hotel is a good comfortable 4* standard as far as rooms, cleanliness, facilities etc. goes. The location is a little away from the action, forcing you to walk, get taxis or plan around the shuttle bus which is not too frequent. Taxis are relatively cheap but beware of the "add ons" in Singapore taxis which can double the fare very easily for - peak times charge, congested city roads charge, airport surcharge. If you go back and forth a little it can add to the hotel price significantly and it may be better to consider a more central hotel where you can walk to shops etc. even though you may pay a little more for a room. Two things we didn't like was being told by driveway/door staff that we didn't need to take our passport as we left to go to the the new casino when we did need to. We were refused entry because we didn't have it with us so the trip was wasted. Public contact staff should know that sort of detail for guests. Secondly we watched a stream of youngsters - many apparently underage, flow through the hotel lobby on Friday night to buy cheap liquor at a minimart in the hotel shopping arcade so they could get "primed" before they went to nearby niteclub (not associated with the hotel). We didn't think a 4* hotel should tolerate that type of traffic through the main lobby as it dragged the amenity down somewhat. All in all though for the price it was a good value stay and I would recommend with some warnings.

Reviews.Title: “amazed”
Reviews.Author: nagpalrajan
Reviews.Content: travelled wid my wife, it was my first visit to Singapore..Beautiful property, good food and amazing services...MUST STAY... also the location it really good, its close to orchard road, street known for shopping and brand stores.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gops15
Reviews.Content: A very good high rise hotel. Our room on the 26th floor provided an marvellous view of the Singapore skyline. The reception was efficient and quick. The room was spacious with a good size bathroom and safe. Clean as expected in Singapore. The breakfast was outstanding. Lot of choices and freshly done. After a long tiring day it was very very comfotable to sink in the bed and enjoy a nice sleep. Taxi's were easily available. The nearest MRT was Outram park. About 15mins walk. We were ok with it while some are not. Overall a unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “The 21 storey WOW”
Reviews.Author: dSParmar
Reviews.Content: I have always loved the name, Holiday Inn and it was chrised more when I booked myself and family to the Holiday Inn Singapore and what a hotel, u would fall back if u watch it from the close. Hotel is located in the central singapore, easy access to fanous land marks, Marina bay was visible from my room Good buffet Its a very good hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: smitamenon2005
Reviews.Content: My trip to Singapore was sudden. And when I was placed in Holiday Inn ,I was to share the room with a colleague. I was not at all happy about it. But when i stepped my foot inti thr room I was Floored. The room was not just comfortable but much more. The hotel provides you an option to choose your pillows or to choose if you want the bed to be made or not. The other best part was the breakfast. I just fellow in the love with the pancakes and the assortment of breads. The only hitch is the MRT is not walkable! But otherwise its a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Lift is cool.....”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for business and it was fine. Had not gone through with the HI renovations at that stage. The TV was the old style. The lift was probably the best feature of the hotel. Buffet breakfast is average.

Reviews.Title: “it is just great”
Reviews.Author: taganottingham73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel September 14-17 2010 with my mum and we were upgraded to the higher floor (23rd floor) the room is spacious, clean, with fantastic view and very comfy beds with one double bed and one single bed. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and i would love to go back and stay in this hotel... Thank you for the upgrade...cheers...

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for a family trip!”
Reviews.Author: Doudou2004
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and a 5-year-old son. The experience has been great! - When we checked in, they assigned me a room with a double bed and a single bed. Perfect for us! I even did not realize they had this sort of room. - The room was very clean. Although the hotel was old, you can tell they try to make it spotless. - A lot of choices at the buffet breakfast. Kids eat free. Not sure whether this is their formal policy. But they did not charge my son's breakfast. - The only downside is there were many girls (professionals) waiting at the lobby in the evening. Good my son was young so I i did not explain all these to him.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roundtheworld
