Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights after a cruise. We were able to check in to our room in the morning which was much appreciated. The room was clean and comfortable but the decor is certainly dated. The non smoking is strictly enforced on these floors. The hotel lobby is huge and not very interesting, the people are very helpful and we were always able to get a taxi when needed. We took the breakfast once and it was fine but quite pricey. We did not find the location convenient for the metro however taxis were very reasonably priced and reliable although there were a few mysterious surcharges. However the location is better than some may lead you to believe. We walked across the road to the river and down along the river to Clarke Quay where there are many restaurants. Walking around Singapore feels very safe and pleasant. We also turned left as you leave the hotel and walked for about 10 minutes and found an excellent shopping centre where there is a Marks and Spencer, British India and Zara etc. Great shopping with far less crowds. The hotel price was reasonable for Singapore where we found hotel prices to be pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, would saty here again”
Reviews.Author: kat_nick2010
Reviews.Content: hotel was lovely - clean, friendly and helpful staff. location wasn't the greatest, but within walking distance of the river so not that bad. good value :)

Reviews.Title: “70s Wonderland”
Reviews.Author: camsean
Reviews.Content: Architecturally, this is an interesting building. Many hotel reviewers dislike the atrium style of building, claiming it is too noisy. For those interested in modern architecture, however, this is a striking example of the type. The interior of the building rises level after level, like the interior of a movie spaceship. Dating from the end of the 1970s, it is too modern to be regarded as a heritage building, but twenty years from now, it may well be. But if the 70s heritage is the best point of this hotel, it is also the source of some of its problems. The rooms are poky by modern standards and the decor is sadly showing its age. Both these points will undoubtedly disappoint some visitors. On the other hand, the Club Lounge offered both excellent views and very good food. This was one of the best points of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: mms77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Atrium for 5 nights. My husband and I had our 4 year old daughter and they let us have a child's cot in the room for free. They have a good selection of pillows at no extra cost. And they have lots of free shuttle buses going into popular parts of Singapore. The only thing I was unhappy about was the smell of cockroaches in our bathroom that seemed to be coming from the sink and never went away. And they failed to restock our bathroom with toilet paper and it took quite a while for them to deliver the rolls. The buffet breakfast was alright, the location is not walkable to anywhere. But you can easily take a cab or their shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and useful”
Reviews.Author: ianwyj
Reviews.Content: Checked in for 2 nights in order to be nearer to another hotel where I was attending a conference. Price-wise, I felt that it was reasonably set for the location. Check-in was relatively simple although I did have to wait about an hour for my room to be ready. My booking was for a high room but I ended up getting one only on the 7th floor. Apparently, only smoking rooms on the high floors were left but being a local, I didn't really mind this too much. The room was comfortable and nicely furnished although it was showing its age a little. Found the bed a little too firm for my liking and there was sometimes a strange smell in the toilet but otherwise, the facilities were reasonable. I liked the breakfast spread (good omelettes) and I just wish I had had a little more time to enjoy it every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Amenities, Great Location, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: JetAirwaysLover
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is in the heart of the city, with everything very near in proximity. The hotel has some very very good facilities and amenities, including Shopping, Health Spa, etc. The service is fantastic, it was a pleasure to have stayed in this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near quay”
Reviews.Author: JIANGCH
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Holiday Inn Atrium for 3 nights. Very nice rooms, friendly service, great breakfast and price is right. short walk to the quay and lots of offers over there. Easy access to all locations, getting a taxi is easy from the hotel. I will definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for city break / business”
Reviews.Author: Stuart W
Reviews.Content: Slightly out of the centre of town, but easy to get in by cab (which are cheap) or public transport. The hotel's a big 28 floor holiday inn, on the edge of the city CBD, which has easy walking to areas like Clarke Quay, where the bars and restaurants are. The rooms are spacious and service is typically high standard as you'd expect in an Asian hotel. The only slight downside is that due to the design of the hotel, if there's something happening in the bar (such as the world cup) which will be noisy, then the noise will resonate up through the central atrium and reach your room. This is rare though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a citytrip”
Reviews.Author: statetrooper61
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Atrium offers the perfect service for a city trip. We stayed three nights during our way back from Bali to Europe. Although the rooms could be renovated in the near future, everything was very clean and the service was perfect. We were upgraded to a higher category and on the day of our departure we were offered to leave our baggage in the hotel and use the facilities in the spa in the afternoon to refresh for our trip back to Europe. I would choose to stay there again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Economically Priced, Clean.”
Reviews.Author: dutseal
Reviews.Content: We only paid USD 100 plus 17% tax for this room so we did not expect much. The city was overbooked so we had no choice but to take this hotel..the reason I say it is because it's far from the main highlights. Taxi costs about $5-$7 to the nearest point on Orchard road, which was Marriott hotel area. Room was adequately sized, restroom was plain but clean. Service was excellent. All in all, for the value of the money, this is considered very good....UNLIKE the experience we had at the Traders Hotel Singapore! What a nightmare. The only weird thing was the king size bed was actually two full size bed (not twin) joined together and you can feel the slight hump in the middle of the bed. But otherwise the bed was big and quite comforable.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mysofttoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days and the stay was extremely comfortable. The hotel has a shuttle service to the Orchard Road which is really helpful as this hotel is not located exactly in the shopping area. The hotel looks great and has a few shops in the hotel complex itself. The famous nightclub 'Zouk' is just hop, skip n jump from the hotel. The staff is good and efficient and this hotel is definately high on my priority list...

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBustin
Reviews.Content: The first thing to learn about the Holiday Inn Atrium is never, ever ask them to collect you from the airport. The hotel is quite far from the nearest metro station, so I had called them to try and arrange a pick-up from Changi Airport. They wanted $80 for the privilege, when a shuttle was $9 and a taxi approx. $25. Check-in was smooth and efficient. Had a room on the 25th floor, so spectacular views from a nice room. Dinner was good, they have a nice bar (with friendly staff) in the foyer. The main thing that lets the hotel down is the location - otherwise a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: liveforever
Reviews.Content: Hopefully the title of my review sums it up - the Holiday Inn Atrium did the job for me in that I got a decent night's sleep, but I'm not sure I'd stay there again. The one thing it has going for it is a great rate compared to other Intercontinental chain hotels in Singapore. There was nothing overly bad with the hotel, just a few little bits and pieces: - The staff are relatively cold - few smiles, few words during check-in/check out, and otherwise seem to be absent. Not to say they are rude - Location - the closest MRT is a 10-20min walk which was a real hassle as it meant a taxi to/from any time I wanted to leave - The rooms are quite small even though I was upgraded "Executive Room" on the top floor. - The hotel is quite dated although ther have been some updates to furniture and fittings recently it seems. Again, I make it sound like this hotel isn't great, but I'm just comparing to other newer more central hotels. If you can look over the above, it's a good hotel for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: happyonoliday
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Singapore and booked this hotel as we usually know what you're getting with a Holiday Inn room - boy were we wrong! To start with the hotel is VERY dated. Add to that that on a 3 night break we had to change rooms 5 times. Not the best when you don't have a lot of time. The first two rooms we were shown were very dated and smelt very damp. My partner has asthma therefore not ideal. We finally accepted the third room - however as were getting to bed the AC broke (!) so we had to move to another room at about midnight. Again the room we were moved smelt very damp and dusty (staff agreed it smelt) but we were so tired we accepted it on the condition that we would be moved the next day. Anyway, come the next day the room we were told we would get had been allocated to someone else so again we were given a old, musty room. At this point we were really annoyed and spoke to the manager - who then upgraded us to a suite. The suite was fine however we didn't want the upgrade - we just wanted a clean standart holiday inn room! It seems the higher up the floors you go the better the rooms are. My advice - aim for floor 18 and above. I have to say though that the staff were pleasant and helpful during the who process. In terms of location - its about a 20 min walk to Outram Park station - and from there it is a few stops to Orchard road etc. Beware of the surcharges applied by the cab drivers - we were told it was 35% but the cab driver had picked it up by 50%! When we questioned it he went back to the 35%! And this was a cab we took from outside the hotel lobbey!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Narayantravelogue
Reviews.Content: Good room and services, however the location is inconvenient in terms of connectivity to MRT the lifeline of Singapore. Old hotel bvut impressive, particularly the atrium as the name suggests. Rooms are comfortable, but bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: Located at the junction of Havelock Road & Outram Road, this hotel is located opposite the busstop for Orchard Road etc.. Its about a 10 minute drive to China Town.. Only disadvantage is a 10 minute walk to the nearest MRT station (Outram Park) but otherwise well worth the money.. Rooms are very large and well appointed.. The large spacious lobby, circular room arrangement & the atrium with 5 elevators gleaming like pearls on a string lend a magical appeal.. Large lobby with ample sitting area makes for a good setting for a relaxed coffee meet in the lobby and extended bar area with live music everyday.. The breakfast was good with a large spread.. Their lunch & dinner buffet seems to be very popular even with the locals and features a wide selection from across Asia.. Stayed here for 6 nights and not too much to complain about..

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rikki7
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a business trip. While I could manage my baggage myself, there was no staff offering assistance getting in and out of the taxi and into the lobby. Lobby had a large chart showing the draw and results of the World Cup, which was screening in the hotel lounge at all hours of the day and night. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Could not fault it at all. Would definitely stay again for business or would recommend this hotel to others for the same. Buffet breakfast was pretty much what you would expect from a large international hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “It was a very nice hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Sheetal1970
Reviews.Content: We ahd gone for a leisure trip during diwali vacations last year. the stay was nice. the hotel rooms and service was also excellent. We were 5 persons of the family and enjoyed it. There was not much of breakfast in Indian side. Otherwise the location was good and the hotel was also nice. It was a pleasant trip overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, very bad exterior”
Reviews.Author: Adnan74
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel wasn't bad, but when u you are reaching the the hotel and the taxi driver tells you that's your hotel, than u go DAAA!! black windows, very dirty look but as soon as you step inside, its totally different. The best part of the hotel is the lobby. As soon as we reached after a night long flight, the room wasn't ready, cleaning was still going on and we had to wait for almost an hour. The rooms are pretty small. congested.! Breakfast was good, which was in our package. The staff at reception be it the main or breakfast they were nice, others weren't that polite. specially the concierge = very rude. Basically i wont recommend this hotel, but cause of the price if you wanna go, than its ok. The pool area, needs alot of work as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Holiday”
Reviews.Author: greatholiday39
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my family for 4 nights and 5 days. Checking in was lousy as rooms were getting cleaned at 3 pm and had to wait for 1 hour. However, were upgraded to a deluxe room on the 19th floor with a great view. Rooms are big and clean. Housekeeping services are slow. You need to call 2-3 times to get what you want. Breakfast was very good. Wide slection was there. Glass Lifts in the hotel are excellent. Concierge is very helpful. There is a small shopping mall at the basement. A verygood store is there which keeps all useful items. Taxis are easily available from the hotel and any ride is about $ 5 only. Free shuttle services to Orchard available, but didinot get to catch the shuttle as timings are odd. Free shuttle to Universal Studios available which was useful. Overall a good hotel for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “just the way I wanted it to be”
Reviews.Author: bipsKol
Reviews.Content: Clean & Spacious rooms, Good Breakfast, Nice Staff. All in all we are absolutely happy with our choice to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: zaijulha
Reviews.Content: good ambience n clean,spacious room for 4 of us..nice view from the 18th floor. the staff was helpful n nice,easy to get taxi,just in front of the entrance. free shuttle bus to universal studio singapore,we had a great time there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shabbier than the online photos but decent 4 star overall”
Reviews.Author: knvh
Reviews.Content: One of the better 4 * in Singapore and good value for money, its usually less expensive than the more centrally located H-Inn @ Park View. Its next to some luxury car dealerships which can make for some interesting window shopping if you are into that sort of thing. What we liked best were the laundry facilities where you don’t pay per item but rather per load [self-service]. So its S$1 for the washer, $1 for the dryer, $1 for the detergent for a total of S$3 for over a dozen items which can’t be beat at most 4 or 5 * hotels in the city. You’ll need to get coins from the lobby/front desk since the common laundry room is on the 3rd floor at the same level as the gym & pool. It would be nicer if we could either use our room keycards to pay for the laundry or have a change machine near the laundry room itself. The basement has a bunch of little shops that offer all kinds of reflexology treatments that avg out to around S$0.50/min compared to $1/min elsewhere in the city [e.g., orchard road]. You can also get prepaid SIM cards in the basement which is useful for foreign guests. The lobby looks fantastic in the photos [read as 5 * level] but is a bit grungy in reality [4 * quality] with none of the ’gloss or sheen’ in the images. So don’t be mislead by how nice the lobby looks! Many rooms do NOT include the buffet breakfast which we totally misunderstood at check-in. The person at the front desk mumbled something like ’you are welcome to the daily breakfast till 10am’. When I clarified if it ’came with the room’, they confirmed. We should have rechecked since we assumed he meant it was included in the cost. Only at check-out we got a shock at being billed for the breakfast which we would run for @ 9.55am since we were still a bit jet lagged. Had we known it was additional, we could have calmly slept in and gone for a nice meal nearby instead. It was S$20 [approx Rs. 680] per person + taxes in 2008 but you should expect over $25pp++ by the time you visit. The glass elevators are a good test for your vertigo! I forced myself to look down as long as possible to try to oversome the sensation. Its not as scary going up for some reason... Pros:Laundry room, cheap reflexology in basement, location, value Cons:breakfast NOT included, lobby looks worse than photos EVen though this may be true for most hotels, to put this in perespective Holiday Inn had the largest gap between the online photos and reality so it was very noticeable and a let down as we walked into the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “VERY STYLISH HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SCREENCNAME
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my parents and brother in this hotel. this is a very stylish hotel with a very good lobby having an atrium which gives the name of the hotel. the glass lifts in the atrium add to the beauty of the hotel. the hotel is located in a happening place and the bus stops are bang opposite to the hotel. the train station is also nearby and the hotel itself is having a free shuttle service to various places in the city. the rooms were very very comfortable and the staff were very friendly. we enjoyed our stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel near the city and sightseen”
Reviews.Author: bhupen_888
Reviews.Content: We have stay at this hotel four two days, Its building is vary good and all the facility are available in this hotel. I can not say more abt because all the things and facility are available in this hotel , For satying this hotel its fantasic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with nice food, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: biztraveller012
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a value for money with convenient location and decent food option though limited. It is very close to Sentosa as well as Clarke Quay and Orchard Road though slightly off the main shopping hub - but that allows it to bring down the rate charged. Only problem we faced was that the room key had to be recharged every day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 4figgis
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Room was OK. Swimming pool area needs refurnishing, loungers cushions were dirty and tatty. We found the breakfast was very poor by Holiday Inn standards and after some discussions we were not charged for them.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel for a great price in singapore”
Reviews.Author: raviivar
Reviews.Content: the hotel is great for singapore.. location is a bit off from the main streets but taxi's are available and a great hotel for a great price... rooms were excellent and clean bathrooms.. great views and good location..

Reviews.Title: “The nicest Holiday I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: ferien_uk
Reviews.Content: Location: Easily reached by taxi, but otherwise not the easiest to get to. On leaving I walked to the nearest train station to get to the airport. It was manageable, but only because I am used to walking long distances with my backpack. With a lot of luggage, a taxi would be a better idea. ************************************************* ********* Rooms: The rooms are very nice. They have large windows, although the view will vary depending on whereabouts your room is located. Some people might have views of building sites! All rooms have TVs, which show a large amount of English-language programmes and films. The bathrooms are spacious and well-maintained. ************************************************* ********* Facilities: There is a rooftop pool, which I went in everyday around 3 o clock and had it to myself most days. There was also a gym with treadmills and some other equipment, although I didn't use it so I can't actually remember what it was. ************************************************* ********* Dining: When booking, there were two price options: either with or without the breakfast. I opted to go for the breakfast, as having a buffet breakfast is one of my favourite things about staying in hotels. There was a very good selection of Western-style breakfast foods and some Asian foods. There were also some muffins and pastries, so I was able to sneak something out to have later for my lunch (I'm sure I'm not the only one who does this!). ************************************************* ********* Overall Recommendation: I have stayed in a fair few Holiday Inns, and this was by far the best. The overall design of the lobby area was amazing, the rooms were a very good size, and I had a fairly good view (not fantastic during the day as I could mainly just see other hotels, but it looked a lot more impressive at night). There was also a free shuttle bus from the hotel which drops you off a couple of different locations in the area, which I found very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: superman_lover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore for one night in May 2010. The hotel looked like it was in need of some decoration. Once you get over the futuristic looking lifts there isnt much else about the hotel- except the service and hard work of the staff. The hotel 10-15mins walk from Clarke Quay, which is a great place to have a drink or dine. As I only stayed one night there isnt much detail in the review. The hotel can be best summed up as ...............Average

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel!”
Reviews.Author: M0ntyM
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building, with good rooms. Good location, with a subway station just a 5-minute walk away. They usually give free welcome drink coupons that can be redeemed at the sports bar. Staff is very friendly and helpful, and they facilitate early check-ins and late check-outs.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money....don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddy33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Value for money and located near important land marks. rooms were decent. However, the service is very average. When we arrived, there was no one at entrance to take our luggage. We had to drag it ourselves to reception. Food is also heavily priced. But due to location you can easily walk to nearby wall and have food there. It's good if you plan to spend most of day sightseeing or other activities.

Reviews.Title: “good budget stay, gr8 location”
Reviews.Author: Ritesh_wanderer
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with good facilities. The staff is helpful and warm. Only thing is that they will replenish the dishes if you get late for the breakfast. You can get a hotel shuttle to almost all the attractions in singapore. Overall a good place to stay with good connectivity to all locations

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, and well priced.”
Reviews.Author: JINXStAndrews
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days with my wife and daughter in march 2010.If you travelling to Singapore I couldn`t recommend this hotel more highly. If you are able, and enjoy walking or using the local public transport as my wife and I do this is the place to stay. The lobby is awesome and the rooms are excellent, mirroring the service. As stated it is a little out of the centre but this adds to the fun of exploring somewhere new. Public transport is ridiculously cheap.If you do stay the breakfast is worth the extra expense, every taste in the world catered for. Incredible hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Southend, Campbeltown, Mull of Kintyre, Scotland
Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billandlinda
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay in this hotel. The rooms are large with great amenities - use of the fridge in room is very useful. Everywhere is soooo clean and we found the staff very helpful indeed. Food was good (breakfast only). Only thing was the charge for Internet use - this was 28$ singapore for 24 hours but not very economical if you only want to check your emails. Good sized swimming pool and fitness room with plenty of towels available. There is a free bus to Sentosa Island and the 'Round Singapore Tour' just a short walk away. Shopping mall (with great food court) also very handy. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable well appointed and user friendly hotel - Holiday Inn atrium Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: surfie999
Reviews.Content: While rooms are not as large as some others, they are certainly well equipped with a appropriate sized lcd TV, acccess to broadband and the usual amenities in the rooms. The desk has a good work light, an adjustable functional work chair and the beds are comfortable and rooms quiet. They have an ironing board for last minute shirt preparation and, importantly a guest laundry [ $S5], which is very handy. Tthere is a pool suitable for lap swimming plus a well equipped gym, both with long operating hours. The buffet breakfast is excellent value and the food is also tasty, with with the usual range of food for this class of hotel. They do a good coffee! Have stayed numerous times over the past 2 years, and each time has been a good experience. Check-in and check-out was quick and well handled; staff have been pleasant and courteous in all areas. Free broadband would be a welcome plus; many others offer this now! The hotel is well served by buses giving easy access to most city areas, with stops very close nearby; within walking distance of several hawker / food centres; there are shopping malls also close by, but not immediately adjacent. The general area is a bit quieter than in central areas with the Riverside area a good area for walking or jogging; Chinatown is close by. Has been a very suitable and good value hotel; would expect to continue patronage when in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: asadolphin
Reviews.Content: To me the Atrium it is a standard Holiday Inn, the rooms are a bit run down but nice and clean . If you don't want to pay for internet in your room you are welcome to use the business centre next to the front desk which is open daily. Breakfast is very nice and I have to say one of the better ones for a Holiday Inn that I have experienced (and I do stay 40-50 nights/year with ichotel group). The only downside for breakfast is if you arrive after 0900 you will have to wait for a while before getting seated as they run out of seats very quickly. The room service menu is good and price worthy. The hotel staff are very service minded and will go out of their way to assist you. The hotel is within walking distance from China town and also Clark Quay and if you follow the river towards Clark Quay you will pass several wonderful restaurants and bars. Personally I prefer taking a taxi rather than the metro and in Singapore taxis are very cheap. Regardless if you want to go to Orchard Road, Sentosa, Marina Bay you are not looking at paying more than around 5-8 dollars from the hotel. There are always taxis waiting outside the hotel and if not the hotel wil quickly call them for you. Taxi to the airport is around 20-25 dollars and the ride takes about 20-30 minutes depending on traffic. If you are looking for a hotel where you get good value for your money and don't have to pay too much for a room then this might just be the right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinn_2k
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days at the Holiday Inn atrium. Loved the place....... herez what I like and dislike about the property: Liked:::: -Spacious, clean, comfortable rooms with tea and coffee maker, LED TV, bathtub in the toilet, 5 towels in the bathroom+ hand towels etc, good quality toileteries... -Superb breakfast -helpfull staff at the reception - I got checkin at 8.15 and checkout at 3pm, which is very good, and all this without any fuss. Disliked::::::::: -The location. its a good 20 minutes walk from Outram MRT. But then, this didnt matter much as the hotel offers complimentary shuttle to Orchard Road/Clarke Quay about 8 times a day and though the last shuttle from Orchard is early at 8.35pm, a taxi from Orchard to the hotel only costs 6 SGD. 10 miniutes walk from the Hotel is the Great World City mall, went there often to eat. Lovely food courts and a delicious meal only costs 5 SGD per person. Also, opposite the hotel is a small malay/ indian restaurant. Lovely mutton/chicken biryani for 5.50 sgd and a whole lot of other stuff too... On the whole, Love the Holiday Inn. Have nothing to complain about, and though the location is not the best, still think my stay at this hotel was worth it !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Toscani2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with some trepidation as there was the usual odd reviews rating it as horrible. I don't know who these people are but this hotel is marvelous. We booked a king room with breakfast. We were concerned about some issues since our plane arrived at midnight. I emailed the hotel and received a response from the front desk manager within 30 minutes. Check in was quick and efficient and our room is first class, as good as any luxury hotel we have stayed at previously. We have a full view of all of Singapore. Selection of pillow types, Safe in our large room, great bed and bedding, great shower with lots of amenities, great breakfast. There is a free shuttle to the Orchard Road area, taxis are about 7-8 usd but the concierge schooled us quickly on the local bus system .75usd each, so we can go anywhere in the country quickly and cheaply like a local. The bus stop is steps away. The hotel is connected to a number of salons, quick-markets, etc for odds and ends. My wife booked a 45 minute massage for S$25. We are here for a week, pre-cruise. The cruise line will have to work hard to equal the service here. I would also advise booking early because at just over $100/night it may not be there when you want it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Sinppu
Reviews.Content: Considering the Singapore price level for hotels, you get what you pay for in this one. There are certainly better equipped and better located, but this one offers you almost a bargain. Internet is expensive. Singapore has loads of free WiFi in the malls, so if you can, use them instead. Stop whining about the location!! There are two FREE shuttle buses from the hotel, one to Sentosa and the other to city centre. Taxi to sights and shopping costs only $5, so it's NOT expensive as some here have claimed. The concierge desk is one of the best we have ever seen. Helpful, friendly, polite, efficient. The restaurant was good, although on the pricey side, but then again, so they always are. A popular buffet. The hotel is not very new, but we had a good night's sleep here and were very satisfied with our choice. This hotel is not for fussy people, so we hope they pay extra and go somewhere else and stop writind these bad reviews, because there really is nothing major wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what do some poeple want??”
Reviews.Author: kenwade
Reviews.Content: Before I give my report on the hotel I have to tell you that we are quiet fussy English travelers that have been around the block and expect what we paid for. We stayed here for two nights in mid March and there is nothing wrong with this hotel, the staff and the breakfast. We asked for a non smoking room and got it, extra towels and pillows, got them. great variety for breakfast and VERY clean room. In fact the hotel was spotless. The outside and a few bits inside could do with a lick of paint, but thats about all. As many have said before it is a little out of the way, but a quick and cheap taxi ride to the subway, a cheap all day pass and you can spend all day in the city for next to nothing. We have been to Singapore several times and this hotel is as good as most in the same rating/ price range so do not be put off, just be aware of a little extra traveling, but for us its just all part of the fun. Ken

Reviews.Title: “IMPRESSIVE”
Reviews.Author: DAJA2
Reviews.Content: Walking into the lobby and seeing the fantastic sight of 6 illuminated transparent lifts going up and down 20 floors was like seeing a scene from Charlie & the Chocolate Factory. Our room was satisfactory. We enjoyed the breakfasts here more than at the other hotels we stayed at. The staff were helpful. The only downside was the fact that it was not in a great location and was a good 15 minute walk away from the nearest metro station which given the heat and humidity was a bit of a trek.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quite - Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust24X7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night after spending 3 nights at Royal Plaza on Scotts.. I have to say this hotel much better value for money compared to Royal Plaza...Located just a walking distance off Orchard road, the hotel has very calm surroundings... not an elegant entrance.. small rooms... but everything was nice and clean.. overall a nice stay...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with the best of facilities”
Reviews.Author: dangboy
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest hotels available in Singapore and is located in the heart of the city on Outram Road and is walking distance away from the Clarke Quay which offers a beautiful view in the night with all the lights and life around. Food served in the hotel is good and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: josh4amit
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we have stayed during our journey to South East Asia and Dubai. The Hotel really rocks in terms of the services and facilities which a traveler would require. We stayed here for 4 days (January 29 to Feb 2, 2010) and during this time, it was really a pleasure to stay at this Hotel. Since we had our meals planned out by the Travel Agent, we only tried the breakfast here, which really is a true Buffet Breakfast one would expect. The Hotel has its own Aura and one would enjoy everything about this Hotel, its services, co-operative staff,etc. In my view Singapore is the best location for a family gateway and this Hotel adds to the leisure. The location of the hotel is not that great as it is a little far from practically everything, but the quality of service lets u forget about this aspect. The Hotel also has its shuttle service but the frequency is quite less and atleast for us, it didn't helped at all. The rooms are quite large and escalators are eye catching. The hotel claims to refund your money in case you are not satisfied with its services, but i do not think that such a need would arrive. Overall, a must stay destination if u plan to stay in Singapore for a few days. Would definitely recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: BillyElliot1
Reviews.Content: We booked through booking.com and had agreat price for a weekend stay with breakfast.Staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is nicely decorated, clean and airy. Our room had a large comfy bed, very clean. I had emailed previously to say we would like an early check in and was pleased when we arrived at 8am our room was ready! They even brought us wine Chocs and fruit for our anniversary! What a lovely touch. The breakfast was huge, lots of things to choose from. The swimming pool and gym were well equipped. The holiday inn is quite close to MTR about a 10 min walk. And bus stop is over the road. The bar has a happy hour and the young bar staff are so friendly and interested.I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great nearby Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: garuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just at the end of a whole series of restaurants leading all the way down the river. As you leave the hotel cross the street and go in the area that says Kings Centre beside the Avis. There is a path there we you can literally walk several kilometers of restaurants and pubs, good mix of everything from varied Chinese, French, Italian, Australian and British themes. Do stop at the outdoor champagne bar for a drink, around the normal price and right on the canal. Why anyone who stays at this hotel eats here is beyond me, other than the river is somewhat hidden and I am sure lots don't know about it. The hotel restaurant is essentially buffet for all meals. The location is not great for the metro but coming and going just took a taxi to the Outram Park MRT which was around $2.00US. That line takes you directly to the airport so it is simple and perhaps faster than a cab. Drinks at the hotel are expensive as they appear to be everywhere, everyone here drinks during the happy hours between about 5 am 8 pm when virtually every bar has 2 for 1 or half price. This puts a drink down to an average price of around $6 or $7US. The breakfast at the hotel is one of the best features, nice pool and workout area. If you want a massage there are at least 5 or 6 massage places attached to the hotel in a small office complex area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service while serving special needs ,even specified in advance and after complaing even no improvenment.”
Reviews.Author: hellotrip124
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel to attend 3 day workshop.We were supposed to get the lunch there.I had special need of india vegeterian food.My trainer informed already about my need to them and they agreed on serving that need. Our lunch timings were 12 to 1 .I used to get my on 12:30.That too very cold .My trainer complained on 2nd day about this to hotel staff.They said they will serve on time next day but no improvement.And even the food was hard to eat.I hope I never have to see that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sapteo
Reviews.Content: The drawback is the location, it's about more than a km from nearest MRT station. For a group with 4-5 members, taking a taxi in Singapore is sometime cheaper than taking MRT. Otherwise, it's good. It's not as luxury as many 5 stars, but the rooms are clean and the breakfast is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Very Tired 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HollieAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our room had a constant unpleasant smell, toilet bowl had a nasty brown stain, had to kick the door to get the key card to work . The whole hotel had a very worn out look about it. They said that they were renovating the top floors. Best features - 2 glass surround lifts and the Lobby Bar where they had 4 hour - Happy Hour each night - great staff and service, singer and pianist each night too, all very friendly. Had dinner on New Year's Eve in their Chinese Restaurant and they tried to get us out as quickly as they could as they wanted to go off to celebrate themselves, would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location; Well Maintained; Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: VK_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a ten minute ride away from Orchard Road (8 SGD) and Mustafa Market (7 SGD). The daily breakfast spread is superb - must try. The staff was very well mannered and were a great help after I brought an overcharging taxi incident to their notice. In fact, I received a mail from the Singapore Land Transportation Department when I returned to India stating that the hotel staff had been following up with the complaint and a list of taxis had been drawn who could have been the offenders. The drivers of these cabs were notified and instructed that any news of any such incident from their side in the future will be taken as confirmation of their guilt in this case. Apart from this, the views from the hotel are quite striking. The interior lobby is well maintained. Do try out the elaborate breakfast spread at this hotel. The hotel was quite attuned to the needs of Indian customers and were ready with almost anything that we asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & friendly”
Reviews.Author: RoesAbroad
Reviews.Content: One of the largest hotels we have stayed in and don't usually go for chains, but this place was so friendly, from reception, consierge and the restaurant staff. We were greeted with a smile at reception and given lots of information on public transport from consierge. The hotel operates a free shuttle bus into town but we found it pleasant to walk down to Clarkes Quay in only 20 minutes stroll. The breakfast was buffet style and catered for all nationalities, it made it very interesting and we were full until late afternoon. The foyer was true oppulance with 6 bullet style glass lifts taking you to the 27th floor, no good if you suffer from vertigo, we were on the 18th floor and the views were magnificent. The whole place is immaculate and organised.

Reviews.Title: “...”
Reviews.Author: Englandtravelgal
Reviews.Content: First i would like to say that the date i have written is wrong, i can't remember when i went... The weather for one thing is Definatly Baking hot ! When you check in you stand in the grand lobby, the bar is very expensive and we just had B&B . The rooms were quite small, and smelt damp, there were 3 bottles of water in our room and we requested 3 beds. The beds were quite nice but you could feel the springs. The Bathroom was good and up to expectations. The pool was quite small, but when we went only an odd few came in. The deck chairs surrounding the pool were always wet and the gym is overlooking the pool. The gym is fairly small but it is nice and airconditioned. Breakfast is really nice, we had a try of the singaporian food but the english food was repetitive only a slight change. The Concierge was really helpful and sent us on our way to explore singapore. The things you must do is the cable cars to Sentosa Island and the Night Safari. Wonderful experience i would come back , but maybe breakfast and dinner, because it was really hard to find dinner (the hotel is really expensive) If you are coming for shopping, this hotel is very far from Shops and stuff ;)

Reviews.Title: “Not Again”
Reviews.Author: Sedgley
Reviews.Content: Tried this hotel because it offered free internet facilities and I felt that I should use a different hotel from normal. BIG Mistake. Booked a non-smoking single business room and felt being a Platinum member I would be offered a decent room. How wrong could I be, the room smelled of smoke, the desk was 60 cms from the television and the room was so dated that I felt I had gone back 10 years+. Some of the lights didn't work from the swtich, and when I mentioned to the bellboy about this he said he didn't think the switch worked, I later found that it did, but surely one of their staff should have been able to sort this out. Breakfast was a farce. The buffet was constantly running out and not being replenished, and despite the number of staff getting coffee was a matter of persistance, 2, 3 or even 4 requests went unoticed. I had a meeting in in the lounge and ordered coffee with customer and ordered coffee. After I signed the check I heard my name yelled three times around the lounge by the waitress, why I'm still to find out, but this is not the service you expect from this type of hotel. The staff as already commented need training in customer service, during my three day stay, the only exception was a waitress at dinner called Jenifer, who was cheerfull and attentive, I would suggest to the management that they promote this girl immediately. Would I stay here again, NEVER!

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous $24 per day for internet access”
Reviews.Author: malmn1976
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel but they overcharge for everything. There is no free internet access and it will cost you $24 per day to use it. Crazy! Washing machines and dryers are $9 per load. Also crazy. This hotel really loves to gouge people. It made me sick. I've been traveling all across Asia since September, including Japan and Hong Kong, and this is the worst hotel for value. By the way, the location isn't good.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL TO STAY IN SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: Hi_Ricky
Reviews.Content: According To me this is the best hotel to stay in singapore. this hotel gives you the value for money. Also if you stay there ask for the rooms above 20th floor to have a great of the city. The Best house keeping service and delicious breakfast. The staff too is very friendly.Rooms are also spacious. It was just Home away from home. Me and my wife just loved this hotel. Next time we are in Singapore undoubtedly it will be Holiday Inn attrium

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel. The location is off!”
Reviews.Author: MinistryOfTravel
Reviews.Content: Very shabby hotel compared to their prices. The location is not that great, as there is quite a walk to the nearest metro stations. We stayed in one of the oldest rooms, and everything seem to fall apart. The cleaning staff were very lazy. One day the cleaner forgot most of this cleaning products in our room. When our trash bin was emptied, half of our bin was laying in the corridor. Nothing was dusted off. Very poor performance. We know that our room, was one of the ones, they were getting ready to renovate, but still... we paid to stay there. Paid alot it seemed. Had trouble with their shuttle bus service too. Spoke to the conceigre about it, and was told that manager would come and speak to us. We waited and waited in our room. Nothing happend. The next day we carefully asked again, and waited a long time, before manager would speak to us and explain the mishap with the shuttle bus. I would not recommend staying here. We were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean room”
Reviews.Author: rubytaiwan
Reviews.Content: the location is not in the shopping centre area, but they have free shuttle bus. my booking is not shown in their system so it takes a long check-in time. the room is clean but small. hotel offeres pillow selections which is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: 6outofoz
Reviews.Content: Friendly efficient staff - excellent concierge, they couldn't do enough for us. Rooms are very big and clean and beds also big. Free shuttle into Orchard Rd and Clarke Quay is handy, otherwise a bit of a walk to shops or food. Taxis are very cheap though. The restaurant is quite expensive but the food was fine. Internet was available wired or WIFI in the room but fairly expensive. Pool area was great. The lobby is certainly spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly glamorous.”
Reviews.Author: nannienorms
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set on the edge of Singapore city, but on the Hippo Tour Bus route, which made an easy and convenient way of travelling and exploring. The hotel staff are delightful and gave wonderful service. The breakfast was very comprehensive, covering all tastes. Rooms were spacious, airy, clean and well appointed, with robes, slippers and toiletries supplied. It was unexpectedly glamorous, and one almost expected Humphrey Bogart to exit the lift!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: AlexBarb
Reviews.Content: Everything was absolutely fine with this hotel. We came by train from Kuala Lumpur so we checked in at 9 o'clock. No problems at all. Requested a room at a high floor. We were given a room at 23rd out of 26 floor. The room, although it was a standard one (not deluxe) was incredibly big, had a big window (the whole width of the wall) with incredible view over Singapore, spotlessly clean. Breakfast was a feast. The pool (no overcharge) was very clean and a nice retreat after a day in the city. The price we paid was very good for Singapore, around 170 SGD. The only downside was, as other fellow travellers reported, the location a little bit off the center. But it's about a 15-20 min. walk to orchard road, which by my standard is fine. Would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “it is what you expect from holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: chenbear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Atrium for two days in October and it is exactly what one would expect from a Holiday Inn. Everything was okay. This is not a good location (unless you are visiting Singapore business) the rooms are small, and the Wi-Fi is 26.00 SGD a day, but other than that it was a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scorpionrulez
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located in a nice area of singapore, the hotel has a very nice exterior veiw and interior is also great with all facilities in the hotel, the room have all facilities, the service is good, food is great. overall the hotel is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asifk12
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel , Very Pleasent ,smart, co-operative staff , hotel has inhouse shopping / massages / spa treatments . Excellent concierge .

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't dazzle in any way but manages to satisfy”
Reviews.Author: Onmywayy
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend last week at the Holiday Inn Atrium. The pros first: the hotel is well-located in terms of proximity to bus stops, train station (Outram Park MRT) and the happening hangouts like Orchard Road and Clarke Quay. The staff are helpful and help out on queries on getting around in the city and special requests like early check-in. The place is efficient enough without dazzling you in any way. The gym and pool are small but serviceable - we found it empty on most days that we went there. The cons now - The first impression of the exterior and lobby of the hotel is dull and dowdy, the place doesnt have a vibrant feel to it. The rooms are pretty basic for the SG$160 per night price tag, the bathroom is smallish. The TV lacks hugely in terms of channels -so many local language channels that I ended up watching the Singapore tourism Channel whenever I was in the room. The breakfast menu is the SAME everyday, which can get monotonous if you are a leisure traveller and not a one-night business traveller. The hotel has only 1 restaurant in addition to the Coffee Shop, so your options for room service are limited. The one time we ordered room service, we got the order an hour late after 2 reminders and food was nothing to write home about. Overall, I think the Holiday Inn has a great brand recall and dependable customer base in the face of rising competition but needs to pull up its socks to keep the momentum going. They definitely need a facelift and a makeover on the food and service fronts.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: AngusC
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and well met expectations for a Holiday Inn with rooms a good size and nicely presented. Breakfast buffet has lots of choice and bright area with outside views. The eating area does feel in need of upgrade and lacking in character/atmosphere for an evening meal. One can go to a great Street market to get food, 5 minutes walk away on Zion Road, called a Hawkers market. Incredible choice of fresh food, in sparkling clean environment, all for a few SIN $'s Got a good B&B rate direct with the hotels website. Although the hotel is not on Orchard Road or by the sea, it is a few SIN $'s taxi ride away which more than compensates for the price. Also good sized pool, and a smaller gymn area.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: IIoana
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience in this hotel, during our summer trip, from Bali we choose to say some more days in Singapore. The hotel is a 4 star, the room was smaller than usualy for a 4 star hotel and the location is far from Marina bay and from the Orchard shopping place, but taxi is cheap. The breakfast was good, staff helpfull. Regarding Singapore is one of the most clean city with fabulous vegetation, for atraction, besides shopping on Orchard: -night safari -botanic garden -sentosa island -little india-gold shops -old city - the food is great in own Definitelly worth to see this city!

Reviews.Title: “I tried it 'just to see'”
Reviews.Author: RestInPeaceAustralia
Reviews.Content: Unhappy Stuff... * View on entry to the room opened directly onto the bed. * My room was upgraded, but it was what I'd expect a standard room to be. My upgraded room had the older style 1970's bathroom tiles and faucets. * TV remote controls have too many complicated, unnecessary buttons. I just need to turn it on, off, change the channels and volume. * 3-4 minutes of my phoning the bell-desk went unanswered. * 'Pillow menu' brochure provided beside the bed, boasted 4 different types of pillows. However, I had 4 of only one type of pillow, I still have a sore neck 4 days later. * Concierge gave the 'extra long walk' directions to the markets via a busy, dangerous highway-type road. I was re-directed to walk the opposite way by a taxi driver. * Mini bar items were minimal (no snacks). * Breakfast staff in the restaurant appeared unfriendly to the guests in general. Four of them spent more time discussing their work rosters and chatting amongst themselves than attending to the diners. I finally had to go into their kitchen area to ask for my first cup of coffee. Happy stuff... * Despite numerous unanswered calls to the bell desk to collect my bags at 6am, the 'Bell-Man', was fast & efficient when I finally reached him through the front desk extension. * Bed & linen was crisp & clean * Friendly welcome at reception For my flight, I was unsure of the terminal I was leaving from when I was about to get into the taxi. It would be good if there was a small information board showing which airlines leave from which terminal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Singapore for reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelS11
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Big rooms, free breakfast. Huge wondows with views over the city. The entire hotel is built around an indoor "Atrium". The middle is hollow and one can look right down to the lobby from the balconies. The hotel has several glass lifts which zoom one up to the high floors. An awesome hotel. Just a little bit out of the way, but if you know your way around, you can walk to Orchard Rd easliy. Taxi ride to Chinatown though. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: tuttifruity67
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful on the outside as well inside, the staff was always very helpfull and professional. The rooms needed a bit of a facelift. And unfortunately the top floor hallway was always super hot and not very well ventilated. Thus chemical smells were always wafting through the hall -we hurried to the elevator every time. Inside the Atrium is so shiny and clean that it gives you the illusion the rest of the hotel is as nice, but unfortunately it wasnt. The breakfast buffet was good.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - except internet access”
Reviews.Author: crossglobaltravels
Reviews.Content: Clean & comfortable - what I'd expect from a Holiday Inn. The location was OK but definitely not in the middle of it all. The train (which is very very good) was about a 10-15min walk from the hotel. We walked to Orchard St which took about 25 minutes. Cabs are cheap so we used them a lot. They had a special for their breakfast buffet so we did that as it was easy and there's not much else nearby for breakfast. Really enjoyed it as it was a mix of food - western (pancakes, eggs) and asian (miso soup, dahl). Design of the hotel is nice - had a Guggenheim feel to it. In room internet access & wifi wasn't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A near signature style at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: nandu_forever
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the CBD area. But any visit to any touristic place would need you to take a cab, which fortunately is quite easy (and inexpensive) given the location of the hotel. Holiday Inn's atrium hotel is quite unique with a grand atrium to boast about, which indeed is impressive with its cream-toned walls and incandescent lit capsule lifts. It's in fact a treat to watch the entire atrium and the floors while riding on the glass lift. The rooms turned out to be comparatively smaller and with the two king-size beds which I'd specially requested for there was virtually no space to walk about. Rooms comes with all kinds of amenities you can think of and the maintenance standards are quite high. Views from the rooms are generally good and gives an ok view of the Marina Bay cityscape. Although sounds flimsy, I feel the hotel should re-think about having their generally well done rooms and suites being put up with some 'stuck in the 90s' TV sets. The restaurant is spacious and has a terrace extension for outdoor dining. The buffet breakfast was quite elaborate with a good number of cuisines at take. Looking at the maintenance and hygience standards the pool and the gym are of above average standards although the area altogether is quite small. Business desk will rip you off should you ever use their service. Free internet was offered but didn't try it then, but is understandably fast enough. Late check-out/early check-in were liberally allowed and mostly depends on the season of travel. At 142 SGD/night the stay here can be termed as splurging without splurging.

Reviews.Title: “A Standard Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: aimantakkisah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 12th Oct 2009 for 1 nite. I travelled here by car from Kuala Lumpur. Took me 4 hours approx to get to the hotel which was easy to find as it was near the expressway exit. Free Parking was provided which was important as parking rates in Singapore may be very expensive. Hotel was clean and comfortable. Location wise was not that good as it was a bit out of the way, the MRT was a bit far but you can get a taxi anytime. Would had prefered nearer to Orchard, Suntec or Bugis VIllage for shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “If there's no where else, you'll be fine, but there's better in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jwarthur
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the other Holiday Inn in Singapore (Parkview), but thought I'd stay at this one for a change. It's a bit cheaper, but what you save on room rates you'll spend on taxi's as this place is not close to anything. The only 'attraction' within walking distance is the Tiong Bahru Markets which is one of the best places for Breakfast or lunch in Singapore. Room's are clean, pool is nice. Staff are average. Business centre is terrible (on the upside, they are so disorganised with the business centre I didn't get charged for internet usage). We were fairly high up (18th floor) but the views are nothing special. My tip - stay are the park view, it's only a little more expensive, heap's nicer and you'll end up spending less on taxi's anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: MeriM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, really clean and everything you require. It's not very close to public transport, but we don't mind walking, even in sweltering heat. It is near a Hippo bus stop (tourist bus service) and a great shopping center with a supermarket and good coffee. Breakfast the first morning was yummy, but even at $20 a head (on special) it was a bit expensive, we preferred the 500m walk to the shopping center and one of the coffee shops there. We have a 2 and a half yr old and he had a good time too. There are 2 pools including a nice shallow wading pool which was a lovely relief from the humidity and nice and safe for him to play. Quayside was just the other side of the road and a 5 min walk along the river, beautiful at night. The bars along the river have happy hour and cheaper drinks and there's also a nice little Italian restaurant. Our room was huge, the bed was massive! We could have had a 3 of us in it and not be aware of the others. Our only problem was that we had booked through the central Holiday Inn number and had requested and paid for an extra bed. When the email arrived the extra bed wasn't listed, so we rang them to check and they said that it was ok, it would be there, it doesn't show up on the emails. On check in the hotel had no idea that we had requested one and said that they don't charge for them. A bed was delivered promptly. Room service pizza wasn't great, but then we were in Asia, not Italy. Room Service does have an extra charge that we didn't see on the menu when ordering. We had a bucket of ice and a wine glass delivered most nights without a problem, one night I got a tumbler instead of a wine glass and on the Friday night they were really busy and I had to ring and ask twice. Then when it arrived the guy seemed a bit annoyed to have to do it, but they were really busy with quite a few weddings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation-Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: finelmg
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn was excellent. Excellent accomodation, food, customer service and great location. Very plush reception, it felt like you were in the Hilton. Accomodation came with free breakfast. Breakfast catered for all. There resturant is great too. I tried the Dim Sum resturant and I was treated like royality and what topped it off was the bill was not expensive, considering what we ordered. Definietly recommend this hotel. Easy access to all amenties.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable and hospitable stay”
Reviews.Author: nadirDubai
Reviews.Content: We had done a good deal of research and simply by reading positive reviews on HIA decided to go for it. Without a doubt the praises were justified. We had arrived on a damp Friday afternoon only to feel the whole place oozing with warmth and courtesy. The reception staff was extremely to allow us to check in. For the next 5 days we felt like royalties. Breakfast was complimentary with our package and quite a variety of delicacies available. The location of this hotel is superb. We could easily reach most of tourist sites within 15 minutes. You just need to be careful to confirm any extra charges before you embark on a trip. Better check with the driver first. All in all we were glad to visit Singapore and stay at HIA. Nearby Farashan cafe was open 24 hours to offer hot prata (paratha) and tea. Rest of the time we enjoyed the food at Amritsar restaurant @ Little India or Subway.

Reviews.Title: “Old and small but i will return”
Reviews.Author: Not_so_lengchai
Reviews.Content: My partner, SY and I was in Singapore for a leisure weekend recently so we booked a night at the HIA based on previous reviews. Although a dated hotel, we booked it due to their attractive weekend rate (SGD123++). For this rate, what we got was a comfortable room/bed, a great looking lobby, nice toiletries, quite wide variety of breakfast and very helpful and excellent service staff at the concierge (esp the left luggage service)....special mention has to go to the really yummy fluffy omelette in the mornings. The not-so-great factors include: no complimentary bottled water in our room (which I thought was quite unusual for a holiday inn), only one pair of bathroom slippers instead of 2pairs, a 21" TV and a location which is great for guests with cars but very inconvenient for those looking to use the MRT regularly. Overall if they maintained their rates and service, i'll still return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nqnam_family
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit far from other places and MRT. The room is clean and a bit small in size. Staffs are professionals and helpful. Checkin and out are quick. However the hotel may be not suitable for family and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: jotelandtravel
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the hotel gives a good first impression the atrium style is very plush and the glass elevators an attraction but then we got to our room! We had asked for a room on a high floor so tha we could take advantage of the views which was nice. However the room itself was very basic 3 star accomodation. It was in desperate need of renovation the carpet and curtains had an awful smell. The bathrom was small and very old fashioned. The pool area was ok one small pool with sunbeds we used this after check out while waiting for our onward flight. It was close to china town although a taxi was in order. Another taxi ride took us to Clarke Quay which was a decent night out for food and drink. The hotel was very expensive for drinks at the bar and it closed very early. The location was not very good for leisure travellers and I would stay in the colonial district if I visit Singapore again. We tookm a taxi to the night safari which was incredible and definately worth the 4 minute taxi ride. Very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Worn but still nice”
Reviews.Author: markhongkong
Reviews.Content: In Singapore to visit a few friends who had just been relocated there. Booked the Holiday Inn Atrium using my Priority Club points mainly due to the nice review here (plus the lower points requirement to be honest). Hotel did not replied to my email for 4 days did not gave me the best impression (they never replied at all...I called them); arrived and was put into a deluxe room on the 6th floor, check-in was prompted and friendly. A pleasant surprise to find them having a personalized envelope with my priority points summary plus a complimentary beer coupon down the lobby lounge. Room as you can see from the photo is big but decor is definitely showing its age, it reminds me of the Holiday Inn I stayed more than 15 years ago in Manila. Nevertheless, it is very clean, probably the cleanest I ever saw from an old hotel. Stayed for 2 nights, generally speaking staff are friendly and service is good, only below average attitude I had was from a receptionist who transferred me without even asking me to hold. Everything is in good order and the hotel seems to try very hard to overcome the age (the friendly staff I saw on floor, the complimentary drink, the spotless clean room), kudos to them. Location as others point out is a bit off center but not too much, traveling to/from most places are not expensive by taxi. Overall a good hotel, price as I know is sitting in the middle and I think it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Holiday Inn (with a special place in my heart!)”
Reviews.Author: Davespilot
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for the bi-annual Asian Aerospace convention. I was a late addition to the staff in attendance, so I had to take a room away from the center of town. I have a Holiday Inn Priority Club membership, so I aimed for the Holiday Inn Atrium. The exterior is very impressive, with the smoky glass. The interior is just as stunning, with the gold lights and elevators. Check-in was efficient. The room was smaller than I expected -- actually, I don't think you could swing a cat in it -- but this is Southeast Asia after all. The bathroom was a typical sink-tub combo. The ceiling leaked thanks to a bad seal on the tub above. Every couple of hours a waterfall would pour through the ceiling and onto the floor. I kept a ready supply of towels handy for the purpose. The furnishings were a bit dated, but I didn't spend that much time in the room, thanks to the long cab drive to the airport for the show. After sweating it out on the tarmac all day, a bed is a bed, and a shower is a shower. Breakfast was great at the restaurant downstairs. It was a European - Asian mix buffet. Unfortunately, I was given the "3rd Degree" every morning by the staff. I hadn't paid for breakfast when I checked in, so I had the usual Singaporean inquisition: "Did you pay?!" "What is your room number?" "Are you a guest?" "We have to confirm you are a guest here!" Etc...Etc...Etc. But, the food was worth it! So, you may be wondering why after all of this, the hotel holds a special place in my heart? One slow evening I am sitting downstairs in the lobby waiting for the bar to open. The front doors of the hotel part -- and straight out of Hollywood -- in walks a very beautiful woman with a friend. The friend runs off to see someone, and this pretty lady sits at a table near mine. We started chatting, and, as they say, the rest is History. Or, Chemistry. We were married 2 years later! Thanks, Holiday Inn Atrium!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, but a bit far from the city”
Reviews.Author: vanilla-ivory
Reviews.Content: We got a room with 2 double beds, and we were 4 in the room (3 adults, 1 kid). Room was clean, spacious, and well-lighted. We have a nice view of the city and the busy streets below. Location is good - walking distance from a small chain of restaurants right across the street. There is an Indian restaurant in that area that serves prata (Indian crepe) with curry - a must try! We went there for breakfast ... twice! I love the cheese-mushroom prata. Affordable and very delicious! Back to the hotel - concierge was very very helpful! I chanced upon a Filipino concierge who was really very friendly and gives all the tips and info you need when you ask something. Housekeeping very efficient too - no matter how dirty and messy the room was (food wrappers, plastic bags, papers etc here and there - entirely not my doing) when we left it, our room was always in order - spic and span - when we come back at night. We did not eat in their restaurant - rates were quite pricey. Lots of big mirrors in the room (I like!). Big cabinet with hangers, with iron and iron board. Easy to hail cabs to go to the city - there's always a cab queue just outside the lobby. Do check their free shuttle service which drives around the city and drops off/picks up people in some of the popular areas. You save up on taxi fare :) However, do note that taxi fares can be tricky in Singapore. Additional charges are added during rush hours and late at night. A trip from Holiday Inn Atrium to Wizma along Orchard Road will cost you about 4-5 SGD, depending on how fast your driver drove and traffic volume. Note that the hotel is NOT walkable to the main shopping malls along Orchard Road. It is also NOT walkable to the nearest MTR station. Best means of transportation is still taxi and bus (which we did not try anymore). There is a shopping mall called Great Wall City about 10-15 mins walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel... friendly staff..”
Reviews.Author: khrise
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel. we were really taken cared of. concierge and valet were so helpful. front desk even asked me how my stay was during check out. buffet was great. i didn't have any problem with this hotel (except that they don't have free internet).. as with everything else in Singapore, bit expensive though..

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel but clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Buddy-65
Reviews.Content: Travelled in July 2009 with my wife and two teenage boys (14 & 17). I requested connecting rooms and that is what I got. Rooms 1501/1502 & 1701/1702 are excellent, just like having a two bedroom apartment. Rooms were dated but spacious and clean. Enough choice on the TV although we didn't go to Singapore to watch TV. Breakfast was, in my opinion very good, no complaints. We ate at the buffet dinner one night and again, good value for money and no complaints. Staff are all friendly and helpfull. We didn't use the internet because it was too expensive. Although a little out of the way taxis are not too expensive so we didn't really have any problems getting to where we wanted to go.There is a small shop outside the hotel with a friendly owner who works the late afternoon to night time shift, go in and say hello, good choices and his prices are cheaper than the hotel :-) All in all, a pleasant stay ate a reasonably priced, nice but dated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “" Nice hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Bhupeshnagarajan
Reviews.Content: This is nice scenic hotel in central city of Singapore" only thing its hard to find the way to move around the city from there since its located in junction of three roads clean and quiet rooms pls let us know the way to pool. front office staff are nice'

Reviews.Title: “A great effort for a slightly dated Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: The Atrium for me was very nice. You wont fail to notice the hotel is looking a little dated in places, from the walkways to the room itself, but I think the staff make every effort to look after what they have. Rooms are spacious, with huge bed, nicely appointed bathroom, good shower, plenty to watch on TV (payable movies too). Downstairs are bars and restaurants, a shop, business centre and seperate internet room. One of the small issues is the location, which at the end of Robertson Quay isn't perfect; the nearest MRT station is a fair walk, buses however do stop closeby, and weather permitting it's actually very pleasant to walk down to Clarke Quay, Boat Quay, or the City alongside the Singapore River. (there are ferry boats too, the stop is close to the Copthorne Waterfront hotel). Breakfast is on the 4th floor and was great, a nice bright airy atmosphere and pleasant staff, including a fresh egg/omelette bar. The Atrium itself is quite spectacular to look at from either the lobby or upper floors, and as you'll notice most reviews take at least one picture of it...so forgive me for being a copycat! If you're happy with the slightly off par location, the Holiday Inn Atrium actually represents good value in a City so full of hotel choices.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Jaszy
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time at Singapore. we had checked out the reviews of this hotel before booking. the atrium concept appealed to us and well it was worth checking it out. our rooms were on the 24th floor so the views were fantastic. one can see the city skyline(which looks great at night), a little of the river and even the sea. it refreshed us after the tiring flight and for the five days we spent there!! the atrium is great, amazing to look up or down it!! for someone who's only used to the 1st floor :-) there was one problem with check in though. we had to pay security before check in and it was disappointing because we weren't informed about it earlier. the staff was just ok, not very friendly. We had requested for early check in but we had to wait more than hour for the rooms and even after that we only got one room and had to wait another 2 hours for the second one. the rooms were nicely furnished, clean, had all the basic amenities, the bathrooms were clean, so overall it was good. my personal fav. was the window....loved sitting there and enjoying the view. breakfast was alright. there's a convenience store in the basement( the concorde shopping center) you can get your snacks from there as well as a mobile sim card. transportation was easy. we could get taxis within seconds from outside the hotel. taxis are the best way to travel in Singapore, cheap and easy. so on the whole its a good hotel to stay in. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBtravelsAsia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and found the hotel to be reasonable and good value. It's location is pretty OK and the hotel does offer a courtesy bus to Orchard Road (main shopping area) and Clarke Quay (restaurants, bars etc.) We got a breakfast package included with our stay, but felt this was spoilt by a large number of people who behaved as if they had never seen food before and subsequently did their best to clear as much food off of the buffet as quickly as possible. One woman saw a bunch of about 7 bananas, and decided she needed 7 bananas!! Quite a few people were also loading food into their bags, perhaps for a later snack. I know Singapore is not the cheapest place but.............. surely not that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice atrium”
Reviews.Author: cytegi
Reviews.Content: After our Malaysia (Genting and KL) sojourn, we came to Singapore and stayed at Holiday Inn Atrium. The exterior of the hotel seems rather dated with tinted glass. Inside was a pleasantly lit huge atrium with glass elevators running up and down. Our room was on the 21st floor and was a bit smelly. A phone call later a boy enters with room freshner- how original. Once the issue was fixed, the room was good with all the standard amenities like bath-tub, TV, safe, iron with board, internet access, pillow menu, bath-robe, mini-bar (bottled water is priced exorbitantly). TIP: Drink water from the tap - its safe. It had a small pool on the 6th level and a kiddies pool as well. Most convenient facility was the laundromat on the same level - so if you don't want the expensive laundry to be done, head to this with change (the concierge can get you change for this too). We got a great deal on breakfast on arrival. Breakfast was a spread of Indian, Chinese and Continental with an egg station for your special Spanish omelette. Hotel was in the CBD and just a short taxi-ride from the Singapore flyer, Esplanade, Orchard Rd., Chinatown and Mt. Faber (cable car to Sentosa). We checked in rather early (at 11 am) and were accomodated right away. While checking out they kept our stuff in their luggage room since our flight was rather late in the evening - and headed where else...but to Orchard Rd for more shopping! The only downside is that the hotel needs some new look and refurbishing (especially replace those smelly carpets in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: WomenTravelClub
Reviews.Content: My stay was for almost a week and I really liked this hotel because of spacious rooms and views it offers. Unlike other hotels in Singapore where they like to combine shops and accommodation together, this is pure accommodation hotel little away though but if you combining Malaysia with road then this hotel location is an advantage as most of the buses leaves and arrive near the hotel. If I can recall correctly then this hotel is of 21 floors and I stayed on the 18th floor of the hotel so once can imagine the view of the lion city. Hotel lobby has a atrium that is why it has Atrium is in its name. Overall nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: ashatravels
Reviews.Content: simply great hotel with lovely ambience and helpful staff.Rooms are good in size.ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Truly atrium look”
Reviews.Author: Holidayyearlong
Reviews.Content: We had a very memorable stay at the Holiday Inn Atrium. We had in total 3 rooms for our family and enjoyed every bit of our stay here. The hotel staff and the concierge services were very helpful but the room service staff barely spoke in English. However, they were courteous at all times. The guest laundry facility was the best that I would rate given the fact that it helped us save a few dollars on the laundry cost and also was very convenient to use with lots of kids clothes. The location of the hotel is slightly inconvenient for those planning to use the public transportation (bus/train). However, taxis are available in plenty. The breakfast has a good continental spread. Overall, our stay was extremely pleasant and memorable and I would recommend this to my friends as well.
