Reviews.Title: “Lovely ambience....good hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: entdoctor
Reviews.Content: We had a great time on our wedding anniversary. The hotel upgraded us to delux room and gave lovely orchids chocolate and wine as welcome . Breakfast could have been better

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: BinaMumbai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and easily accessible. It is indeed a value for money deal as you get 5 star experience in reasonable rate. Only thing that I think needs a improvement here is the resturant menu for both vegetarians & non-vegetarians. Also the breakfast timings. The breakfast spread on a daily basis had same items. Incase of vegetarians the option was not good as it didn't have snack items but meal items like rice, dal,etc. for breakfast!! As far as timings go, their official time for breakfast counter closure was 10.30 AM and almost all the days that i stayed found that around 10am most of the items were over and were not be replenished.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place!”
Reviews.Author: brosam
Reviews.Content: always going full! lot of people .... excellent atrium.. almost 30 floors high! view is fantastic... nice rooms... i had a queen bed for 3N... very nice location.... convinient cab and bus services, can be arranged form the hotel... sight seeing facilities available ! great breakfast! highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: PrashNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: It was a great experienece. They have very good Service, nice restaurant. Ths staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You cant find a better one”
Reviews.Author: PankajKohli
Reviews.Content: i think its a very good place to stay, generally in singapore you only coem to your hotel to sleep as its a shoppers paradise, so we really had a nice and comfortable sleep, food was excellent. Decor, Hotel staff, rooms amenities everything was excellent. whenever i will visit singapore in future will surely stay again in Atrium

Reviews.Title: “Absolute VFM.. & Super Breakfast !!”
Reviews.Author: Anirudh_Sharma
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd hotel of the trip to Singapore. I had read some of the reviews that the hotel decor & furnishings were getting old & dated, but at the price, it seemd alright to try out. & whoa, what a choice it was. @ 144 SGD, you would be hardpressed to find a better hotel in Singapore. The hotel is very nice. The room we got was on the 12th floor and the view was not the best, but still very beautiful. Nice furniture and bath fittings and very comfortable room. The breakfast was one of the highlights. With lot of choices in cuisines and dishes. Mistakenly we had booked 'Fragrance Hotel - Imperial' on our travel a few days earlier to Singapore. Comparing the price and the Value, what a revelation 'Holiday Inn' was. It's little bit far from the 'Tiong Bahru' MRT station. (approx. 15 mins walk). But a Taxi can take you there in SGD 3-4 from the station. A very good hotel at a Very good Price.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ravdeep
Reviews.Content: The rooms ar extremely clean n comfortable. The food is also tasty n lot of variety. Swimming pool at 6th floor is a good relaxing area. The hotel is appropriately located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near the River”
Reviews.Author: schueyrocks
Reviews.Content: Check in was very efficient and courteous. We were given a late check out without requesting it as our flight out was in the evening. Hotel lobby was quite impressive. Hotel location was very good. Perfect for romantic walks along the river culminating in great seafood at Clarke Quay. Room was quite small and in need of refurbishment. The good thing was that some of the floors was undergoing refurbishment so it should be good now! Breakfast spread was good. The convenience store in the basement was good for picking up snacks.

Reviews.Title: “palatial vastness”
Reviews.Author: abhijitbarua
Reviews.Content: Though a old construction, this is one of the larger singapore hotels and very convenient for family trips or business trips. Rooms are very spacious and well furnished. Lobby is huge. Choice of restaurants. Breakfast is huge .. fantastic value. The front desk manages very well considering the size of the hotel and they even helped me with bundling breakfast at a deal price, which i realized was great value. Only drawback was it was not within walkable distance from the MRT or shopping areas. But later i realised how easy it is to get a taxi and reach many of these places, even compared to staying in the Orchard area, where getting a taxi is a big problem! Overall, one of the best value hotels in S'pore!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Atrium”
Reviews.Author: HarryDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed over at the Atrium for a course for two weeks. The rooms were excellent; and of a good size. The room service was good and the place was maintained very well. It was in the heart of the city and easily accesible to other areas. Taxis were easily available and easy to get other modes of transport. The concierge was very helpful in providing maps and directions and even clearly suggested where places were easy to walk down to. The hotel had two restaurants and the Japanese food served was really good. The 'Melting Pot' was where we had really sumptuous breakfasts and service was good. Additional snacks were provided during the coffee breaks we had and the little goodies were quite innovative snacks. The buffet lunch at the 'Melting Pot' was large with a wide range of choice to suit all palates - Indian, Chinese, Japanese & Continental. The bar downstairs was a good place to relax and unwind in the evenings. The little shops in the lobby provided the necessities and the best part was one could enjoy a good 'massage' to take away the tiredness after a long day if required. The hotel was also located close to a very good 'food court' along the waterside where one could enjoy a meal outdoors; one could not miss this opportunity at Singapore with its wide range of foods. The only drawback was that internet was not provided free of cost even though the hotel charge was quite steep; close to 300 Sing $ a day. The price for internet use was also steep, this was uncalled for considering Singapore is a technology nation. Overall experience was good. Trip Reviewer: JP 106279224

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Guest Love”
Reviews.Author: harish_doon
Reviews.Content: It is a great Hotel with clean room and very good quality in everything. Grocery shop in the lobby level contains fruits, bread, cake, beer and all necessary items are very cheap rates. This hotel is centrall located and provides value of Money. Hotel staff is also very friendly and courteous. Thanks and best regards Harish Chandra [----] [----]

Reviews.Title: “shopaholic's singapore”
Reviews.Author: surfergirl93
Reviews.Content: the hotel is conveniently located on orchid street. it is well furnished and in very good condition. the rates are resonable.

Reviews.Title: “A secret about Holiday Inn Atrium”
Reviews.Author: Ketan-Adesara
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest things about Holiday Inn Atrium is that some of the rooms have 3 beds and they charge for 2 adults if you have children. We loved the location, close to the attractions and far from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Not too far away from places!!”
Reviews.Author: Lahiruwan
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed for 4 nights in April on a family vacation. Was a bit reluctant to book this place initially as I had seen the reviews about the distance from places of interest however I was happy to find myself wrong. The Tiong Bahru MRT was a good 20 min walk away but taxis to almost anywhere were cheap. For example it was under Sin $6 to Orchard Street, Multafa Centre and the Esplanade Theatre (Cats!) during the weekends. Weekdays cost about a dollar more due to the congestion charge when entering the city area. The Tiong Bahru Plaza is a good value mall and is a 20 min walk away near the MRT. Great World City is a 10min walk away and both places have nice food courts with plenty of choice. Also, there is a cheap Indian place right infront of the hotel. The service was ok and they offered us early check in (at 8am) and late checkout (4pm) without much fuss. The hotel is quite old but has been maintained well and the rooms are being refurbished. The Internet is grossly overpriced at S$35 a day though

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: bulletrider
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day stay at Atrium. The hotel is magnificent and in a good location, very close to city centre and other must visit locations. I am a jogger and the early morning run near the river all across to the city center, almost 10 kms is a dream come true. Breakfast is a lovely continental spread with cheeses fruit pastries etc. Lunch was excellent and so was dinner. The pool is lovely and luxurious. I paid $150 per night for a room which is excellent value. Overall I would say this is probably one of the best hotel I have ever stayed in for business. Perhaps not the most convenient if all you want to do is theme parks, but if you want to mix a little luxury with the odd trip to the parks then this is an absolute must

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MuchtraveledGranny
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 5 days. It was lovely. The only problem is the location is out of the city at several major road junctions. But this means that buses and taxis are easy to find and cheap. Rooms were good size, there is a swimming pool on the 6th floor, the aircon is good in the rooms. The lifts are the glass type so if you have a problem with heights you should stand facing the door and not look out. There is a small mall off the ground floor to the left of the Business Centre. We had both had manicures and reflexology there and it was fine. The two shops sell drinks and snacks which is cheaper then the hotel mini bar. They are open from 10.00 am until very late. The hotel is clean and well run. The staff are eager to please I would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and seedy”
Reviews.Author: gangav
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need to refurbishing and a clean up. The rooms and foyer have a damp smell. The furniture is very old. The lobby is frequented by 'working ladies'. It is not in a convenient location. The restaurant is good, but the service is poor. The Cantonese restaurant is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: merchy20
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the worst thing about it. The nearest subway station has two lines which is a good thing, but it is at least a 10 minute walk. It is not advisable to walk to the hotel mainly due to the heat. Take a bus from Outram Park subway station and go 3 stops down to get to the hotel. This is easy if you have a Singapore Tourist Pass, giving you unlimited subway and bus travel for up to 3 days. When you enter the hotel, the air conditioning is fabulous. In the atrium, you see 6 glass lifts going up and down, and from up top, the view below is stunning. The reception staff were very helpful in welcoming me. I was given a deluxe room on the 17th floor, which was fairly good value. They give you a special card to ride the lift past the 6th floor which makes you feel important. This card can be used to access the gym and swimming pool on the 6th floor. The pool overlooks the surrounding area and the gym, which contains modern equipment, is open 24hrs for guests. The room itself included everything you would expect from a decent hotel room plus a plush king sized bed, well sized bathroom with incredible shower and satellite television. The only thing that disappointed me was when room service kept changing the pillows to the impractical pattern they were when I got there. I had to keep finding the right pillows to sleep on each night, but this was a minor point. There are many services provided at the hotel and next door, a few small shops that sell food and gifts. There weren’t many shops or places to choose from such as supermarkets for food or coffee shops. All in all, a great hotel, but the location is not ideal. Probably better to stay at the hotel and relax than to stay and venture out sightseeing as there is nothing nearby to see or do and it takes time to get to and from where the real action is.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but nice and clean hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: nooneyet
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Atrium Singapore located 20 minutes walk from the nearest MRT station which is the only disadvantage, we have found in this hotel. The rooms are quite small but yet convenient. Breakfast was great. Large variety and fresh food served all the time. At night you can walk to the nearest Robertson Quay with many restaurants and bars. Good points for: - Staff service is excellent - Housekeeping service is good. Room made early morning. - No charge for toll-free calls from the room Bad points for: - No free Wi-Fi in rooms or public areas. Tip from us: When traveling in Singapore, buy daily tourist pass for 8$/day. It will let you use all SMRT lines + public buses around the island.

Reviews.Title: “Average is the best I can Say”
Reviews.Author: Maxydog
Reviews.Content: The holiday Inn Atrium while being one of the most spectacular hotels I have stayed in, is getting tired. From the worn carpet to the pealing paint the hotel needs a face lift to be better than 3 stars. The rooms are nice but you pay for everything. The beds are comfortable but the pillows are bad. The staff are great but the prices are well over the top. I could go on but there is no need, in Singapore you get what you pay for. As far as the location there are a few positives that have not been mentioned. A short walk across the road to the river will put you in an area where food is plentiful. Watch where the locals eat and drink and you wont go wrong. There is a laundary across the street where you can have washing done for SGD10 for the first 3 kilos. There is a bus to Orchard Road and China town but in our stay we found it unreliable and ended up catching taxis which were cheep. The hotel is cheep, but not nasty, and was good for the quick stay.

Reviews.Title: “a little too far out”
Reviews.Author: chnnang
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a week for a business forum. the hotel is nice, the rooms are big enough and have everything you would expect. the food is good and the service was very good. the only problem is that it's a little too far from the city centre. you can't really use the mrt as there is no close station so it's taxis everywhere. taxis are cheap and there's lots of them in singapore but sometimes we had a 10 minute or so wait to get one. if you're looking for somewhere nice and quiet to stay with a slightly lower room rate then this is a good place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & spacious room for a great price but far away from hot spots”
Reviews.Author: Moonbeam720
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Atrium for 3 nights. The price was low (booked through agoda.com) since this hotel if farther away from the hot spots. Even so I would recommend this to others. It has a bus stop right outside that will take you to downtown. It's also walking distance (less than 1/2 mile) to a mall where you can shop. Across the street from the mall is a local eatery place where they have small stands of local food. We walked there 2 nights in a row for dinner and brought it back to the hotel to eat. 35 minute walk gets you to the Clarke Quay where night enterntainment is lively, especially on the weekend. There was a huge mall but we skipped it since shopping in Singapore can be expensive. Our purpose for this trip was to enjoy the local food and sightseeing. The room itself was clean and spacious. We had a king sized bed with comfortable white linen sheets. The outdoor pool was small but enough since we were the only ones there. We booked a day tour from the hotel concierge and it was wonderful. We spent 6 hours driving around Singapore going over the culture, history, and highlights. We stopped over at Chinatown, Little India, and ended at the Orchard Gardens (highly recommend). Overall the experience was good. If I have another chance I would probably visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Staghunt
Reviews.Content: Perfect after 13 hour flight. Big airy lobby, nice rooms, high quality of service. Walkable to Clarke Quay for an evening meal. Can walk to Orchard road but need to be used to the humidity. Swimming pool was never crowded. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably Anonymous”
Reviews.Author: woody2310
Reviews.Content: Why do families choose Holiday Inn ? a. because it’s predictably familiar. b. because it comes equipped with standard features (eg. room size, amenities, etc.), and c. Because they’re comfortably anonymous. At Holiday Inn Atrium, you’ll find all these to be true. However, if you’re looking to actively use the MRT train to travel around the city, strike this hotel out. The nearest train station is a good 10-15 minutes walk. Cabs however, are always available. Coming to the hotel, beds are clean and comfy and the bath is comfortable too. We didn’t take the breakfast option. Just a $ 5 cab ride away takes you to Maxwell Road / Newton Centre offering you the wealth and diversity of this state. What a learning that is. The hotel does feel a bit lonely and desolate though, like it’s past its glory days. If you’re looking for the ‘buzz’ factor, it just isn’t here. The common areas need a makeover pronto. The lobby looks stuck in the early 80s. We had nearly booked the Pan Pacific, but for fellow travellers who selected the same property. From the 26th floor, the city view is a bonus(see pic). Other than that, there was nothing specifically remarkable, other than Mr. Shahir, the ultra helpful and ever smiling Concierge (see pic.). Rating : 5 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few little probs”
Reviews.Author: danzimbo
Reviews.Content: Singapore-ean service never fails to disappoint. The check in was nice and friendly, and complimentary drinks vouchers were given. We were offered a business room on a lower floor, but opted to stay in the family room. The room was wuite big with a big king bed. The bath is not long, so taller people may prefer shower. The age of the hotel is obvious, but is not detracting. The conceirge service was professional and helpful. The distance to attractions / shops should not detract as the price of taxis is very very cheap. The only things I can moan about are that there was a room service tray on our corridor floor which was there nearly 24hrs and still there at check out. Our newspaper didnt arrive on the 3rd morning, and toilet paper wasnt replenished on the 2nd day (we ran out and housekeeping delivered a box of tissues! - lang barrier!!LOL). I have stayed opposite at the Copthorne Waterfront and I have no preference between the 2, although my wife prefers the CW I have no preference. I liked it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a super city!”
Reviews.Author: Glug43
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in a fantastic city. We spent a couple of nights here before getting on a dive boat. This hotel is great. Try to get a room on an upper floor, the views are amazing! Try the pavement restaurants, they look odd to westerners but the tastes are wonderful. Just noticed that every sentence ends in fantastic, wonderful, etc,etc.. And that covers the whole city. I will definatly try to get back here.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koponx
Reviews.Content: This is a very old hotel, although nicely maintained and renovated. Staffs was nice and helpful, breakfast was great, and room was clean, although the bathroom configuration is bit odd. The only problem was the distance to main attraction area , ie. Orchard Road. It's around 30 minutes walk (in the humid heat) to Orchard Rd and 20 minutes to the nearest MRT station. Taxi costs S$5-6 to get to Orchard. You probably can get better and closer hotel and additional small price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fiontra
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Singapore and stay with family and had no idea how expensive the hotels were or how mediocre the quality of many are, surprising as it's so reliant on it's tourist trade. I decided to book at the Atrium because of the value rates and the reviews here on Tripadvisor and wasn't disappointed as the hotel was great. The room we had on the 23rd floor was very clean and well maintained throughout our 7 day stay. The staff were all incredibly friendly and both check in and check out were easy and efficient. Complimentary drinks on arrival and bottled water and newspaper every morning were the added extras. As far as location goes there are plenty of places to eat nearby on Zion Rd or a 10 minute walk to the Great World City Mall. A short taxi ride gets you to Chinatown Point and the Chinatown MRT station - but a word of caution ERP and Peak time surcharges make taxi travel in Singapore now a joke, a SGD$4 taxi ride can be almost double at rush hour! You can walk to the Outram Park MRT which s about 15 minutes away. Take the MRT where ever possible! I'd definitely stay again because of the good value and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Above average Hotel nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Mickytraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Holiday Inn for 2 nights on my way to Bali.Having got off a 12 hour flight from London at 730 am i was wondering whehter i would get an early check in as i turned up at around 9 am and hoped for the best. Being a Priority Club member seemed to do the trick and i was in my room in no time which was a nice touch from Holiday Inn.The hotel has a quite spectacular atrium reception and looks absolutely immaculate.Got to the room and the room size was very good and the room and bathroom was spotless the tv in the room was a good size and had all the channels you could want.The location of the hotel is ok but not spectacular as its a bit out of the way from the centre and walking in Singapore when it is humid is no joke but taxis are plentiful and cheap.Service in the Restaurants and bar in this hotel are very good and as in most hotels in Singapore the do a happy hour from 5PM until 9PM as any other times the drinks are quite expensive otherwise.The hotel was a 15 min walk from Clarke Quay overlooking Singapore River and had plenty of bars and restaurants for all budgets and tastes and was open until the early hours.Overall the hotel was fair value for Singapore but the location was a little out of the way

Reviews.Title: “Super smelly”
Reviews.Author: robbyjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. The hotel rooms are situated in a circular arrangement around a large open space, which is nice because there is a lot of natural light. The good news: Our room on the 11th floor was small, but clean and comfortable. There is a clean and basic gym with a view of the outdoor pool on the 6th floor. The hotel is also 2 blocks away from Great World City shopping mall with a grocery store and varied food options. The bad news: The location is not very convenient to the main shopping areas or public transportation. If you are up to a long walk and don't mind the heat and humidity, you can make it from the hotel to Clarke Quay in about 20 minutes. What really irritated me about this hotel was a strong and unpleasant smell. It was definitely a chemical smell, like a carpet cleaner or air freshener. I thought that perhaps there was a mistake, and we had a smoking room. I called down to the desk to double check, and sure enough we had a non-smoking room. The smell did not go away. I went to sleep and awoke the next morning totally congested with itchy eyes. Apparently I was allergic to the smell. The next day I explained the situation to the front desk, asking we could change rooms. One of the staff accompanied me to my room to check it out. She sniffed around, and quickly explained that this was a room fragrance that the hotel staff routinely sprays after cleaning. She offered to have someone from housekeeping open the locked window, and that she would instruct the staff not to spray the fragrance. After leaving the window completely open for the next few days, the smell subsided but unfortunately, did not really go away. Even though this was a decent hotel, the unpleasant smell is what will linger in my memory!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful little gem”
Reviews.Author: ascorman
Reviews.Content: This delightful little gem of a hotel exceeded my expectations, It's central, Cabs aren't a problem, Near the city center, the price was right. If you are looking for something no frills, clean rooms, ease of checking in and out, this is the hotel for you. A quick review of the room then, like mentioned, it's refurbished, clean, has an LCD tv, great workstation area, and the washrooms are filled with all basic amenities, and best of all good water pressure. Now, for the minor critiques, location wise, there aren't any MRT stations around, but cabs aplenty, The hotel lobby looks dated and doesn't impress. But all in all, good stay, good time

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: garbus222
Reviews.Content: Loved the interior of the hotel (and the elevators ;-). It's a big hotel with the properly working facilities - no surprises here. I'm PriorityClub Platinum member and chose to have 2 award nights at HI Atrium. Because of Platinum card, I had quick and smooth check-in. However, if you are not PriorityClub status member and you happen to arrive at the same time as some organized tour, then the check-in can be a bother. Got a nice room on 18th floor - with a nice view. Room a bit outdated (I don;t know - is it Holiday Inn thing that all their room are nice but not very modern and look like a bit worn out?). Anyway, nice room, good bathroom (but nothing special as well). Didn't stay there much and just hit the streets of Singapore. It's 10-15min walk to the nearest metro (Tiong Bahru). Shopping mall is 5min walking. There is Zouk disco (excellent) in the close neighborhood. Overall - typical Holiday Inn (good, but nothing amazing; maybe apart from lifts ;-).

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover Hotel, No Frills but enjoyed it. GREAT breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Onie13
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here in August 08 with husband and a 14 month baby in a 1 KING BED DELUXE room. We paid $SG 632 for 3 nights - Sat, Sun and Mon nights. Found the cheapest deal by booking on holiday inn website directly. Also got free buffet breakfast daily included which was terrific start to our days, had wide variety and good quality breakfast, both hot food - eggs, bacon, pancakes/crepes made to order, fresh fruit, cheeses and then bread/cereals. The service staff at restuarant were really friendly too Being a holiday inn you know the standard and it met it - would say a 3.5 to 4 star in my opinion, good size room, got a cot for baby, big bed which was comfortable. Clean and good toiletries - red earth. Check in staff helpful and friendly. Was not in centre of town but we walked to new quay area - about 20 min walk - heaps of resturants. Or cabs are so cheap so being out of town isnt that bad as very cheap cab fare to orchard road. We also have to recommend Jumbo seafood for their chilli and black pepper crabs - we went 3 times. We also went to the zoo which was fantastic zoo - about 30 mins away but only a $18 Singaporian cab fare. The Holiday inn was a great spot to base ourselves for 3 nights and had everything we needed including the fantastic free breakfast - oh and one free drink at bar. Another recommendation is next door is some various massage/nail places and i had the best foot massage there and was so cheap!!! Internet available but at a cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlygod
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, I stayed on 24th floor, had a good view. One of the cheapest hotels in Singapore, which is an expensive city. Staff were very very helpful, resolved any issues I had.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: achuthan
Reviews.Content: When we checked in to the HI Atrium, with our daughter and my father in law, it was after a pretty bad flight (4.30 hours through the night with a departure at 00:05 India Time). We were quite frazzled with that - but the check in was fast; much appreciated. Quiet good rooms, (we were in two rooms) near each other on the same floor. Right through the rooms were well appointed and the guest relations was fantastic. Great buffet breakfast! With a hint of Singaporean food as well. Staff took good care of us and the check out 5 days later was quick too. Couple of grouses though - 18 Sing dollars for a wash and dry cycle in a commercial laundromat is way too expensive. And the swimming pool is way too small! Five strokes and you reach the other end!!! Great that the gym is open 24 hours - so should the laundromat! and the pool!!! Very close to Great World City Shopping Mall and the food court there is superb. We just loved the place...and if we travel into Singapore back again, would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special here”
Reviews.Author: Shafort
Reviews.Content: Check-in: It was quick & fast. Room: It had a nice view but besides a lot needs to be improved. It is old & small. Please see the pictures and you will know what I mean. I was not expecting this kind of standards from a Holiday Inn. Service: At the time of check-in, I requested for a newspaper in morning which was promised, but the next day, there was not any delivery. Had to call the front-desk and it took 10 minutes to deliver. Then about 11 am, a maid tried to forcefully open the door despite the fact that she knew that I was inside. I then opened the door and she seems to be apologizing for her mistake (she was not talking in English) and walked-way. Location: If you prefer travelling by taxi then its not too far from the city center. But in case you prefer walking which I like to do, then basically the hotel has nothing to offer nearby. It’s a good 15-20 minutes walk to Orchard Road and other key attractions. In conclusion, I would not prefer to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with superb City view”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 5 nights with my wife as in Singapore for holiday in August. Booked through hotel's website as a Priority member of this hotel chain. Got a good price including a 3 nights "Explore Asia" package with breakfast. First impression when entered this tall building was" what a huge black Tower". It has 27 floors and we've got a nice Deluxe King size bed room on the 26th floor, as I've asked front desk. Check-in was good, but slow delivery on luggage in room, as they stop almost to new customers who checked-in. Room was big enough for us 2 not too big or small, with comfy bed, standard bathroom, TV, A/C, free newspaper every morning and complimentary free bottle of mineral water every day (part of the Priority Member club I guess). City view on Financial District from our room was amazing and we could spend the day watching this. Breakfast buffet was good with large range of stuff (Western and Asian). The only thing is the staff there wasn't so nice and polite and they rush you out if you arrive around 10am as buffet closed at 10.30am. We did not found this so nice and gentle. They could have said this in a different way...I guess they're not too professional... Used pool on the 6th floor which was big enough to swim after a long day out and relax on a sunbed. Also had a drink at the Lobby Bar and they serve good cocktail and Wine, with Big Screen TV and Live Music in the Evening. No MRT station nearby so if you're ready to walk 5-7 mins to Great City World Mall (for shops and very good Food court and free shuttle to Orchard Rd or Chinatown) or take taxi every day, then go for it. Otherwise, choose another hotel downton near Orchard Rd or Clarke Quay f.ex

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: jovanpuyo
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Holiday Inn Atrium was good. The room was clean and relatively spacious. They even added nice details that other hotels didn't include. They have have a number of universal electric plugs near the desk (so you don't need an adapter), a selection of pillows, a supply of complimentary bottled water every day, and probably all the basic toiletries you will need in your stay. The staff is really friendly, courteous and helpful. And there are even convenience stores and service shops located at the ground floor that are independent from the hotel. So what's keeping this from being a great hotel? The location and the food. Being used to staying near the MRT station during my other stays in Singapore, it takes 15 minutes to walk to the one nearest this hotel (Outram Interchange). That's not bad if the weather is cold, but you'll definitely stink after basking under the tropical sun. There are also no nice hawker centers in the area, which is a good place to go if you're craving for something to eat at night. And it being far from the MRT, you're sometimes forced to take the cab to go to the popular eating spots. I availed of the breakfast for an additional price of S$20 per day. It was so-so and mediocre at best. I was expecting the menu on the buffet would be different from the previous day, but they hardly change. The usual hash browns, french toast, bacon, chicken sausages, prawn dumplings, scrambled egg, grilled tomato, cold cuts, omelets, cereal, fruits, breads, yogurts and juices are there every day. Only the day's special changes, which is a big disappointment considering the richness of Singaporean food. So given a choice will I go back to Holiday Inn Atrium? Maybe. But that is if my first choice hotels are already fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skippy085
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, had a king room and a twin room for our teenagers. Staff very freindly and obliging. Very quiet, taxi's easy to get. Buffet breakfast very yummy, lots of variety.Rooms were clean with all amenties. Pool great. Laundry available but quiet costly. Lovely Atrium.Overall will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: edleycabs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel for 2 nights in the middle of July 2008. We had a queen size room on the 20th floor. The room is a classic "cookie cutter" Holiday Inn room - not big, not small and has all the normal toiletries, desk etc. The bed was comfy and water pressure was decent. One small gripe was that the pool closed quite early at 9pm - and it was a nice looking pool! We received one free Priority club drink each (beer, house wine or juice) for use at the lobby bar during our stay. Sadly the lobby bar isnt too flash but I'll suffer while drinking free beer! You also get two bottles of water per day. One other very helpful thing about this hotel was that they two independently owned convenience stores situated just outside the lifts which stock all manner of stuff you might need from beer, water, crisps, condoms, postcards etc. Very helpful if you fancy having a couple of quiet beers in your room while watching the TV. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is probably the hotels biggest problem. Its not close to anything, but not far from anything either. So, you are looking at around a 10-15min to get anywhere. Taxis were easy to get, reasonably cheap so in the end it wasnt a massive problem as we were there only two days. I think if I was staying in Singapore for longer I would look to go for a hotel close to a MRT station or within easy walking distance of Orchard Road. We went for the breakfast option with our room booking which I was glad about as there are few local places nearby. The spread was fine and the coffee was passable. Overall enjoyed staying there and definitely would stay there again if only staying for a weekend. However, if I was staying longer I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value..Especially with Priority Club points”
Reviews.Author: nmrteck
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Hotel for 5 nights from June 6 thru June 11th 2008. I used my Priority Club points for the stay which amounted to 15000 per night. I felt this was a deal as the Holiday Inn Parkview was 25,000 per night and the cash rates were comparable $230-260 per night). Being a Platinum member I received a nice room on the 11th floor, quiet side not facing the busy street.. The Queen bedded room was not enormous but functional for two. We received one free Priority club Drink for use at the bar during our stay. Two bottles of water per day were provided and we used the Minibar fridge to store them. There is a safe in the room. The room was clean and smelled fresh. Good water pressure and plenty of electrical outlets. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My only complaint was the internet was very pricey. The cost was $ 24.99 per day thus we did not use. The location was fairly quiet and was about a 15 minute walk to Clarke Quay and all the dining and clubs as well as the MRT station which we used often. Taxis were reasonable but they have a surcharge at certain times- like Monday thru Friday from 7-9 AM and 4-7 PM. I believe the rate is 50% more at those times. Also there is a surcharge after Midnight. The pool was very nice for a Hotel IMHO. There is a breakfast/lunch /dinner buffet which looked to have an excellent spread but we choose to use our funds at other local establishments due to the pricey nature. Overall enjoyed and definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MrCabinCrew
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Little Hotel. The rooms are Clean and the service Great. The rooms have a very nice smell to them

Reviews.Title: “decent business hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: fatcontroller1999
Reviews.Content: The staff here were very helpful and friendly. Location wise, it could be more central but everything is within 15 minutes by taxi - singapore is so small that location doesn't really matter so much. Rooms were fine and rates reasonable. I had a king on the 7th floor, no complaints - clean, comfortable, in room broadband (Sing$ 28 for 24 hours) only ethernet though wifi worked in lobby area for same code. By the end of our stay we realised that the early evening stream of beautiful girls coming into the hotel was for a club attached to the 5th floor of the hotel - not for more professional reasons... My colleagues and I headed off to malaysia for a couple of days after the business trip. the hotel let us store our big bags free of charge and even let me use the swimming pool shower area on my return.

Reviews.Title: “Liked It!”
Reviews.Author: AJBJDS
Reviews.Content: Deluxe room - Clean, comfortable king bed with good sheets and duvet. Not greatest location, but comfy room, and you can take a shuttle (free but infrequent) or taxi for not too much $$. We opted for this because it was a bit less expensive than many other options. (Since when did Singapore get this expensive for hotels!). Pretty new, and quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Holiday Inn is the Holiday Inn, don't expect more.”
Reviews.Author: jacgui
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at good hotels so maybe we expect a little more. It was clean but jaded, a left over from the 80's. For some reason we ended up paying top price (more than cheaper deals on the internet) and our travel agent was told it was top notch so we were disappointed. If you are expecting the usual Holiday Inn fare then that is what you will get and it's not a bad hotel. It has a nice pool and a good gym. Rooms are clean. If you are looking for that something 'extra' then you won't find it. We had to take a taxi everywhere and the view was of a carpark. If you are only paying S$200 a night then it's a good deal. We weren't so probably that's were our problems started. The air conditioning was noisy but it worked Ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanhalen812
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and this hotel - and generally all within the intercontinental group - did not disappoint. I stayed in a queen sized bed deluxe room. I had requested for a quieter room since this was a working trip, and because of some reivews i had read elsewhere about the live band music floating up to the higher floor rooms and was told "the band doesn't play these few months" - which i interpreted as a tacit admission that they have encountered this complaint a few times before. Overall the staff was helpful but with one blemish - on check in i was told to go to the wrong room and two nights later my keycard was disabled. It was not pleasant coming down 25 stories first after a four hour flight and then after a long day ending around 11 pm. But overall a good experience and i will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Talste
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Atrium for a week in April. We found the staff (reception, room attendants, wait staff, porters, etc) to be friendly, professional & very helpful. Our suite was spacious, well furnished & well maintained. My wedding anniversary happened to fall during our stay at the atrium and I was pleasantly surprised to find hubby had organized with the General Manager a roof top champagne breakfast for 2, the view was fantastic, breakfast was yummy and we had dedicated wait staff to serve us !! Not what you usually expect at a Holiday Inn !!! That night after returning from dinner we came back to discover a rose petal path & floral arrangement on the bed, This was a total surprise to myself & Hubby !!! Food wise the melting pot café has a great variety of local and western cuisines, as does the room service menu and we also had a delicious Chinese meal at the Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant. All up we had a fantastic time at the Atrium and I'm greatly impressed by the managements willingness and versatility with assisting hubby in making our anniversary a memorable one. I would recommend this hotel to any one and will definitely be staying there again on my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Holiday Inn Atrium”
Reviews.Author: powen
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. The room we stayed in was really clean and spacious. (Ladies - the toiletries provided are by Red Earth. Nice little treat!). The service was very good and fast. Rooms come with a "pillow menu" so if you don't like your pillows or would prefer latex, foam, etc due to allergies or personal preference, you can just call up housekeeping to make your request! The only downside is the location but it's manageable enough. It's not within the main shopping belt and the MRT station - around 15 min on foot - is a little far to walk in the hot and humid weather. The hotel provides a shuttle but it's hourly in the morning and once in 2 hours in the afternoons. However, taxis are readily available and run by the meter. During peak hours and past midnight, there are surcharges to the fare. For example, the fare from hotel to Orchard Road is about SGD$5 but during peak hours, it's almost double. Otherwise, we just loved staying there and would definitely consider staying there again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MarlonGobitz
Reviews.Content: Wow - what a great hotel. Besides the remote location, it could easily > be a 5 star hotel - one of the best Holiday Inn hotels I've ever stayed. > > Tip: take the bus (e.g. 51) which takes you right to Bugis > Junctions/City Hall which costs only 90 cts a ride. > > Amazing breakfast - all kinds of hot and cold food, fresh fruits, soya > milk, nice business rooms (received free upgrade as I am Platinum PC) > with flatscreen tv in my room, free daily bottles of water.Nice Pool, > nice Gym (24 hrs). Great Service! Polite employees. > > In the end was very happy with my stay here - believe me, the Swiss > Stamford charges double and you'd even have to pay for the gym! > > One comment maybe: i don't think they change the bed sheets daily - > maybe an idea to put a little sign next to the bed: do you want your > sheets to be changed, yes or no (like other Holiday Inn hotels in > Europe do) > Also, the bathtub is not cleaned daily (i noticed some beard hairs > left to the inner side of the bathtub - i did shave under the shower > the night before and know they must be mine....). > OVeral, i loved this Holiday INN!

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Wheresmypants
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Holiday Inn Atrium at 3.00am after a 5 hour flight from Perth and found the staff alert, helpful and friendly even at that hour. Our baggage was promptly taken from the taxi and whisked up to our room on the 15th floor. Checkin was efficient and painless. We booked through Qantas holidays and so just handed them the e-booking and everything was sorted out promptly. The hotel was still wearing its Chinese New Year decorations which consisted of red lanterns and floral arrangements in the foyer. The inside lobby is quite impressive as you look upwards towards the many tiers of floors. The room itself was spacious with 3 single beds that proved quite firm but the room was spotless. We had a nice big curved window with a vista of down town Singapore. There were tea and coffee making facilities, mini bar and complimentary bottles of water. The TV worked fine and the bathroom was more than adequate with Red Earth toiletries (Shampoo, Conditioner, Moisturiser, Shower Gel). There were complimentary newspapers in the morning outside your room in a nice Holiday Inn branded pouch. Also available were complimentary slippers. The pool area seemed very pleasant although we did not get a chance to swim as we were merely on a 8 hour stopover and spent most of our time sleeping. We did not use any of the breakfast facilities but opted instead taking a 5 minute walk down the road to catch breakfast at a foodhall at Great World City. As you can see on the maps this hotel is not located in the heart of everything but remember its only a short taxi ride away from all that Singapore has to offer. The only thing that slightly bugged me was the refundable $100.00 deposit they take out of your credit card which after currency conversion fees and fluctuations in currencies means you are actually charged for the privellage of letting them keep $100.00 of your money over night. This was annoying as I had already pre-paid my whole booking online months before. All in all a great hotel for a stopover or a short stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality but a bit far from tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: Xavier_uk
Reviews.Content: Stopped over in hotel for 2 nights over the Chinese New Year. Hotel was booked as part of Stopover package. Check in was easy and so was the check out. Room was clean and in good order. The bathroom was also okay with a combined shower and bath. The air-conditioning was efficent. Buffet breakfast was good quality. The downside to this hotel is it location. Although not the worst it is just a bit too far from most of the tourist location. It is a 10 minute walk to China Town and even longer to Orchard Road. I do like walking and exploring places but this hotel is just not close to any of the main places that tourist want to go to. However, taxis are good value and only took 5 minutes to get to all of the main tourist locations.

Reviews.Title: “fine for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: ticky
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 4 days in december 2007 on the way to australia and for 3 days in january 2008 on the way home all the staff were really good and helpful about everything except for the 2 oldest waitress in the breakfast room who seemed to look down on people and seemed to think they should not help one bit but the rooms where clean and ideal for a stopover the pool was always maintained well and really clean plenty of sun loungers and towels the door staff where really helpful about taxis and telling us where to go would not recommend for a long stay but for a 3- 4day stopover it was ideal if you did not want a hotel with alot of rowdy holiday makers it was ideal and the price was good although you need to get a taxi every where or a long walk as the local transport does not come near the hotel but taxis are cheap and there are plenty of them

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but awkward location”
Reviews.Author: Tiramits
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for around 10 days in August 2007. Quite enjoyable with family (including young child). We booked through priceline and bf was not included - big problem as we soon realized. This hotel is located away from the center of the city and there are not many eating places nearby. However, there is a small Indian restaurant just opposite where you get tasty ethnic food all through. Another option is to walk to the Great World City mall, around 10 min walking distance. We started doing this from the second day onwards because eating at the hotel's pricey restaurants all days is just that - pricey! The Chinese restaurant at the hotel is pretty good. Rooms were very nice - well done and very clean. I would definitely recommend the Chinese restaurant at the Four Season's Hotel which was outstanding! The hotel has its own free tansportation but one has to catch the bus at specific times only to go to Orchard road. It is a nice place to walk around with children (but so is the rest of Singapore). Since the hotel is a bit far from the city center, we had to catch taxis (not always easy to do so as we found out especially in peak times) or walk to the Outram park station, around 15 min away - nice walk but problem is that in Singapore, it suddenly rains and you need to duck for cover - so, not totally convenient! In future, I would probably look for a place nearer or in and around Orchard road. Only negative point about this hotel is its odd location but probably that is why the price is a little less compared to the ones located near the city center! One plus point about the hotel is that they have guest laundromat unlike other hotels that charge a hefty sum for doing the laundry! Pool was very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, location not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Mbarrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on our way out to Australia for 1 night and then for 2 further nights on our return. The hotel looks fantastic and the rooms were very comfortable and big enough for the 3 of us. Going out we got 3 single beds, coming back we all had to share the massive bed. We were on a singapore airlines stopover deal which I would recommend as you get your transfers to the hotel and a range of other extras for free. The staff are extremely friendly, but I have to agree with one of the other reviewers about the front desk staff. It took 3 visits to the front desk to arrange a late check out. Once we found a worker that understood what we wanted and the hotel workings ,we just went to him all the time and had no further problems. The hotel is about 10-15 mins walk from chinatown and whilst singapore airlines run a free hop on bus for those on the stopover package, it does only travel one direction and take a while to get where you want. Use the taxis as they are extremely cheap and provide some good travel tips, be aware of those that offer to take you to the cheaper shops as from our experience the taxi driver just seemed to take us to his mates!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - will use again.”
Reviews.Author: Moose-groupie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was everything that I would expect from a Holiday Inn and more. The staff were great, extremely polite and helpful. Breakfast was a great mix of East meets West. The building is certainly different and makes a refreshing change. The room wasn't that big but fine for two people who spent most of the time exploring Singapore. A nice 15 minute along the river to the Clarke Quay, with all it's resturants, bars and entertainment. We also used room service on our first night which was very nice and although a lot more than the food halls around Singapore no more than most resturants. The hotel also allowed us a late check-out as we had an evening flight. We will certainly use this hotel again when we visit Singapore in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times with business and pleasure. Found for a Holiday Inn that it gave excellent service and was well appointed. I have Platnium membership of the Priority club so was well pleased when I got an upgrade plus complimentary drinks tokens for the bar. Rooms good and very clean and a good size. I also like the laundry on the 6th floor beside the pool. For if you want to wash and dry your own clothes. Breakfast has a good spread and plenty of seats and room to move about. The hotel is situated close to Clark Quay only 10 miutes walk and you can walk to Orchard road in 25 minutes. Plus there is a large shopping centre close by and supermarket. Overall the check in staff are very efficent and the hotel is a good price for the service. One of the best Holiday Inns I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal!! Book through Orbitz!!”
Reviews.Author: flintoca
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. We stayed in a king deluxe room on the 26th floor. The room was gorgeous and the bathroom was fairly large. The outside pool was great, and never crowded. The location may seem inconvenient on a map, but not at all! We took a taxi to Sentosa Island for just $9 SNG. And Orchard Road is a 25 minute walk or a $6 taxi ride. Very reasonable. The band in the bar downstairs was really good, and was a nice place to chill out at night. And we highly recommend the nail salon and massage parlors downstairs. Extremely cheap and no reservations needed. I got a manicure, a pedicure, and a 40 minute massage all for $70! Sweet deal. I'd definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent architecture”
Reviews.Author: Gags
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last leg of our honeymoon. As I am also a platinum member of the hotel group, we received an upgrade to a suite on the 19th floor. (I finally managed to get an upgrade which is very rare in other hotels in this group) We loved the the archtecture of this hotel with the 25 storey internal atrium - it feels like a five star hotel, but then it is a Holiday Inn! The suite was great with a proper kingsize bed, separate lounge area, toilet and wetroom with shower and bath. We had great views of half of Singapore. (You will never see more than half due to the circular nature of the building!) Breakfast was included in our rate, which was excellent - all the usual 'full english' and continental items were available. The location is not the best thing about this hotel. They do have a shuttle bus to/from the centre, but this was often late and did not seem to offer a return journey in the evening. Taxis are dirt cheap and probably the best way of getting around as the MRT transport system was confusing along with the deposit you have to pay for a ticket and no all day tourist type tickets available?! As we had a late departure, reception gave us a late checkout until 3pm and then we could use the pool and shower facilities there, whilst waiting to go to the airport. This was fine as towels are supplied along with soap and shampoo. There is a small shopping mall in the basement of the hotel, but this seemed a bit spartan with no proper shops there. Overall this is a very good hotel and we would go back there tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory - pricey breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LottieCardiff
Reviews.Content: in the process of renovation - a little noisy at times but not troublesome if youre out shopping. Clean. Courteous staff. 2 single beds pushed together - comfortable but not a great fan. No complaints - seems pricey to the luxury of malaysia for a quater of the price. Great transport lins to main sites nearby.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trvmos
Reviews.Content: I t was a wonderful hotel,very well organised and in a nice location close to the river.It deserved the money.We would like for sure to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Getting better”
Reviews.Author: Fei-Low
Reviews.Content: I am a regular to the group hotel. This is the 5-6th times i stay in this hotel. I normally alternating this hotel with intercontinental in Bugis junction. I must say the staff is getting better and better. This is a 3*+ star outlet so our expectation is not that high but this trip the staff, especially house keeping has improved significantly compared to the last trip. The toiletries & towels were replemished twice a day, we know cos we bath 2-3 times a day, beds turn down and rooms tidied in the afternoon, this house keeping service puts the hotel firmly in 4 star category just that the property is a bit dated. Our complement to the guy that service 12th floor, very good attitude. Breakfast spread is very good, none of the usual queue at eggs counter, that chaps pace it very well. Other than that the hotel is near Tiong Baru Market (10mins walk) which has one of the best hawker food in S'pore.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Atrium is a very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sabhay
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself and our two grown-up children spent 4 nights in the Holiday Inn Atrium. We found the hotel staff accomodating - we requested an early check-in and got it for both rooms at 8 AM instead of the normal 2 PM check in time. We also requested a late check-out and we got to retain one of the two rooms till 4 PM instead of the normal 12 noon check-out time. Both these gestures were very welcome for us. The hotel is quite clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast is more than adequate and of world standards, I feel. We did not order any room service at all so we cannot comment on that - a number of other people seem to have complained of bad room service in their reviews of the hotel ! The location is not so great - no MRT train station nearby, no shopping nearby so had to go everywhere by taxi. But taxis are fairly cheap and we probably would have spent almost the same amount on the train. No problems with billing. Check-out took less than a few minutes. Our travel agent had made the total payment in advance and there was no hassle about that. All in all, we were quite satisfied with our stay and we would definitely return to this hotel but for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Shocked at great reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Austeyr
Reviews.Content: Well where do I start? We arrived at about 5pm and went straight to our room on the 6th floor. Mind you this was part of the "Singapore Stopover" system. The room was not too bad that was until the wife and I went to bed. Noticing the "couples bed" was two singles pushed together we can say we were confused. We sat down on the beds and started to settle in for the night. My lordy I may aswell have asked to sleep out at the lobby on the concrete steps. This is not a joke. The beds were extremely hard with no spring in them at all. We then ordered room service as we could not be bothered going out to find something, we had just arrived. First time ordering we received 3 dish's. 2 out of the 3 were correct and the other we did not order (a vegetarian pizza that they thought we said vegetarian platter....huh it wasn't even on the menu). With me making a call we were bought the vegetarian pizza (puree tomato base and grilled cheese, took one bite and threw the rest out). Second time we ordered it was also wrong but rather than complain we just sucked it up and left it to the side. We also requested no one enter our room whilst we were out and could they please make our room the next day at approx 10:30am. We asked this as the wife was a little uneasy the first day. We put the "do not disturb" sign out and went out for the day. We got back and the room was the same. We then took the sign off, went out for half hour, got back and they had cleaned it when we specifically asked no one to enter until 10:30am the next morning, not happy. The windows are SCREWED shut and you have to get the assistant manager to arrange for them to be unscrewed and opened. Problem is trying to get a hold of someone who knows what's going on and signing some forms to get it done, A safety aspect that the hotel is good on but it's a bit annoying, especially when they ask for a reason to have them opened. AH it's a SMOKING room and the windows are screwed shut..... right. The "RED EARTH" hygeine products replaced in our room every day was nice. No ATM inside for money and we had to walk across the road in rain to get money, also another down side. I do recommend the BBQ Buffet, garlic prawns which were huge, crab, pork belly, steak with mushroom, etc, etc. All in all we arrived in Phuket stressed,sore from the beds and out of pocket for a dismal hotel. Totally NOT WORTH THE MONEY!! You WILL be disappointed. Spend that little extra and either get a better room or stay in a different hotel. Taxis are cheap, we went EVERYWHERE in them and were some times cheaper and more convenient than a bus. The best thing about this hotel was the Japanese lady down stairs at the Asian Convenience Store, through the glass doors to the right side of the inner hotel. I reccommend ANYONE staying at this hotel go in and see her, lovely lady, very helpful and gives a cool discount if you're nice enough. Contact me if you'd like any more info I'd be more than glad to help.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: SEJBangalore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 3 nights in October and had a very comfortable stay. We had a room with a view of the river, which was nice. The room was rather small - we had an extra bed put in for our daughter, which filled up the little carpet space there is. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly enjoyed the hotel”
Reviews.Author: cosmicpulsar
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were not booked in till 1400hrs on the first day and understood this but we got a taxi from Changi Airport to the hotel, arriving at ten-thirty a.m. and were able to leave our cases with reception. As its quite central we were able to have a walk around and get something to eat. Booked in at 2.00pm showed to our room and the cases followed within minutes. Hotel is 27 levels, we were on the 17th with a great view over part of the city. Plenty of information in the room in booklet form, nicely stocked fridge, satellite telly/radio, complimentary tea/coffee etc which is re-stocked every day. Thankfully all rooms Non-Smoking in the hotel except for two floors and we were well away from them. The room / bathroom was very clean and again well stocked as regards soap, shampoo, towels, face cloths etc. The only dissapointment was that the shower was over the bath and not separate but hey...... Instant hot water every time, no waiting. Staff were very helpful at any time. We stayed for 18 days but only ate in the hotel six/seven times all but one was for breakfast which was Buffet style and very adaquate offering local dishes as well as full English for S$17.00 ( 3 $ to English Pound) We did dinner only once which was a meat and fish BBQ and a good selection of salads, pasta's, various veg and again local dishes. I think that was in the region of S$30.00. The bar on the gound floor was never packed or rowdy and there was live music every night.. All in all it was a very enjoyable stay and would not hesitate to recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bar Music for Everybody”
Reviews.Author: travelboy2000
Reviews.Content: I have been to Singapore several times and have stayed an numerous hotels, always based on the best price for a 4*. This time I got the Holiday Inn. The location isn't as great as the hotels on Orchard (no walking distance to anywhere special), but it is a quick cabdrive to Clarke Quay and there are malls nearby. I didn't mind, as I was there only to work all week. The breakfast at the Melting Pot Cafe can be considered average - there is the full Western and Eastern selection, plenty of fruit, fresh coffee and cappucino (a plus). Lunch Buffet is tedious, because it is the same every day of the week - being there for a seminar a whole week, I had gotten the buffet booked too. After three days I started going to a food court nearby. The health club is very minimal, the pool is fine, clean, simple but in better shape than for example the Hilton on Orchard. Rooms are standard 4*, nothing special, bathrooms are a bit old, but clean and functional, minibar stocked with beer and soft drinks - fine for me. Staff are very friendly and helpful, from the reception to the room maids. There is a sleazy nightclub on 5th floor for the lonely business travelers, but a nice bar in the lobby with very attentive staff. Around 9is until midnight a trio plays awful music, and this is what really bothered me. Even after reaching my room on the 20th floor and closing the door, I could still hear the music loud and clear, as the rooms are all set up around an atrium. Calling the reception solved the problem, but I had to do it every night of the week, which was a real pain in the butt. It constantly made me feel like I had to ask for special favors when all I wanted was to sleep a bit.

Reviews.Title: “recommended value”
Reviews.Author: VerDan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located "nowhere", hard to reach. the nearest mrt station is outram park station, from there you have to take a bus 970 or 35, or if you feel strong enough you can walk quite a disntance. staffs are friendly, the room is okay (deluxe), but it dont have bathtub, the room quite spacious and clean, the lobby and elevator are nice.

Reviews.Title: “four weeks at the atrium”
Reviews.Author: klg239
Reviews.Content: Four weeks into a six week stay at the Atrium and not too many bad words to say. The rooms are starting to show their age however the bathrooms are clean as is the rest of the room. Complimentary bottled water and Red Earth bath products are a nice touch. Service is very good here. Room service or requests from housekeeping turn up in record time. The fastest I have ever experienced. Bar staff are very friendly and knew me by name and drink after the first night. A good location: within walking distance of a nice shopping centre - New World City - that has a good supermarket. There are two Convenience shops and many nail and massage shops within the hotel complex as well. Whilst not the most centrally located hotel, Taxis are so cheap and readily available at the hotel entrance - so travel to other parts of Singapore is a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Good_onya_Mate
Reviews.Content: It was back in 2003 but we really enjoyed it. Close to Orchard road location, quiet hotel. Great looking atrium. Friendly service.It is an Hotel I'd recommned.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: jayIndia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at holiday Inn Atrium for 3 days on our trip in August 07The hotel is quite nice and staff are very helpful..the concierge never tire of answering questions.... Some people have commented on the location but its so easy to get a taxi everywhere and when u're on a holiday, its not everyone that wants to be in the thick of things as in orchard road..e.t.c--infact we found the location to be a plus for us,...it was close to EVERYTHING we needed--church, bicycle rentals,,a nice mall...good hawker center...what more do we need in a location? I specially recommend the old concierge man who welcomes you as you come in..he is a storehouse of knowledge about Singapore..

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, average location”
Reviews.Author: Alena&Steve
Reviews.Content: Some issues with check in when wrong room was given to what we confirmed but this was quickly corrected. Rooms are feeling their age and a little musty. Restaurant is below par compared to other Singapore hotels and location is not ideal, nearest train station is 15min walk although there is bus across the road. The surrounds are fairly quiet and although there are no restaurants close by it is only a $5 taxi fare to the restaurants and city. As it was reasonable price cant complain too loudly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Vikasmakol
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip from Dpauls agent, and the stay in Holiday Inn Economy class rooms was awsome...

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and great hotel but poor location”
Reviews.Author: Vaniessa C
Reviews.Content: this is a really good hotel which won't burn a hole in your pocket.went there out of the blue and once i arrive there i was greeted with friendlt staff.however,there are no bellman to carry your bag for u and you have to carry it up urself =(.however, room was clean,comfortable and cosy.the tv was quite old but there are lots of selection for you from indonesia,malaysia,singapore and some other countries.breakfast was great with many varieties. hotel staff are helpful and honest.i wanted to change some currency at the hotel but the staff told me to change it outside as the hotel itself offer lower rates than outside.was glad with their attitude =). the hotel location was rather dissapointing though..you have to travel to every part of singapore by taxi which is always available at the front door even at 6am and 12am!! i would definately come back to this hotel again due to the hospitality and the price but will definately bring more small change for taxi =(.

Reviews.Title: “Good Chain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmalucy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Booked a superior room and got an upgrade to a deluxe. Complementary bottle of wine in the room was a very nice touch. The room was very comfortable and clean. Staff very helpful and you can use the swimming pool showers once checked out if you need to freshen up before your flight. Location good inbetween orchard road and china town. Robertson Quay very close by has some great places to eat. You can walk into the centre by simply following the river. I would recomend this hotel for anyone stopin over in Sing.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: DNR
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Atrium is a good hotel, and I would certainly stay here again. My room was clean, comfortable and well equipped, the staff was competent and friendly, and the hotel's location perfectly adequate. In-room internet access was very fast and reliable, though no bargain. The buffet restaurant, though, iwasn't up to the same standard as other aspects of the hotel. Although the quality of the food was okay, the food selection was very limited, and lunch and dinner selections very similar.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all.”
Reviews.Author: JJWA
Reviews.Content: We’ve just returned from a very enjoyable stay at the Atrium Hotel. We grabbed some bargain airfares on Tiger Air out of Perth, so went for an extra long week-end (cheaper than flying East in Australia!) I booked a King Deluxe non-smoking room via the hotels web site, and asked for a roll out bed for our daughter. On arrival at 4am (we had paid for that night as didn't fancy sitting in the lobby at that time of the morning with no room available), we found there was no bed for our daughter made up in the room. Too tired to complain we thought we'd deal with it when we got up again later that day. To our surprise, our king bed was so big, we decided not to worry about the roll out bed as it would only clutter up the room. The bed was a little hard at first, but we all found it very comfortable once we got used to it. Plenty of pillows too as we found extra in the wardrobe. The room was pretty typical of Asia. Dark wood, and a little musty on the nose (soon got used to that too) Tea & coffee making facilities were available, and those little long life milks (we bought our own milk once out and about as the small ones were never enough). Fridge was empty, which was great as you can stack it with what ever you like. There was a list of mini bar drinks that are available if you wanted to buy it from the hotel. Also, complimentary bottled water was re-stocked each day. (Singapore tap water is safe to drink - we did and we're still alive!) There were bathrobes & slipper - if you're into that sort of thing. Ours didn't get used at all except for our daughter playing dress-ups. Bathroom was OK. It was clean and well stocked with nice toiletries. Shower in ours was over the bath. It had great water pressure and an adjustable shower head (eg: jet stream) View from our room was not towards the river. We looked over the Furama Hotel, some parkland and highrise housing. (We were on the 17th floor) Breakfast was served each morning, (between 6 and 10.30, I think) on the 4th floor. The choice was very good. The usual western foods like bacon, eggs, sausages, hash browns, tomatoes, etc... Plus a nice selection of local foods, eg: rice, curry, noodles, etc. There was also cereals, pastries, pancakes, a selection of breads, cheeses, cold meats, salads, fruit juices, yoghurts and more. We left there very well fed each morning. We only had to wait one morning for a table, and I think it was only for a few minutes. The hotel was full that week-end as there was some major Singapore horse race on. The pool was on the 6th floor, next to the gym. Pool area was relaxing after being out and about fighting the crowds. There were only about 10 or so sun beds, so if you timed it bad, you missed out. On saying that though, Singapore is not a place people go to lay by a pool, so it was never crowded. Most people would arrive, have a dip and leave. We didn't see any staff at the pool area, but I think there was a phone if you wanted to ring for food or drinks? We took our own drinks when we went for a swim, and saw other's doing it too. Whilst there it was my husbands birthday. After a long day out we arrived back to our room to a lovely surprise of a bottle of wine, chocolates and fruit. It was a very nice thought from the hotel. One night we got in late from a day out, and none of us could be bothered heading out again for dinner. We ordered room service. Prices were expensive compared to what we'd been spending on the streets. (Chicken curry & rice S$15 + + +) Food was tasty though. Location wise, we had no complaints at all. We've been to Singapore on a few occasions and stayed in various areas of the city. We walked along the River & Clarke Quay one day and ended up at Raffles Landing. It was a pleasant, if not warm wander. Like other people have mentioned, taxis are so cheap, it's better to just grab one so you get from A to B with out getting too hot & sticky. We used the MRT once. You pay a price for your ticket, and then when you arrive at your destination, you put your ticket back into the machine for a refund. Great idea as it saves on littering. Close to the hotel there is a petrol station where you can buy drinks and other supplies. Also, about 10 minutes walk up Zion Road; there is a Hawkers Centre (not sure if that's what the locals call them?) Where there's a great selection of local foods at fantastic prices. Most dishes were around the five dollar mark or cheaper. You can even get a large Tiger beer for S$5.00. Just opposite that is a Shopping Mall called Great World City. All in all, we found no fault at all with the hotel. Staff members were all very efficient and polite. We even requested a late check out with no problems at all. If you want a mid range hotel, and don’t fancy paying top dollar, you can’t go wrong with staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive atrium”
Reviews.Author: luke.traveller
Reviews.Content: The atrium is absolutely stunning! We were very pleased with this hotel. The room was available for check-in at noon, desired room type, the room itself was very nice, nothing at all to complain. Fridge was empty, which is fine, we like to put in our own drinks. Very good breakfast, but very busy, we had to wait 2 minutes or so till a table was ready for us. We liked the pool area, however on our first attempt we could not find the towels, as the pool area is unattended and towels are somewhat hidden. Very nice walk along the river to the centre of Singapore. A bit hot during the day... but very nice in the evening with plenty of nice (expensive!!!!) riverfront restaurants for dinner. We used taxis a lot, they are very cheap, will cost around 5 SGD to the centre. The only thing I have to complain about is the price of the internet: they wanted 15 SGD for half an hour. An absolute rip-off. Also, the self-service laundry is not cheap, with a price of 9 SGD for washing and another 9 SGD for drying. But, it was very convenient for us that this option is available at all, not common in Asia. And: you need 18 1-SGD-coins for this! The laundry room is next to the pool area. Overall, a very pleasant place, if you don't mind to take a taxi once in a while, in return for a nice hotel with affordable rates.

Reviews.Title: “gym is OK”
Reviews.Author: vaxx
Reviews.Content: The gym is a bit small but adequate for a basic workout. There are 4 running/skiing machines, a set of free weights (heaviest is about 50lbs) and a 4 sided weights station (chest press, lateral pull down, leg extension and bicep curl). it would be a bit poky if more than 3 people are using the place at one, but otherwise its clean and bright - it looks out onto the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Atrium Holiday Inn - value for money if you can stand the Muzak”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times. Relatively good value for money in Singapore. Staff is friendly and efficient. The hotel, with its dramatic atrium architecture, is not located within easy walking distance to major shopping areas etc. Prepare to use taxi a lot. Rooms are basic but clean and comfortable. High charges for in-room Internet, SGD 28 per day! Lobby bar is poky and depressing and often has substandard band playing. It is to be avoided at all costs. But top wine bar/disco Zouk is less than 10 minutes walk away (recommended). Overall music selection in the hotel´s public areas is abysmal: cheesy and nauseating cover songs and Kenny G-type tunes are piped into restaurants and other areas and threatens to ruin your breakfast. Foodwise, hotel restaurants are ok, buffet breakfasts are satisfying. A couple of neighbourhood restaurants in housing complex across the street serve cheap and tasty food to the locals and to occasional hotel escapees. Hotel pool is small but nice, however gym is tiny, stuffy and in need of updating. Have experienced errors several times upon checkout. Last time I had been charged for three breakfasts (at SGD 18 each) even though they were supposed to be included in my rate according to my booking confirmation. Worse, I had been charged full rate for the 4th night of my stay even though it was supposed to be free, according to the package I had booked. The checkout person removed the incorrect items but did not once apologize for all these errors. So one has to check statement carefully before paying.

Reviews.Title: “Should Only Get 3 Stars”
Reviews.Author: travelman001
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Conrad or Pan Pacific. However, as those hotels were booked (at least at the cheaper rates), I chose this one. Big mistake. This hotel is rated 4 stars.
