I must disagree with that. The hotel only deserves 3 stars. It's a big old hotel that is in dire need of a renovation. The check-in staff was friendly and efficient. The room was small and not superbly clean as I would have expected. The bathroom was not clean. The shower curtain smelled. The bed was comfortable. The duvet was clean. The pillows were old and did not smell fresh. The towels were worn thin. The room window curtains were worn and dusty. The air conditioner only had one speed - high. However, I had to keep the A/C on as I did not want to sweat. There was nothing within a reasonable walking distance to anywhere. I had to rely on taxis to get anywhere in Singapore. The breakfast buffet was something like 11.99 SGD. As I only have bread and coffee for breakfast, I ordered that a la carte. My breakfast bill was a little over 11 SGD! The pool area seemed ok. The gym was small and did not smell fresh. Overall I was not too pleased with this hotel. I would only recommend it so someone on a tight budget. It is NOT 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “loved it...”
Reviews.Author: psychodoc
Reviews.Content: hi... i stayed here in may 2005 for 4 nights with my family ... wife and naughty 2 yr old twins.... i have to say that i had no problems.... except that the room service was a wee bit tardy... the rest was fine... and we had a real great time !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, astonishing architecture!”
Reviews.Author: markhifly
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 night at the Atrium in August 2006, nice experience, beautiful hotel. The atrium lobby is spectacular!!!! Had a superior room at the 14th floor, nice spacious room, clean, full service. Staff was quite polite and friendly. The only bad comment is its location. there is no MRT near the hotel, you have to walk 10 min. or take a taxi for a few dollars. Overall I had a very enjoyable stay here, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what people are complaining about!”
Reviews.Author: Nev.w
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Australia stopping off in Singapore for 4 nights on our way home. We chanced our luck with Priceline and ended up with the Holiday Inn Atrium. As some may know, when you book through Priceline you are not guaranteed the best room, far from it on some occasions. We arrived at the hotel fairly late in the evening and asked for a non smoking room fairly high up to enjoy the views. The girl at reception could not have been more accomodating and gave us a room on the 19th floor. The room itself was failrly large with a huge bed and fantastic air con. There was no noise as some have mentioned, despite there being a live trio of musicians in the bar until midnight. We did not eat in the hotel as we wanted to sample as many of the eating establishments as we could in Singapore. The only fault, and a minor one at that is the location. Singapore is not that big but it is very warm and humid so walking any distance can be a bit uncomfortable. The answer to this is taxis which are always on hand outside the hotel. They cost so little so we used them regularly. Final word on the staff at the hotel. Each and every one of them did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable. They were all very helpful and always had a smile on their face. On checking out we overheard an American businessman asking to see the manager. This was not to complain but to compliment the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Southamerican23
Reviews.Content: I´ve got nothing to complain about with this hotel. Maybe you´d say I have low standards taking into consideration I´m a 20 year old and was traveling along with 9 other people pretty much the same age as me; but I have to say, I´ve stayed in some great hotels, and we could compare since we were coming from a long trip passing by Beijing, Shanghai, Hong Kong and Bangkok, and this hotel is good. I was in the 8th floor. Upon arriving, they said they didnt have the two bed room so they gave us a three bed room although we were only 2 in the room. Didnt ever hear a slight noise from the evening live band that some other reviewers seem to complain about. Yes internet and groceries are a bit pricey but what can you expect? thats a first world country!! Im from venezuela and boy, I just think people tend to take things for granted. Oh, the breakfast!! Wow... I´ve gotta say that it was the best I had in all the cities I mentioned before, veeery wide selection, and they even had a menu for other religions that couldnt eat whats in a regular american breakfast. Public transport is not right at the door but a if you walk for less than 5 mins, itll do the job. But still taking the cab isnt too bad, it isnt that pricey. The room was always clean and tidy, the staff was great... so... as I said before... nothing to complain about!! After all a hotel is just to get there and sleep... you wouldnt waste that air ticket price to stay in the hotel! unless in this one you would be just fine... if anyone wants any suggestions just emails me at zenith_023@hotmail.com... and enjoy your stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: michael999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atrium in July; a very disappointing experience. Poor service, lost reservations, a ceiling leak in our room that flooded the room and our belongings, indifferent and incompetent staff, dirty and degraded facilities. Not worth the money or frustration to deal with it, there are much better values in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MazDub
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend just stood in awe when we walked into this hotel. The lobby is amazing, with glass lifts. We stayed here for 3 nights and had a nice room with fantastic views. Buffet breakfast was great too, with loads of choice. I would delinately recommend this hotel. The only bad thing was that it wasnt very close to public transport which meant paying for taxis(when we were lazy!)

Reviews.Title: “A high quality and reliable hotel”
Reviews.Author: walana
Reviews.Content: There are so many options in Singapore and I ended up choosing the Atrium, and was glad I did. I found the service to be of a very high standard, such as concierge and restaurant staff, and the breakfasts were the best I've ever had, the variety of foods was amazing!!! The rooms were quite large, standard furnishings, but clean and very suitable. Most places were quite close by taxi from the hotel, but it is a bit of a walk to public transport if you prefer this option. It was very easy to organise tours and get tourist information from their tourist desk. Convenient that there is an Internet cafe and shop in the hotel lobby but these are a bit pricey. Overall I had a very enjoyable stay here, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Small and standard”
Reviews.Author: Lallitha
Reviews.Content: Here is the latest bit on the Holiday inn Atrium where we, my husband, our two year old son and me stayed from April 26-30, 2006. It was quite a comfortable stay for us. Having got a room on the 26th floor (of the 27 floors), the view was quite beautiful, especially when you open the curtains to see Singapore at night. The minute you give the hotel's address to the taxi drivers, you would be asked whether it is 'Old Glass hotel', or 'The concorde hotel' etc. That's because these were the old names of the current Atrium. The outside glass panels sporting a brown-black colour does look a little old, but the inside makes up for it with its beautiful trasparent lifts, which is even more beautiful in the night when it is fully lighted up. Although we had asked for a superior room with king sized bed, one was not available when we arrived at the hotel. But they made arrangements for us to get our preferred room soon and in the meantime accomodated us into another room. The room sizes are small and compact, even in the executive suites, where we stayed. The executive room comes with a mini bar/fridge, iron board and iron, and a safe. Service is quite quick and decent, whether it was food we ordered, or the bell service or when we wanted an international three pin plug, one was provided within 5 minutes, of course a fee of Sg $ 5 was charged. Daily housekeeping replenishes sheets, towels and tea and coffee for use. Morning breakfast was quite a standard affair, with a good mix of continental and Chinese. The shopping arcade on the ground floor takes care of all basic needs. If you want to try the reflexology foot massage that's available down in the shopping arcade, please take care to mention whether you would prefer hard or soft massage. (A note of caution: the hard masssage is quite painful, although in retrospect no visible damage is seen.:-)) All in all the hotel was a comfortable stay for us. No noise, no complaints, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff....”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer_uk2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed 15/03/06 thru 18/03/06. Well situated hotel in the heart of the city, just a short distance from Orchard Rd. Dispite earlier negative reviews, we found this hotel to be of a high standard, front desk and concierge staff always friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good (inc in room rate) and plentiful. Lobby area impressive with a view to the very top floors, and glass lifts to all floors.
